#branding --> 	</div><!-- #header -->  	<div id="content-box">  <div id="content-container"> 	<div id="content" role="main">  	 		<div id="nav-above" class="navigation"> 			<div class="nav-previous"><a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/01/26/going-clear-the-documentary/" rel="prev"><span class="meta-nav">&larr;</span> Going Clear, the&nbsp;documentary</a></div> 			<div class="nav-next"><a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/23/scientology-and-the-french-resistance/" rel="next">Scientology and the French&nbsp;Resistance <span class="meta-nav">&rarr;</span></a></div> 		</div><!-- #nav-above -->  		<div id="post-11823" class="post-11823 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized tag-mark-rathbun tag-alex-gibney tag-david-miscavige tag-dianetics tag-farsec tag-john-travolta tag-kirstie-alley tag-l-ron-hubbard tag-lawrence-wright tag-leah-remini tag-marty-rathbun tag-prison-of-belief tag-psychiatry tag-psycho-analysis tag-psycho-therapy tag-psychology tag-scientology tag-tom-cruise tag-xenu">  			 			<h1 class="entry-title">Scientology Beliefs (revised)</h1> 							<div class="entry-meta"> 					<span class="meta-prep meta-prep-author">Posted on</span> <a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/" title="9:56 am" rel="bookmark"><span class="entry-date">February 3, 2015</span></a> <span class="by-author"><span class="sep">by</span> <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/author/martyrathbun09/" title="View all posts by Mark C. Rathbun" rel="author">Mark C. Rathbun</a></span> </span><span class="comments-link"><span class="meta-sep">|</span> <a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comments">1,015 Comments</a></span> 									</div><!-- .entry-meta --> 			 			<div class="entry-content"> 				<p>In plain English, here are scientology&#8217;s core religious beliefs.</p> <ol> <li>Scientology’s sophisticated mix of pop psychology and hypnotism are firmly believed to be the only workable ‘technology’ for curing mental issues, neurosis, psychosis, physical disease, increasing awareness and intelligence, and for creating OT’s (operating thetans, L. Ron Hubbard’s version of Nietzsche’s superman or Aleister Crowley’s magician).<em>Note:  Scientology is at first presented in secular, scientific terms promising and then false reporting 100% workability.  In fact scientology never achieved even the scientifically recognized 20 to 30 percent placebo effect in terms of long-term satisfaction.  In order to explain away that discrepancy the less-than-placebo percentage who stick with it are led to adopt the remaining listed beliefs.  The ‘technology’ evolved being carefully designed and administered so as to lead scientologists to wholeheartedly accept and live according to these beliefs.</em></li> </ol> <p>2.  Planet Earth is a prison. The vast majority of human beings &#8211; and billions of             invisible other beings &#8211; are its inmates.</p> <p>3.  Xenu is the name of scientology’s Satan who established Earth as                                  a <span style="color:#444444;line-height:1.7;">prison and transported billions of beings to serve as its inmates.</span></p> <p>4.  Our continued imprisonment is assured by ‘psychs.’ ‘Psychs’ are                                    defined as psychiatrists, psychologists, psycho-therapists, priests,                                ministers, and anyone else practicing in the field of the mind and                                  spirit.  Psychs were sent here from a planet called ‘Farsec.’  They are a                        special breed of being created and invested with the sole purpose of                            keeping humankind mentally imprisoned.</p> <p>5.  Ron Hubbard is the first to discover the above ‘truths’, and the only                             one to have devised a means of escaping the prison planet.</p> <p>6.  Navigation through the only hole in the wall consists of closely                                        emulating Hubbard and behaving as he did when he lived.</p> <p>7.  Enemies, including psychs as well as anyone expressing any doubt or                           reservation about these beliefs, must be destroyed by any means                                  necessary by scientologists. Such means include lying, suing, cheating,                        harassing, intimidating, blackmailing, smearing and by physical                                      violence.</p> <p>8. When a scientologist has expended all of his best efforts in the vain                             pursuit of these beliefs he is expected to ‘discard’ his body so that he                           may continue to pursue them without such a physical ‘impediment’.</p> <p>Whether the ultimate belief, number 8 above, constitutes suicide is a wholly subjective question of religious belief.</p> <div Rathbun'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Memoirs of a Scientology Warrior, Amazon Books 2012</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329374"> 		<div id="comment-329374"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/2f53f0df2fcbd572e44bd7777a92a120?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/toomajanlarry' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Lawrence</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329374"> 				February 4, 2015 at 2:34 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329374#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329374", "329374", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Lawrence'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Marty, the vast majority of what you write fascinates me.</p> <p>In the very near future it seems there will be nothing confidential at all regarding anything that constitutes the Church of Scientology&#8217;s disseminatable religious beliefs. A church and it&#8217;s congregation with such religious beliefs, if they mean not to harm anyone then they should never make a gesture as though they mean to harm anyone. Misunderstood? Hardly. In the end the Church of Scientology gets what is deserves. Making believe they are trying to set Mankind free while making a joke out of us. Look who the laugh is really on! <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-smile' title=':)'>:)</span></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329428"> 		<div id="comment-329428"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://i2.wp.com/graph.facebook.com/v2.2/100001480061156/picture?q=type%3Dlarge&#038;resize=48%2C48' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.facebook.com/100001480061156' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Harle Quin</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329428"> 				February 5, 2015 at 12:53 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329428#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329428", "329428", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Harle Quin'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I must say Marty, I am glad you are continuing to have realizations about LRH and scientology. He/She&#8217;s simply stating what to many of us is the obvious: LRH was a fraud, the &#8220;tech&#8221; is a scam. I agree, you don&#8217;t. That discounts neither one of us. In fact, it would seem  to me that you exercise as much judgment on Starship as he/she does on indies.<br /> Whether one hold&#8217;s Starship&#8217;s view or not, we are all capable of justifying many &#8220;justifiable crimes,&#8221; as the term implies.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330291"> 		<div id="comment-330291"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/6a992ac788eab4b8b7c88d9c086aae4a?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">FOTF2012</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330291"> 				February 18, 2015 at 12:20 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330291#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330291", "330291", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to FOTF2012'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I agree, Todd. There are multiple factual points where Ron was dishonest and/or fraudulent. There are zero objective, scientific validations of the results of Dianetics or Scientology. There is not a single proven clear or OT as originally defined by Ron, not one after six decades of opportunity.</p> <p>Pointing this brutal truth out does not demean others. Rather it provides a necessary wake up call to our fellow human beings.</p> <p>That&#8217;s not to say that Scientology cannot lead to many realizations and insights. I think it can and does. Unfortunately, it also leads to delusion and the totalitarian stifling of free thought.</p> <p>Where Scientology ultimately sinks itself is that it makes both religious and scientific claims. Scientific claims are falsifiable in any number of ways. Religious claims are not.</p> <p>Most religions keep themselves off the hook by limiting their ultimate claims to an unfalsifiable afterlife. Their current life claims are typically very subjective and debatable. They often include claims like being a better person, being happier, feeling in touch with God, and so on.</p> <p>While Scientology also claims betterment of one&#8217;s internal state, and makes claims of a better afterlife or afterlives, it unfortunately also makes a slew of easily falsifiable current life claims. </p> <p>These include, but are not limited to things like: increased IQ, freedom from psychosomatic disease, better eyesight, better health overall, immunity from lung cancer caused by smoking, becoming radiation proof, drug treatment programs with 70 to 80% effectiveness, the ability to the exteriorise from one&#8217;s body at will and do so with full perceptics, past life recall, ability to change the world through postulates, super powers, perfect recall, longer lifespans, greater wealth, greater creativity, the ability to control MEST both objectively and subjectively as well as the ability to control life and thought. And so many more implicit and explicit claims, most or all of which could be verified through objective research if they were real.</p> <p>While there are nuggets along the road, Scientology&#8217;s promised gold mine never quite materializes. The bridge becomes a circle, a hamster wheel. Escherlike, the lizard of the organization circles back on its own tail (and tale), and begins to cannibalize itself. The lack of the ultimate results is hidden behind unfalsifiable gnosticism. The attention of the faithful is misdirected to supposed enemies and false causes as to why the results are never achieved. The hopes of the faithful slowly turn to self betrayal in stubborn persistence of belief.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov even depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330314"> 		<div id="comment-330314"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/742817c1603c6e5f9f5086f4763a57b5?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://valkovuddin.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>iamvalkov</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330314"> 				February 19, 2015 at 2:36 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330314#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330314", "330314", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to iamvalkov'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I&#8217;m not disagreeing ,  but I feel many if not most of the &#8220;objective&#8221; claims have not been systematically tested.  I&#8217;m not sure they ever could be,  because of &#8220;operator interference&#8221; type of factors,  as well as theindividual differences,  person to person.   IQ is measurable, reaction time and speed of perception, those kind of things could be measured,  but the studies themselves would be enormously time-consuming for everyone involved. Given the lack of standardization of scientology methods,  how would anyone study it at all?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser context and that all inconsistencies within that context have been satisfactorily resolved.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-8 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330372"> 		<div id="comment-330372"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/e71aecf18b4c7dd40c5c06bc57f15196?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Todd Cray</cite>  			<span class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330372#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330372", "330372", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Todd Cray'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>It seems to me that anybody whose claims have a &#8220;scientific&#8221; nature finds themselves saddled with the burden of proof before they even deserve serious consideration by others (such as peer studies). LRH tried to do that once (the &#8220;first clear&#8221;)&#8211;with devastatingly telling results. That was the end of that, although not the end of his &#8220;scientific&#8221; claims.<br /> &#8220;Science&#8221; is also a bit of an Achilles heel to the &#8220;church.&#8221; By definition, science is not only verifiable but also repeatable. To use a simple example, if I drop an apple the result has to be the same as you dropping one. Otherwise, gravity is not really a scientific principle but strictly a matter of &#8220;personal experience&#8221;&#8211;an experience that only one or some (not all) may share. In that way, &#8220;science&#8221; (if it could be demonstrated in the &#8220;tech&#8221;) undermines the &#8220;church&#8221; monopoly on effecting and experiencing the alleged &#8220;wins&#8221; through its &#8220;tech.&#8221;</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330399"> 		<div id="comment-330399"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330399"> 				February 20, 2015 at 12:48 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330399#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330399", "330399", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p><i>Todd: &#8220;It seems to me that anybody whose claims have a “scientific” nature finds themselves saddled with the burden of proof before they even deserve serious consideration by others&#8230;&#8221;</i></p> <p>The first line of proof is that there are no flagrant and rather obvious inconsistencies. This level of proof is rather easy to attain and to qualify for peer review. It seems that LRH couldn&#8217;t even get past this initial level.</p> <p>This shows his failure to mass hypnotize wogs. He then had to put together a gradient of hypnotism. He called this system of gradients a &#8220;Scientology Org.&#8221;</p> <p>.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-8 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330464"> 		<div id="comment-330464"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/6a992ac788eab4b8b7c88d9c086aae4a?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">FOTF2012</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330464"> 				February 21, 2015 at 3:21 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330464#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330464", "330464", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to FOTF2012'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I agree &#8212; good points.</p> <p>Let me pose this as a challenge (to the church). Let&#8217;s take IQ claims. Ron said IQ definitely goes up with hours of auditing. There are standardized, non-Scientology tests to measure IQ. A comprehensive test can take several hours and cost some money to administer. And the church reportedly has billions of dollars at its disposal.</p> <p>The church has made a claim about to IQ through its &#8220;scripture&#8221; and therefore the onus is on the church to prove its claim (that is just how burden of proof works). It has the resources and the self interest to prove its claim. The church could easily set up a program where a standard IQ test is given by external experts before auditing and then at one or more points in time as auditing progressed.</p> <p>Without getting into supernatural powers, metaphysical knowledge, past life recall, testing IQ improvement would be a pretty straightforward and standard way of validating or falsifying this particular claim.</p> <p>If the church and its believers are positive that the words of Hubbard are infallible scripture, why would it hesitate to do such testing? It has plenty of money to fund such a project. And every self interest in doing so. In fact, if the claims proved to be true that would spur worldwide positive interest in the church and its teachings. So not performing such research could be argued to be an overt of omission.</p> <p>As I reflect on this it strikes me that Miscavige&#8217;s focus on MEST acquisition could be taken as the signal that he himself does not believe in the ultimate claims of Scientology &#8212; or even some of the more pedestrian claims. Therefore he would rather buy impressive buildings than perform research that would pull the rug out from under his own feet.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329519"> 		<div id="comment-329519"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/ecd994d7f918147adaa53571480babdb?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://deleted' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Brian</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329519"> 				February 5, 2015 at 3:04 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329519#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329519", "329519", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Brian'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Sign me up. You are who I&#8217;ve thought you were.</p> <p>Namaste and Thank thank thank yooooouu <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-smile' title=':-)'>:-)</span><br /> Brian</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330012"> 		<div id="comment-330012"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/e51eb072efb50327f9e46bb8bc0c4f29?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Cooper Kessel</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330012"> 				February 11, 2015 at 2:48 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330012#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330012", "330012", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Cooper Kessel'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Me too!!! class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330414"> 		<div id="comment-330414"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/a1049d2528a46f6bd92dca4577fd768f?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.unicef.org/' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Cat Daddy</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330414"> 				February 20, 2015 at 4:18 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330414#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330414", "330414", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Cat Daddy'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Sorry that ment to be a comment to another comment. But since I am here</p> <p><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Affirmations_%28L._Ron_Hubbard%29" rel="nofollow">http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Affirmations_%28L._Ron_Hubbard%29</a>:</p> <p>Excerpt:</p> <p>he &#8220;Affirmations&#8221; (also referred to as the &#8220;Admissions&#8221;) are a work said to have been written by L. Ron Hubbard in the late 1940s, a few years before he established Dianetics (1950) or Scientology (1952). They consist of a series of statements by and addressed to Hubbard, relating to various physical, sexual, psychological and social issues that he was encountering in his life. After the Affirmations became public knowledge in 1984 the Church of Scientology has disputed their authenticity, though in legal papers it has described the Affirmations as having been &#8220;written by&#8221; Hubbard and sought to retain ownership of them. The Affirmations appear to have been intended to be used as a form of self-hypnosis with the intention of resolving the author&#8217;s psychological problems and instilling a positive mental attitude. They are closely linked to the occult philosophy of Thelema, devised by Aleister Crowley in the early 20th century, in which Hubbard participated for a while during 1945–46. In her book Inside Scientology: The Story of America&#8217;s Most Secretive Religion, Janet Reitman calls the Affirmations &#8220;the most revealing psychological self-assessment, complete with exhortations to himself, that [Hubbard] had ever made.&#8221;[1]</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329197"> 		<div id="comment-329197"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>It comes from the belief that accompanied the explanation of Hubbard&#8217;s death.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329213"> 		<div id="comment-329213"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/6b29024f3651a80b7a5aecbfa60b27ed?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Rachael Ramona</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329213"> 				February 3, 2015 at 12:28 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329213#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329213", "329213", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Rachael Ramona'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>It&#8217;s not that every Scientologist has been instructed in writing to discard their body per se. It&#8217;s that all Scientologists are indoctrinated to do exactly as Ron did. And the public PR line is that once Ron got to the point where he could no longer conduct OT research because his body was a hindrance, he &#8220;discarded the body&#8221;. </p> <p>Of course, public Scientologists believe they are still about a dozen unreleased OT levels away from this being an issue. </p> <p>But the fact is, they all believe LRH just &#8220;discarded the body&#8221; because he could not move any further up the ladder of OT unless he did so and Scientologists are totally cool with this. </p> <p>So this idea of &#8220;I&#8217;m just going to get rid of my body now, because I&#8217;ve done everything I can do in Scientology with it&#8221; is absolutely something Scientologists embrace, even though none of them have had to cross that bridge (pardon the pun) yet.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329241"> 		<div id="comment-329241"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329241"> 				February 3, 2015 at 2:06 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329241#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329241", "329241", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>It&#8217;s a leap in logic to say that because LRH &#8220;discarded the body&#8221; in order to do further research (according to those who made the announcement) that all scientologists are supposed to do so. I never heard a single scientologist express that idea. It would be more consistent for them to think that LRH is the only one who does research.</p> <p>This is a typical stretch that causes many critics to lose credibility.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329276"> 		<div id="comment-329276"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/c1b1d7db0f52bb43958512a6fd5ade03?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">sara</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329276"> 				February 3, 2015 at 5:24 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329276#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329276", "329276", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to sara'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Well, when I was on Flag (a long time ago) I overheard a couple of advanced Scientologists talking about &#8216;discarding&#8217; their body because they were out of the &#8216;circle of life&#8217;. They decided to stay on a bit longer &#8230;</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329304"> 		<div id="comment-329304"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://i2.wp.com/graph.facebook.com/v2.2/100001480061156/picture?q=type%3Dlarge%26_md5%3Df4adb5f9ac730685476ddaa63da3dce7&#038;resize=48%2C48' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.facebook.com/100001480061156' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Harle Quin</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329304"> 				February 3, 2015 at 10:00 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329304#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329304", "329304", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Harle Quin'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Actually, if you watch the LRH death announcement video again, you will hear Pat Broeker clearly state that anyone could now go into Flag to run the E.O.C (end of cycle) L Ron has just completed.</p> <p>This is what Pat said;<br /> &#8220;We also by the way have the OT level that is goint to be done (very long pause) immediately after every thetan discards his or her body. He wrote that up before he went (applause) now this&#8230;don&#8217;t take this as an invitation, because you don&#8217;t get it until youre through the OT level before it.</p> <p>But know, that, when it&#8217;s time, the tech is there so you&#8217;re not left with what to do now or even having to figure it out for yourself. It&#8217;s there we&#8217;re er that will be written up right away, coz we have that, word for word and it&#8217;ll be archived and made safe and it will be eventually available at Flag and other AO&#8217;s and people will be allowed to come into AOLA, before they discard it, read the materials, check out on them, do wordclear, demo (mumbling in crowd cause laughter)&#8230;So you know. Now you know it. Now you&#8217;re ready for when it happens.&#8221;</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329695"> 		<div id="comment-329695"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329695"> 				February 7, 2015 at 3:53 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329695#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329695", "329695", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Harle Quin, quoting Broeker: “We also by the way have the OT level that is going to be done (very long pause) immediately after every thetan discards his or her body. He wrote that up before he went (applause) now this…don’t take this as an invitation, because you don’t get it until youre through the OT level before it.&#8221;</p> <p>The above statement only says there&#8217;s an OT level &#8220;to be done&#8230;immediately after the thetan discards his or her body.&#8221; There isn&#8217;t anything in that statement that suggests suicide, as it doesn&#8217;t indicate in any way that the thetan &#8220;discards&#8221; (or &#8220;drops&#8221;)  the body IN ORDER TO DO THE OT LEVEL.  </p> <p>In fact, Broeker then says &#8220;don&#8217;t take this as an invitation, because you don&#8217;t get it until you&#8217;re through the OT level before it &#8211; which, to me, simply means that when you die &#8211; which eventually everyone  will do &#8211; if you&#8217;ve done OT levels up to the particular OT level that is (supposedly) to be done after you die, then you would be ready to do that one. </p> <p>Not that it really matters what those speakers stated, as their words aren&#8217;t based on anything Hubbard ever wrote, and they are known to be liars.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329696"> 		<div id="comment-329696"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329696"> 				February 7, 2015 at 3:58 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329696#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329696", "329696", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I inadvertently left out the closing quotation marks in the second to last paragraph. It should read:</p> <p>In fact, Broeker then says “don’t take this as an invitation, because you don’t get it until you’re through the OT level before it &#8221; &#8211; which, to me, simply means that when you die (which eventually everyone will do, obviously)  if you’ve done OT levels up to the particular OT level that is (supposedly) to be done after you die, then you would be ready to do that one.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330013"> 		<div id="comment-330013"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/e51eb072efb50327f9e46bb8bc0c4f29?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Cooper Kessel</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330013"> 				February 11, 2015 at 2:51 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330013#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330013", "330013", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Cooper Kessel'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Pull your head out Miraldi. As such, the dictum applies that it is impossible to hold logical discourse about it. Put another way, regardless of where you stand on the issue, cognitive dissonance is inevitable.<br /> First off, there is absolutely no evidence that the OT levels that Broeker proclaimed even exist. The evidence suggests that they do NOT.<br /> But more importantly, Broeker suggested that LRH conducted &#8220;research&#8221; (and left it behind) about the body-discarded state while LRH had clearly NOT (yet anyway) &#8220;discarded&#8221; his own body! How is one to reconcile this absurdity.<br /> Then again, maybe it was the Vistaril that was doing the talking?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-martyrathbun09 comment-author-is-site-member bypostauthor odd alt depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330268"> 		<div id="comment-330268"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/c2d94d163a566268e73c8b0195b6c03a?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Mark C. How is it amazing to find people who make their decisions or view the world based on it? It wasn&#8217;t too long ago that Christendom made many intersocial decisions based on the concept of Original Sin. The theta-MEST theory, if I am correct, is a fundamental pillar of the concept of one&#8217;s own godhood (source of and thus cause over MEST). Until one no longer needs to be god, one will look to confirm that one is, indeed, godlike.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329468"> 		<div id="comment-329468"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329468"> 				February 5, 2015 at 8:41 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329468#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329468", "329468", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Well said! As science learns more and more about the nature of consciousness, such a duality seems less and less likely to capture the incredible nature of existence and consciousness.</p> <p>Scientologists in general are taught that dying is a causative act. You don&#8217;t die. You _drop_ your body. This is seen as not being a big deal. After all, you are an immortal being. And any grief felt by your survivors it is simply a secondary that can be handled as part of their own case. Therefore, dropping your body is not an overt against your first dynamic or other dynamics if you make an EOC decision for ethical reasons.</p> <p>Of course such details are never discussed or debated within Scientology because of the lack of free speech, the stifling of analytical reasoning, the absence of critical thought, and prohibitions against verbal tech.</p> <p>In a way, Scientology&#8217;s view of causatively dropping one&#8217;s body reminds me of the old MASH theme song: &#8220;Suicide is painless. It brings on many changes. And I can take or leave it if I please.&#8221;</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330304"> 		<div id="comment-330304"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330304"> 				February 18, 2015 at 7:28 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330304#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330304", "330304", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Good post FOTF. The answer is no, not at all. Actually I haven&#8217;t really thought much about him since I left in 82. I think more about the people that have been harmed in his name after getting interested just recently.</p> <p>I stumbled on some blogs for fun just a few years ago and was quite curious about how things have developed.</p> <p>I have found, Marildi that I get various responses from people. I have been thanked very deeply and touched by people who have said that my thoughts have helped them.</p> <p>I have also been cursed and condemned by people as well. I take both responses as they come and understand them to be those people&#8217;s experience. What anyone thinks of me is their own business, not mine.</p> <p>My intention that has been stated before is twofold:</p> <p>1) Revisiting the 11 years of my development from the age of 18 to when I left the church. The revisiting allows me to go though my own mental files and discard any old unless thought forms that may be lingering. Things that I once thought were true, receded into my subconscious and became part of my energetic self so to speak: wrong knowledge</p> <p>2) The second purpose is to be an iconoclast to the false deceptive image that Ron causatively and deceptively perpetrated on our citizens.<br /> Specifically his third partying other paths, causing his students to only rely on him for guidance and trapping them in a prison of belief.<br /> Part of this second intention came about when the Indies were complaining about DM as the reason things are in a mess.<br /> With all my heart, I strongly disagree with this sentiment. </p> <p>I realized early on that people were having a hard time seeing Ron&#8217;s causative link to Scientology&#8217;s present condition. I knew that Scientologist&#8217;s have been conditioned to never be critical of Ron by way of threats to their family, jobs and continued being on the bridge.</p> <p>I then decided that I wanted to be a willing pinata and push as many buttons as I could, using reason and critical thinking, to help Indies be comfortable with criticism.</p> <p>So regarding step two, there is still much work to be done. I believe you and many others have no idea what a spell you have been under. Many people still think that only Ron knew the truth and there is no other path available for them. That is one thing I would love to address. Study others, learn from other wisemen and women. Ron was a dark soul. He was a confirmed liar and has harmed many people by third partying other spiritual paths.</p> <p>That is the essence of my constant criticism. To make it ok for those now out, to allow themselves to rehabilitate their own sovereign discriminating intelligence. And that starts with seeing L Ron Hubbard as he is, not the marketed lies of make believe he worked so hard to convince us of.</p> <p>So my question Marildi is: why does it bother you that I do?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-8 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329805"> 		<div id="comment-329805"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329805"> 				February 8, 2015 at 2:04 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329805#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329805", "329805", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Okay, thanks. </p> <p>JMO, but you would probably be more successful if you were less heavy-handed in the way you go about it. Some thiongs he said make a lot more sense when looked at from a Gnostic viewpoint.<br /> <a href="http://gnosis.org/gnintro.htm" rel="nofollow">http://gnosis.org/gnintro.htm</a></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330231"> 		<div id="comment-330231"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330231"> 				February 17, 2015 at 4:20 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>From the link <a href="http://gnosis.org/gnintro.htm" rel="nofollow">http://gnosis.org/gnintro.htm</a> provided by Valkov:<br /> <i><br /> &#8220;All religious traditions acknowledge that the world is imperfect. Where they differ is in the explanations which they offer to account for this imperfection and in what they suggest might be done about it. Gnostics have their own &#8212; perhaps quite startling &#8212; view of these matters: they hold that the world is flawed because it was created in a flawed manner.&#8221;<br /> </i><br /> World is flawed only from a human-centric viewpoint and not otherwise. That is what Buddhism tells us. Nirvana is extinguishing that human-centric viewpoint. Do plants and animals suffer? I don&#8217;t know. But from our human-centric viewpoint they suffer. When we give up this human-centric viewpoint, we can bear any suffering with equanimity.</p> <p>The world is what it is. Blaming it, or blaming its supposed &#8220;creator&#8221; doesn&#8217;t resolve anything.<br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330244"> 		<div id="comment-330244"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330244"> 				February 17, 2015 at 5:55 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>That is so true, Val. And that article you link makes the case so well. Thanks.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330347"> 		<div id="comment-330347"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/ecd994d7f918147adaa53571480babdb?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Brian</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330347"> 				February 19, 2015 at 3:20 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330347#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330347", "330347", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Brian'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>A man is measured by his own deeds Val. He was an old timer. He said Ron did not experience people. He said that Ron &#8220;confronted&#8221; people.</p> <p>The only real metaphysical connection I see Hubbard having is Crowley and black magic.</p> <p>Gnostic is from Sankrit Jnana: knowldege. All these words have the same root. They mean to know. Know what?</p> <p>The Gnostics wanted to know God. The Jnanis, yogis, want to know God.</p> <p>Hubbard thought he was God. He does not fall into any real tradition or lineage except magic and wanting powers.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-8 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329825"> 		<div id="comment-329825"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329825"> 				February 8, 2015 at 8:52 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329825#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329825", "329825", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p><i>So my question Marildi is: why does it bother you that I do?</i></p> <p>Hahaha&#8230; that is skillfully turning the table. 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Ok MIraldi, good points.</p> <p>Two questions:</p> <p>1) Do you give Xenu, the OT3 materials, credibility that you would audit Ron.</p> <p>You can separate the inventor of the combustion engine from the motor.<br /> That is because he made a physical product which is separate from him.<br /> You can drive around in a car and the inventor&#8217;s mindset personally is meaningless and has no effect on the driver.</p> <p>L Ron Hubbard created a religious philosophy and practice. Philosophy deals with thoughts, value systems cosmologies and world views.<br /> These things are read, studied, word cleared, demoed and checked out for proficiency.</p> <p>They become part of you. You are imprinted by his psychological profile. That imprint becomes behavior. That behavior is called being a Scientologist: someone who has opened up their mind to study, agree with and become someone whoa has some Ron traits. Because the traits he thought were useful became HCOB which became your mind.</p> <p>That argument of, L Ron Hubbard is dead and left us with the tech is an attempt to separate out the unethical life and criminal revelations of Hubbard from those who are still under his spell and practicing his philosophy.</p> <p>Who wants to have a spiritual teacher that lies, puts kids in chain lockers etc etc. It&#8217;s too embarrassing to those who call themselves a Scientologist.</p> <p>So&#8230;&#8230;&#8230;..let&#8217;s separate us from him by saying Scientology and Ron are different.</p> <p>What kind of spiritual aspirant wants to distance themselves from their teacher by coming up with such rubbish.</p> <p>I am more than proud of my teacher. His life is a star high goal I seek to emulate, not run away from and create mind games to distant myself from his immorality.</p> <p>Scientology is L Ron Hubbard. It&#8217;s his mind that becomes yours.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330313"> 		<div id="comment-330313"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330313"> 				February 19, 2015 at 1:52 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>All the good stuff he came up with was &#8220;borrowed&#8221; anyway, right? He never announced his sources because he thought so low of himself and craved to be seen as one of his Sci Fi heroes. He was an egotist.</p> <p>He constantly berated other teachers and approaches, with great talent for narcissism. And claimed authorship of other&#8217;s works. He was not a great man. </p> <p>He was an intellectual coward who did not have the courage, intelligence and wisdom to bring a debate to the real world. If in fact he had something to offer.</p> <p>Instead he sought destruction of critics and hid like scared pathetic rat.</p> <p>Looking up to Hubbard is a strange mindset. The more I find out about him the more I know what the prison of belief means.</p> <p>Do you know the person? Do you not look? </p> <p>L Ron Hubbard is like a big fat man selling weight loss products and his devotees don&#8217;t see the cognitive dissonance in this.</p> <p>Pop psychologist and charlatan are the labels that work for me.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330365"> 		<div id="comment-330365"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330365"> 				February 19, 2015 at 10:59 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Brian: &#8220;I can borrow a hammer from a neighbor to build a nice cabinet, or I can use it to kill someone&#8221;</p> <p>The point is that even if the hammer had been used to &#8220;kill someone&#8221;, why would we need to destroy &#8211; or even not use &#8211; the &#8220;nice cabinet&#8221; ?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330403"> 		<div id="comment-330403"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330403"> 				February 20, 2015 at 1:15 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p><i>Marildi: &#8220;The point is that even if the hammer had been used to “kill someone”, why would we need to destroy – or even not use – the “nice cabinet” ?&#8221;</i></p> <p>The furor over &#8220;blood diamonds&#8221; comes to my mind.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330413"> 		<div id="comment-330413"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/ecd994d7f918147adaa53571480babdb?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Brian</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330413"> 				February 20, 2015 at 4:13 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I do agree with you Marildi. Spiritual counseling, I believe, will only increase in popularity as we grow as a culture.</p> <p>I believe, that the process was started, to some degree, with Ron.</p> <p>So yes, there is validity in looking within for answers, in finding basic starting points of associated chains of events to neutralize mental and physical pain. To use reason as our god to extract truth from suffering.</p> <p>This even extends into past life therapy.</p> <p>But it won&#8217;t be called Scientology anymore. It will be called something else.</p> <p>No one owns these processes. Einstein did not invent the theory of relativity. He discovered a verity that existed since always.</p> <p>The problem, with this present evolution of a spiritual therapy called Scientology, is that L Ron Hubbard imprinted his dark side into these writings that distort truth.</p> <p>I will trust no Scientologist or Indie who does not acknowledge the dark and dangerous heritage of knowledge that L Ron Hubbard infected Scientology with.</p> <p>&#8220;He was just a man,&#8221; He said he was only human&#8221;, &#8220;he was not perfect&#8221;, does not cut the mustard. Some of his writings and behavior can rightly be called evil.</p> <p>The OT levels must be exposed as part of that madness.</p> <p>Use the hammer by all means. But make sure the metal hammer part is secured to the handle. If it flies off people get hurt.</p> <p>Look at L Ron Hubbard and his religion with the cold hard look of a wise dispassionate observer.</p> <p>Do not let emotional attachment to who you think he, Ron, is/was. </p> <p>If a person still has this magical attachment to Hubbard and thinks he&#8217;s a true wiseman, what is to stop the next madman from recreating a paramilitary dog kennel of &#8220;willing hounds&#8221; to set the planet free by the &#8220;only one true technology.&#8221;</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330429"> 		<div id="comment-330429"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330429"> 				February 20, 2015 at 9:37 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Brian: &#8220;I will trust no Scientologist or Indie who does not acknowledge the dark and dangerous heritage of knowledge that L Ron Hubbard infected Scientology with.&#8221;</p> <p>But don&#8217;t you see, Brian &#8211; you are unwittingly demanding the same thing you are against &#8211; authoritarian rule. </p> <p>Who would be the one to be given the authority to say what &#8220;needs to be acknowledged&#8221;. That would mean everybody else being required to see things the way the &#8220;authority&#8221; sees them &#8211; the very thing we are all protesting about the CoS. </p> <p>If you are in favor of freedom of thought, and I trust you are, then I think you should allow others just that &#8211;  freedom.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330443"> 		<div id="comment-330443"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330443"> 				February 21, 2015 at 5:39 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>A hypnotized person cannot be handled, just by allowing freedom of thought. He cannot be handled by &#8220;authority&#8221; either as Hubbard tried. &#8220;Authority&#8221; simply ends up hypnotizing the person more.</p> <p>So, how do you handle a hypnotized person?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330446"> 		<div </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330455"> 		<div id="comment-330455"> 		<div class="comment-author inquiry into the nature of Ron&#8217;s claims/clams, is the opposite of authoritarianism.</p> <p>To equate critical analysis with authoritarianism is to be still affected by Ron.</p> <p>CRITICISM = ATTACK</p> <p>The OT 3 level claims need this scrutiny. </p> <p>The uncovering of lies is not mind control.</p> <p>That is still Ron talking.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- It is just a question.</p> <p>1) Do you believe in Xenu?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330519"> 		<div id="comment-330519"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330519"> 				February 22, 2015 at 7:51 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Why do you think Marildi will answer you this time? Any questioning from you that puts her on defensive is a suppression of her &#8220;free thought.&#8221;</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330525"> 		<div id="comment-330525"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330525"> 				February 22, 2015 at 11:47 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Brian, I neither believe nor disbelieve in Xenu. In general, I do my best to avoid having &#8220;beliefs&#8221;. </p> <p>What makes the most sense to me, up to now, is that Hubbard apparently considered scientology to be a gnostic faith &#8211;  which could explain the reason for all his &#8220;myths&#8221;. Per gnosticism, myths can embody basic truths. That could explain why some of the OT levels work for many people, regardless of whether or not they are literally true. </p> <p>Hubbard may also have considered himself to be what is called in gnosticism a &#8220;Messenger of Light&#8221;, whose purpose was to bring knowledge and freedom to others. I talked to an old-timer one time, back in the early &#8217;80&#8217;s, who knew Ron personally and told me that Ron was very excited when he realized what he was here to do. </p> <p>Be that as it may, it&#8217;s also possible that Hubbard was a false Messenger whose purpose was to deceive and entrap people by giving them some truths &#8211; along with untruths, with the actual aim of enslaving them. </p> <p>Whichever of the two purposes it was, it seems to me, based on my own study and experience, that he did reveal a lot of truth. And benefiting from the truths, along with sifting out any untruths, is what I consider to be important.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330574"> 		<div id="comment-330574"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/f4dd23d6f380e5693407c8da3aed3807?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">MarkNR</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330574"> 				February 24, 2015 at 12:10 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Brian, Marildi, I will give you my detailed observations shortly.  My mother is having a bit of distress tonight.<br /> Mark</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329912"> 		<div id="comment-329912"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/206c144407563bc4e488cb8b121ae5d2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/oluckyme' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Oluckyme</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329912"> 				February 9, 2015 at 12:54 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329912#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329912", "329912", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Oluckyme'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Brian, man after my own heart. -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330238"> 		<div id="comment-330238"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/88ffb7b225d0c8180d13460ea3586382?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">nancy</cite>  			<span
