nancy'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I know of several &#8220;OT&#8217;s&#8221; in the LA area who expressed the idea for suicide or &#8220;dropping the Bod&#8221; after LRH died.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330260"> 		<div id="comment-330260"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330260"> 				February 17, 2015 at 7:49 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330260#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330260", "330260", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Okay, but &#8220;several&#8221; in the LA area is a small minority. You could find several of almost anything in almost any group. I&#8217;m pretty sure that if there were anything close to a majority who had this idea, the subject would have come up many times on many sites. But it hasn&#8217;t.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329596"> 		<div id="comment-329596"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/cf9852fde6b900f07e118db09bf76344?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Crepuscule</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329596"> 				February 6, 2015 at 2:21 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329596#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329596", "329596", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Crepuscule'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><blockquote><p> It’s not that every Scientologist has been instructed in writing to discard their body per se . . . </p></blockquote> <p>Well . . . when <strike> teaching </strike> making shit up about &#8220;Identity Versus Individuality&#8221;  in <i>SCIENTOLOGY 8-8008</i>, L Ron Hubbard,   had this to say about what an hindrance the body is when it comes to operating as a spiritual being . . . </p> <blockquote><p> . . . The most common confusion on the part of a preclear is between himself as an identified object and his beingness. One&#8217;s  beingness depends upon the amount of space which he can create or command, not upon his identification or any label. Identity as we know it in the MEST universe is much the same as identification, which is the lowest form of thought. When one is an object and is himself an effect, he believes that his ability to be cause is dependent upon his having a specific and finite identity. This is an aberration; as his beingness increases his individuality increases, and he quickly rises above the level of necessity for identity for he is himself self-sufficient with his own identity. </p> <p>The first question a preclear undergoing theta clearing asks himself is quite often: &#8220;How will I establish my identity if I have no body?&#8221; There are many remedies for this.<b> The worst method of having an identity is having a body.</b> As his individuality increases and his beingness expands &#8212; these two being almost synonymous &#8212; he is less and less concerned with this problem; that he is concerned with the problem tells the auditor where he is on the tone-scale . . . </p></blockquote> <p>. . . so speaketh Mainkind&#8217;s Greatest Friend. </p> <p>(As and aside, that first paragraph is kinda interesting when one considers just how tightly some people cling to the label &#8220;Scientologist&#8221; after escaping the cult.)</p> <p>Another aspect to bear in mind on Scientology&#8217;s disregard for the human body is that ubiquitous unofficial axiom &#8220;The Greatest Good for the Greatest Number of Dynamics&#8221;. This statement is bizarre when one considers that, assuming there is the slightest validity to &#8220;the dynamics&#8221;, each dynamic, starting with the second, is dependent for its survival on the one immediately below it. The first dynamic is the self operating in MEST world via the body. Providing that is surviving well, there develops an ability to put the second dynamic in place and, the healthier the second dynamic the more likely to survive is the third . . . and so on. That&#8217;s just logical, right? Well, in practise, Scientology demands that if a particular action will provide the greatest good for the greatest number of dynamics, it is always the first &#8211; and pivotal &#8211; dynamic, the body, and then the second &#8211; family &#8211; which are sacrificed. </p> <p>Remember also that, as masters of the universe, Scientologists are &#8220;not their bodies&#8221;, Far from it. They are mighty spiritual beings dealing not with just one life time, but with millions and millions of life times stretching across the entirety of eternity. A billion year contract &#8211; yeah, sure, where do I sign?.  This sense of such vast scale, most often implanted by auditors leading people down the <strike>garden path</strike> whole-track  often results in an abnormally cavalier attitude about the physical matters of personal health and death.  </p> <p>Its been a while now since I first saw the video where David Miscavige and the rest of his capos announce the death of L Ron Hubbard to a hall full of Scientologists. Do you know what they did upon receiving the news that L Ron Hubbard had dropped his body? They rose as one to their feet in a prolonged celebratory ovation of cheering and clapping. Quite, quite bizarre.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov even depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330194"> 		<div id="comment-330194"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/742817c1603c6e5f9f5086f4763a57b5?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://valkovuddin.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>iamvalkov</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330194"> 				February 17, 2015 at 12:38 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330194#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330194", "330194", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to iamvalkov'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Cepuscule,  I recommend this,  for a more three dimensional understanding:<br /> <a href="http://vis-www.cs.umass.edu/~dima/mytexts/suff.html#subjectivity" rel="nofollow">http://vis-www.cs.umass.edu/~dima/mytexts/suff.html#subjectivity</a><br /> Also the concept of existentialist philosophy in general,  and the thought of Ken Wilbur,  as in &#8220;The Intergral Vision&#8221; or &#8220;A Brief History of Everything&#8221;..   Not all of existence can be understood by &#8220;objectivizing&#8221; everything.  The objective is just the sound of one hand clapping.   The other hand is the subjective side of things.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330227"> 		<div id="comment-330227"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330227"> 				February 17, 2015 at 4:03 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330227#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330227", "330227", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Subjectivity comes from having a viewpoint. When there is no viewpoint there is no subjectivity.</p> <p>In mindfulness, ultimately, there is no viewpoint and no subjectivity or objectivity. There is simply seeing things as they are.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330316"> 		<div id="comment-330316"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/742817c1603c6e5f9f5086f4763a57b5?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://valkovuddin.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>iamvalkov</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330316"> 				February 19, 2015 at 2:46 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330316#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330316", "330316", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to iamvalkov'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Vin,  yes, but that is kinda like saying &#8220;When there is no hand there is no grasping&#8221;.  Deep?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330333"> 		<div id="comment-330333"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330333"> 				February 19, 2015 at 8:04 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330333#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330333", "330333", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I would say that the larger is the context in which one observes the lesser is the subjectivity. </p> <p>Hence when one observes in the context of the universe, as do the scientists, the observation is more objective.</p> <p>It is like observing in the context of the cosmos rather than in the context of earth.</p> <p>It is like observing in the context of a universe having both spiritual and physical characteristics, than in the context of just the spiritual universe or the physical universe.<br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330340"> 		<div id="comment-330340"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/cf9852fde6b900f07e118db09bf76344?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Crepuscule</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330340"> 				February 19, 2015 at 12:52 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330340#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330340", "330340", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Crepuscule'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><blockquote><p>Cepuscule, I recommend this, for a more three dimensional understanding . . . </p></blockquote> <p>Thank you, although your suggestion seems to have very little to do with what is being discussed here. Nikolai Berdyaev was an ardent Christian and his philosophical musings stand in direct opposition to what flimsy fragments of a philosophy the Lucifer-infused L Ron Hubbard was able to cobble together.</p> <p>I do understand that, rather than the body of his work, you were referring specifically to Berdyaev&#8217;s subjective/objective premise. I am not surprised to see it being raised because that subjective vs objective question is something of a constant theme in Scientology discussions when efforts are being made to defend the subject. The most common use of it that I have seen is in an effort to exclude anyone who has not personally undergone some form of Scientology processing. The idea being promoted is that without having experienced Scientology processing, a person is wholly unqualified to discuss it. Nothing could be further from the truth. For example, if such logic were to be valid, then there would be no male obstetricians. A more prosaic view highlights the abundantly apparent truth that your average wog understands more about Scientology then any Scientologist. Which is kinda ironic; for all L Ron Hubbards millions of words, the sum total of wog understanding of Scientology can be expressed in just one word: AVOID. </p> <p>In this specific raising of the subjective vs objective question, it would appear that the defense of Scientology is being shifted into the philosophical, rather than scientific, context. That&#8217;s quite understandable because anyone who believes  that L Ron Hubbard had anything useful to say about &#8220;the modern science of mental health&#8221; has an elephantine &#8220;MU&#8221; on the second and third words in that description. Science also requires that anything it states as fact can be objectively measured, something Scientology has never been able to do. Instead, it perpetually seeks to confuse anecdotal &#8220;success stories&#8221; with independently verifiable data. L Ron Hubbard also proved a third context for the defense of his fraud by drawing the cloak of religion over his operation. I&#8217;ve already addressed that aspect further down-thread so won&#8217;t labour the point here except to point out how tricksy it is to pin Scientologists and their enablers down. After all, depending on the argument being made, Scientology is an &#8220;applied philosophy&#8221;, and/or  an &#8220;exact science&#8221; and/or a &#8220;religion&#8221;, Shimmer Wax, comes to mind. </p> <p>So, here I am, after presenting a number of objective facts, being encouraged to read-up on Berdyaev&#8217;s subjective/objective premise in order to develop a &#8220;three dimensional understanding&#8221;. But, why would I want to limit my understanding of Scientology to just three dimensions and, even if I did, a three dimensional understanding of what, exactly?  The lethality of Scientology, the fundamental flaws of L Ron Hubbard&#8217;s &#8220;eight dynamics&#8221; which were being addressed in that exchange, or Scientology itself and, if so,  what use is the subjective/objective question in dealing with either or both of those? None, as far as I can see. I understand that for people locked into the Scientology prison of belief their subjective experiences trump objective reality every time. The very nature of Scientology processing starting with the entry level TRs  was carefully designed by L Ron Hubbard to ensure that very thing in order to encourage innocents to &#8220;clear&#8221;&#8221; their &#8220;banks&#8221; as quickly as possible. In Scientology&#8217;s case, </p> <p>Oddly enough, Berdyaev would agree with me and point to his concept of &#8220;Original Sin&#8221; whereby anthropocentrism and the confining of one&#8217;s thoughts to oneself leads to to self-imprisonment. L Ron Hubbard knew that too which is why Scientology is so solipsistic. I further agree with Berdyaev that the gaining of knowledge must rely in many respects on the seeker of knowledge making what is known a deep part of their being. Newton, for example, didn&#8217;t discover gravity at the moment when, as myth has it, an apple fell on his head.  Rather, Newton spent years and years learning up on extant &#8211; and objectively verifiable &#8211; knowledge, imbuing his very soul with what was objectively true so, when the apple dropped, it provided the lens through which the wider picture could be perceived. Inspiration, intuition, creativity, magic &#8211; call it what you will &#8211; but it didn&#8217;t happen with out a long and difficult runway cluttered up with all manner of subjective permutations. </p> <p>Where Berdyaev and I part ways is in his assertion that all knowledge is subjective when it originates. That&#8217;s like saying gravity didn&#8217;t exist until Newton discovered it and, at the moment when he did, gravity was his alone. That&#8217;s just silly. Its like saying &#8220;what&#8217;s true for you is what you have observed to be true&#8221;. It&#8217;s the doorway into the prison of belief where inhabitants are held captive in chains forged in the smelter of their own subjectivity. And that, my friend, is the labyrinth of the mind where time really is kept by the clapping of one hand. It is the obnosing of objective reality which sets us free and into the world where time is measured by three, or more, hands.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330369"> 		<div id="comment-330369"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330369"> 				February 19, 2015 at 11:30 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330369#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330369", "330369", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Crepuscule, what&#8217;s the problem with this statement you disagree with in 8-8008:</p> <p>&#8220;The worst method of having an identity is having a body.&#8221;</p> <p>Is it that you consider there are even worse methods of having an identity? Our brothers and sisters in this great life. The very source of love itself is our unity with all life.</p> <p>Tat Twam Asi-Thou Art That</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329657"> 		<div id="comment-329657"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/90cb511a4632987d8dfb4e4ea1604642?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Private</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329657"> 				February 6, 2015 at 3:54 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329657#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329657", "329657", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Private'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I watched a couple of videos that feature you, Mr. Rathbun, e.g. Truth Rundown, media interviews and depositions. </p> <p>This said, during those few past years, you appeared more and more bitter and unhappy impression. </p> <p>In the beginning you were surrounded by hundreds of Independents but most left you for reasons that are just whispered.  </p> <p>Was dropping Scientology such a good idea? vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Effects of good tech can be easily measured by the rationality and reality of the person. &#8220;Good feelings&#8221; alone are not sufficient. You can observe plenty of good feelings felt by a person on drugs or on crazed sex binge.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329266"> 		<div id="comment-329266"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/87e14f750c932bc3c4ac9adccf42ebfd?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='https://plus.google.com/105599518456815048425' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Gene Trujillo</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329266"> 				February 3, 2015 at 4:27 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329266#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329266", "329266", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Gene Trujillo'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Dianetics was originally based on valid therapies &#8211; early Freudian regression therapy and Korzybski&#8217;s General Semantics. However, when mind control is surreptitiously entered in along with the valid therapeutic ideas it is especially insidious because both mind control and valid therapy involve an emotional shift. It can be hard while undergoing the experience to tell the one from the other, but one is to heal for the person&#8217;s benefit, the other is to dominate for the benefit of the controller (first Hubbard, then Miscavige). Real therapist don&#8217;t try to use &#8220;transference&#8221; to exploit, CofS was built on it.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329279"> 		<div id="comment-329279"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329279"> 				February 3, 2015 at 5:57 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329279#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329279", "329279", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>The valid part of Dianetic therapy was &#8220;looking at the the trauma for what it was, without filters.&#8221; The purest form of Dianetics appeared in 1969 as R3R. It was my first experience with auditing. It was quite successful but not without some difficulty.</p> <p>The earliest form of Dianetics in early 1950 was not that clean. It was corrupted by &#8220;continual auditor speculation&#8221; to guess at the engram and then run it as soon as one hit upon it. Read the auditing demos of that period from R&amp;D volumes. Hubbard is continually speculating on what the engram was, and then questioning the pc based on his speculation.</p> <p>This approach could only get the low hanging fruits, and beyond that it did not work because &#8220;occlusion&#8221; set in. The occlusion built up because Hubbard was not allowing the mind to &#8220;un-stack&#8221; itself. When there was nothing stacked up the engram simply appeared all by itself and could be run out. But Hubbard was always in extreme rush and did not have patrience for mind to unstack itself. The simplistic idea of chains had only limited value. The data in the mind is indexed in so many complex ways, that it is best to let the mind unstack itself in the order determined by it. That was the idea underlying the &#8216;file clerk&#8221; but Hubbard used the &#8216;file clerk&#8221; along with his continual speculations.</p> <p>Luckily, in my first auditing in 1969, the auditor let my &#8220;file clerk&#8221; have a free hand after instructing me to maintain TR0 during the sessions. Once I got the hang of it, many deep engrams appeared and were run out one after another during the latter period of 25 hours. What happened, surprised me a great deal, and there was immediate and perceptible benefit from it.</p> <p>So, undue influence in auditing was there even in the early 1950s due to Hubbard&#8217;s ineptitude. It somehow worked intermittently when right factors happen to came together.</p> <p>Mind-control came in with a flawed Theta-MEST theory that Hubbard treated like a &#8220;fourteen pound diamond.&#8221; He enforced that theory in all different ways possible. That gave him a way to make a person feel better by boosting his thetanic ego.<br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329202"> 		<div id="comment-329202"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329202"> 				February 3, 2015 at 11:57 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329202#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329202", "329202", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I think the post is addressing BELIEFS.  </p> <p>be·lief<br /> 1.an acceptance that a statement is true or that something exists.<br /> &#8220;his belief in the value of hard work&#8221;<br /> something one accepts as true or real; a firmly held opinion or conviction.<br /> opinion, view, conviction, judgment, thinking, way of thinking, idea, impression, theory, conclusion, notion a religious conviction.<br /> &#8220;Christian beliefs&#8221;<br /> synonyms:	ideology, principle, ethic, tenet, canon; More</p> <p>2. trust, faith, or confidence in someone or something.</p> <p>I do not think believing is the same as knowing.</p> <p>know<br /> : to have (information of some kind) in your mind</p> <p>: to understand (something) : to have a clear and complete idea of (something)</p> <p>: to have learned (something, as a skill or a language)</p> <p>a (1) :  to perceive directly :  have direct cognition of (2) :  to have understanding of  (3) :  to recognize the nature of :  discern<br /> b (1) :  to recognize as being the same as something previously known (2) :  to be acquainted or familiar with (3) :  to have experience of<br /> 2 a :  to be aware of the truth or factuality of :  be convinced or certain of<br /> b :  to have a practical understanding of </p> <p>What people believe and what they know, there can be a very wide space in between.</p> <p>I think it makes sense that Marty would know what the beliefs are.</p> <p>I would say myself, the culture that bubbled up around the conversations in that group,  made #7 a reality.  It was not that way when I first got involved. It has not been my experience. On the other hand, it is my personal view that I have been exploring magic.  And this has been a very offensive idea to most people.  That is not a personal belief for me.  It is a personal understanding. I can see how it can be defined as pop psychology too. &#8220;Pop&#8221; in the meaning that it &#8220;challenges tradition&#8221;.  That is what pop means in this context. </p> <p>psy·chol·o·gy</p> <p>noun<br /> the scientific study of the human mind and its functions, especially those affecting behavior in a given context.<br /> synonyms:	study of the mind, science of the mind<br /> &#8220;a degree in psychology&#8221;<br /> the mental characteristics or attitude of a person or group.<br /> plural noun: psychologies<br /> &#8220;the psychology of Americans in the 1920s&#8221;<br /> synonyms:	mindset, mind, mental processes, thought processes, way of thinking, cast of mind, mentality, persona, psyche, (mental) attitude(s), makeup, character; informalwhat makes someone tick<br /> &#8220;the psychology of the motorist&#8221;<br /> the mental and emotional factors governing a situation or activity.<br /> &#8220;the psychology of interpersonal relationships&#8221;</p> <p>According to these definitions, it is pop psychology also if one would not see it as magic.</p> <p>New Definition: Hypnosis</p> <p>Hypnosis typically involves an introduction to the procedure during which the subject is told that suggestions for imaginative experiences will be presented. The hypnotic induction is an extended initial suggestion for using one&#8217;s imagination, and may contain further elaborations of the introduction. A hypnotic procedure is used to encourage and evaluate responses to suggestions. When using hypnosis, one person (the subject) is guided by another (the hypnotist) to respond to suggestions for changes in subjective experience, alterations in perception,[19][20] sensation,[21] emotion, thought or behavior.</p> <p>&#8220;Move to the beginning of the incident&#8230;&#8221;   This is a command.  There are auditing COMMANDS.  You are commanding the P.C. in the session.</p> <p>verb (used with object)<br /> 1.<br /> to direct with specific authority or prerogative; order:<br /> The captain commanded his men to attack.<br /> 2.<br /> to require authoritatively; demand:<br /> She commanded silence.<br /> 3.<br /> to have or exercise authority or control over; be master of; have at one&#8217;s bidding or disposal:<br /> The Pharaoh commanded 10,000 slaves.<br /> 4.<br /> to deserve and receive (respect, sympathy, attention, etc.):<br /> He commands much respect for his attitude.<br /> 5.<br /> to dominate by reason of location; overlook:<br /> The hill commands the sea.<br /> 6.<br /> to have authority over and responsibility for (a military or naval unit or installation); be in charge of.</p> <p>The auditor gives COMMANDS the P.C. follows.  That would not be possible with out a certain degree of surrender. </p> <p>Unless you have the viewpoint that you are having a CONVERSATION. In which case you might say, &#8220;No, I don&#8217;t want to.&#8221;   Or YOU could change the conversation at any time and direct it to where you would like the conversation to be.</p> <p>If you are following commands, you are being other determined.  I can see how this is a form of hypnotism.  And there has been much praise for hypnotic therapy.  I benefited from it myself on Dianetics.</p> <p>You go out in the world and you see people following commands all over the place.</p> <p>&#8220;Sign on the dotted line&#8221;  &#8220;Move to the front of the line&#8221;  &#8220;Step out of your car please and put your hands behind your back.&#8221;  &#8220;File your taxes.&#8221;  &#8220;Drive at the speed limit.&#8221;   &#8220;Take a seat.&#8221;   &#8220;Take a number&#8221;.  &#8220;Eat your breakfast&#8221; &#8220;Put on your seat belt&#8221;  &#8220;Pay the rent on the first&#8221;  &#8220;Repeat the auditing command&#8221;   etc etc.</p> <p>When you are following orders or commands, you are in a state of hypnosis.</p> <p>When using hypnosis, one person (the subject) is guided by another (the hypnotist) .</p> <p>I am not put off about it.  Whether people are exploring Scientology or not, they are out there following commands from other people.</p> <p>I think the point is, for me, is being aware of it.  It&#8217;s a condition.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329216"> 		<div id="comment-329216"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329216"> 				February 3, 2015 at 12:33 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329216#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329216", "329216", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>And commanding, is about forces. But I did figure out the first law of magic myself.  And,it&#8217;s interesting because the first law magic means you can not share it.  What the first law is.  The first law of magic is, &#8220;Never tell&#8221;.   If you hold something back from the other person, you put them into &#8220;not know&#8221; when you know.  I think Hubbard&#8217;s obsession with with holds stems from this. He was obsessed in knowing that NOTHING was being with held from him.</p> <p>Contrary to his notions, with holds are NOT always preceded by overts.</p> <p>Do you share your hand at the poker table?  If you did,there wouldn&#8217;t be a game.</p> <p>Hubbard does give it up that inability to with hold can be a weakening point.</p> <p>What makes magic potent is purpose.  You only become entangled with anti magic when your own purposes align with it.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-7 highlander-comment" 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' id="comment-329398"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329398#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329398", "329398", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Well, what&#8217;s wrong with pop psychology and hypnotism?  Every time you sit down in theater to watch a movie you are indulging in hypnotism. </p> <p>I can see the rightness in that. I can get hypnotized by a good book. </p> <p>Marty didn&#8217;t imply pop psychology was a bad thing,neither hypnotism. I didn&#8217;t take it a negative way. No need for me to get suddenly stuffy, after dabbling in the occult for decades. Hell, bring out the Ouija board!  </p> <p>Hypnotism, pop psychology, cults, magic, secret societies, religions, rituals, ceremony, spirits, parallel universes, magic spells, the super natural&#8230; we have most of us been knee deep in it.  So, it can get a little murky in places. So what?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329407"> 		<div id="comment-329407"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329407"> 				February 4, 2015 at 9:15 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329407#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329407", "329407", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>It doesn&#8217;t actually get funky until you realize there is a para military organization on top of this wanting to control your conversations with other spirits. I think the work Hubbard did up through OT2 was pretty simple and straight forward.  There is something to having lingering spiritual connections. For sure.  I think a person should be turned loose to work these things out for them self.  It&#8217;s hard promise to someone that you can hold their hand all the way into the supernatural. That they can be in command with those forces and conditions. Especially with a paramilitary group of soldiers on top of you in the environment. These are forces and condition in themselves that are not easy to manage.  If you took the Sea Org out of the picture, and the ethics officers, Scientology wouldn&#8217;t really be a strange thing to explore.  Most grown ups don&#8217;t want baby sitters and cops crawling all over them while they are straddled in parallel universes.  The whole Scientology universe has a cross purpose/identity conflict/out of valence issue. Hubbard changed the purpose,from clearing the planet to getting ethics in on the planet.  When he changed the purpose the whole dynamic shifted from spiritual to political.  To me, it&#8217;s the Sea Organization that makes it all strange and weird.  Not the Hubbard writings. Then Miscavige turning it into a religion?<br /> That kicked in a whole new chapter of case and fanatics. This is why it feels creepy.  It&#8217;s multivalent.  It&#8217;s not clear anymore as a group. It&#8217;s Identity.  Cross purposes. The soldiers got restless. They waited and waited and waited for the enemy to attack. Nobody paid any attention to them. For morale they began to stalk the perceived enemies. &#8220;Kill the psychs&#8221; blah blah.  Then they had some&#8221;squirrels&#8221; to go after from time to time.  The last ten years have been the glory of the Sea Org. Battle after battle.  No fight? They turned on each other.  Now they are famous mostly for domestic terrorism and domestic abuse. Piracy looting and pillaging.<br /> The closet hippies got left behind in the dust and put back on objectives to keep them busy while the wars are going on. They even have a &#8220;war chest&#8221;.   The purpose is domination, not liberation.  You see,that changing of purpose just flipped the whole thing around 180 degrees. And yes, Hubbard did that.  The place has cleared out because most people seeking to grow spiritually, do not want to be dominated and neither do they want to dominate others.  They want a hippie kind of harmony. ARC, understanding, a world of peace, pleasure, calm, laughter, love, education, joy,musicality.  The aesthetics of the supernatural.  Not soldiers stomping all over dead bodies. You can not dominate and liberate at the same time.  Hubbard locked the whole activity into a GPM.  He sabotaged it. And he did it on purpose.  This is what I find interesting.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329409"> 		<div id="comment-329409"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329409"> 				February 4, 2015 at 9:24 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329409#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329409", "329409", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>If you read KSW and a lot of other things he wrote around that time and after, it&#8217;s pretty clear he did not have a lot of arc for his peers. (Solonots) </p> <p>In the house next door you have a group of &#8220;wogs&#8221; with a Ouija Board and they are just doing it. You find people talking to angels,Gods, all sorts of communication going back between people and spirits. And it is a non issue and they have no C/S.  I was talking to spirits and animals when I was very young. I just got desperate for company and extended myself. I don&#8217;t know why Scientologists think it is so dangerous or unusual, and why they remain secretive about it.  They actually pretend that they are not doing it. And if you &#8220;let it out of bag&#8221; you have endangered everyone&#8217;s security.  It&#8217;s like,they are embarrassed about the &#8220;tech&#8221;.</p> <p>You go to Japan, those people for the most part feel their ancestors in their homes and honor them, even if they have been dead for hundreds of years.</p> <p>Why would anyone that has explored Scientology be offended to admit pop psychology or hypnotism? Scientologists I have noticed, generally have a problem admitting what they are doing and thinking.  And if they get busted, or get board, they  say they were &#8220;brainwashed&#8221;.  They do not want to admit they were hypnotized, they do not want to admit they took a walk on the wild side and dabbled in the occult. Closet Hippies.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329983"> 		<div id="comment-329983"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/0ddf391a6d27c629385d7419b3432688?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">mwesten</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329983"> 				February 10, 2015 at 2:43 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329983#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329983", "329983", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to mwesten'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I love reading you! What is running and reading on the meter are concepts. Concepts that are archetypes which trigger associations in the subconscious, which is real.</p> <p>If you spent years and years paying, hoping for and believing in OT 3, if you arrived there and Ron told you that a gigantic cauliflower once ate the universe and shit out the earth and all it&#8217;s inhabitance, and that is the cause of suffering, you would find it reading on the meter. </p> <p>If he told you that the source of all pain and suffering came from this, your subconscious mind would bring up real concepts and experiences of pain: real emotional and mental pain.</p> <p>The very act of confronting subconscious pain can resolve that pain.</p> <p>The pain is real, the cauliflower is not. The cauliflower is the restimulating symbol of that pain. Ron&#8217;s Sci Fi Symbols of his case.</p> <p>In dream therapy you can run real pain. But after it&#8217;s resolution you know it was a dream you were mocking up. You know you created it.</p> <p>But in Ron&#8217;s dream therapy you are left with a twisted cosmology with the source of your suffering being an external make believe cause: the whole implant OT3 thing.</p> <p>You are then left with a non duplication of reality: A Scientologist</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329914"> 		<div id="comment-329914"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/3ead379e00d768d7733bc84889e9a363?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/aprilfool' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>aprilfool</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329914"> 				February 9, 2015 at 1:47 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329914#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329914", "329914", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to aprilfool'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Many Indys, ex-Scientolists cannot confron the truth of it.  </p> <p>I suppose it&#8217;s understandable perhaps in that that they&#8217;re still under hypnosis, still implanted. They are all called ORGANIZATIONAL policy letters.  Not, CHURCH policy letters.  They are simple policies like any business would have. McDonald&#8217;s, Burger King, IHOP, you should see the policies and manuals that come with opening up one of those franchises. </p> <p>I have no issues with Scientologists, Freezoners, Independents. I am not a threat to them and I don&#8217;t think they have a lot of threats against them.  They do not have the enemies they imagine they have. I do have problems with witch hunts and bullying.  I do have problems with a police force and terrorist organization operating under the umbrella of religion. And I think that is what the Sea Organization has become and perhaps, has always been.</p> <p>Scientologists would be better off with out this appendage. I do not think it is a good idea at all. It is a taxing organization.  The materials are free to everyone now. </p> <p>No, I do not need to attack Scientologists every where or the subject matter of Hubbard&#8217;s research and writings because of one terrorist organization.</p> <p>Time and time again the Sea Organization has proved themselves a threat to Scientologists and Scientology groups.  Everything they touch turns to sand.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329331"> 		<div id="comment-329331"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329331"> 				February 4, 2015 at 2:01 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>&#8220;No, I do not need to attack Scientologists everywhere or the subject matter of Hubbard’s research and writings because of one terrorist organization.&#8221;</p> <p>TO, that&#8217;s a large viewpoint, succinctly stated.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329299"> 		<div id="comment-329299"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329299"> 				February 3, 2015 at 8:28 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>&#8220;The psychs&#8221; didn&#8217;t shut down the mission network. I personalIy do not view those things as pop psychology or hypnotism. In 35 years as an audiror, CS and Course Supe, I participated in countless wins and cognitions on all four flows.  And I think I have kept my gains after being out for almost 9 years now.  I still apply my wins and cogs in every day life.</p> <p>At the same time that LRH was developing/discovering what I very much value in the above, he was also a megolomaniac who was very slowly but surely going insane (by his own definitions) and establishing a Soviet syle fascistic organization bent on control of his parishioners&#8217; minds, behavoir and their money.  Some of LRH policy is wonderful, much of the Org Series for example and some of his early basic policies.  But the vast majority of it is his blueprint, procedures, and insane ideas which form the basis of the above mentioned Soviet style fascist organization.  There&#8217;s an amount of evil intention in it that is not pretty.  But to even stay IN Scientology, one had to agree that even the crazy things Ron said were &#8220;the truth.&#8221;  I still continue to have to this day (last night) &#8220;3D nightmares&#8221; about Scientology.</p> <p>If independant groups like the Dror people in Israel can audit and train people to more happiness, without using the 80% or so of LRH policiy that stinks, lies and hurts people, I say great for them.  Personally at 64, I no longer have any interest in or desire for any further Scientology training or processing.  I have moved on to other studies and activities which speak to me more now.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329376"> 		<div id="comment-329376"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329376"> 				February 4, 2015 at 3:01 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thanks, Joe. I do mean the same as you do by &#8220;core scientology&#8221;, and I have also moved to other studies and activities. Doing so was validated by LRH himself back in 1951 in the Chart of Human Evaluation (SOS), where the highest tone level on the chart was characterized as “Search for different viewpoints in order to broaden own reality. Changes reality.&#8221;</p> <p>You probably remember the study tape “Training: Duplication” where LRH explains why it is that learning the truth about something is a road to having judgment – not only judgment in whatever subject is being studied, but judgment in general (even about women, he jokingly says in one part <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-smile' title=':)'>:)</span> ). I consider a gain in judgment to be one of the most – if not THE most &#8211; valuable things a person can take away from scientology. Here’s a quote from that 1962 study lecture:</p> <p>“Of course it’s [judgment] most rapidly restored on such a track by teaching the person the exact truth of something. There is the truth of something, he is able to duplicate the truth of something after many travails, and this truth of something is immediately pursued by the understanding of that something he has been taught. You understand that that is a stage; he’s still dependent on you for the understanding of what’s been taught. And your next stage up is a realization, which he reached at a sudden step up the line on his own bootstraps, so to speak. He regained an ability to understand, and so then he himself could realize. That’s the route that you’re taking. That route has total self-determinism and other-determinism and, of course, therefore, pan-determinism all mixed up in it, all at one fell swoop.</p> <p>“The person becomes pan-determined over the data. The person does not only understand why they learned the data but why the data was taught to them, and understand and REALIZE – of course, the realization includes the independent truth of the datum regardless of having been taught the datum. And with that, of course, a person has reached a high peak of the ability to judge something. A person then has judgment. There’s no other route that I know of. I mean if this is not a perfect route, all right, so it isn’t a perfect route. There is no perfect route.</p> <p>“Perhaps there is a perfect route, but there is no perfect route to hand at the moment if this is not a perfect route.”</p> <p>(&#8220;Training: Duplication&#8221;, 24 Jan 62)</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329291"> 		<div id="comment-329291"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329291"> 				February 3, 2015 at 7:41 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329291#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329291", "329291", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Have a look at this web site, and figure out how many false reports and how much false information, and wrong items the Organization is putting out there on a daily basis right now. src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>LOL <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-bigsmile' title=':D'>:D</span></p> <p>Actually, I think whoever developed primal therapy may have gotten the idea from a process in *Creation of Human Ability* called “Yelling”:</p> <p>“In that man has, for a long time, used words to make space, and as any barbaric people uses noise to make itself big, it will be found that an inhibition of making noise is a major difficulty on the case of any preclear.…The auditing command is: ‘Start yelling’, and ‘keep yelling’. The preclear can be sent off by himself to yell. If a group is being processed where its noise will not disturb others, a back and forth interchange between the auditor and the group will be found beneficial. This process is very limited and has a tendency simply to make people cheerful [like it did in the posted video], but occasionally some cases are so inhibited on the making of noise that they are having difficulty with their vocal cords or with their mouths. Tooth trouble can be traced to the inhibition of making noise. Distaste for singing is equally traced to the making of noise.”</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Maybe this belief needs to be explained better. As noted above, effects of good tech are measured through the reality and rationality it imparts, and not just &#8220;good feelings&#8221;. When a person has &#8220;good feelings&#8221; but he is out of touch with reality, and moving farther away from rationality, as a result of auditing, then it cannot be called good tech.</p> <p>So, take a good look at how closer you are to reality as a result of Scientology auditing. Are you able to see the abuse and contradictions in the Church of Scientology?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-3 highlander-comment" Marty&#8217;s opinion.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329244"> 		<div id="comment-329244"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329244#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329244", "329244", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Well, the Scientology belief is that its &#8220;tech&#8221; is infallible. My criticism of this belief is as follows:</p> <p>1.	Scientology consists of much ground breaking work by Hubbard.</p> <p>2.	Scientology introduces a whole new plateau to addressing the problems of the mind.</p> <p>3.	The work on this breakthrough is, however, far from complete.</p> <p>4.	The success from the application of Scientology is far from consistent.</p> <p>5.	Any lack of success gets blamed on the practitioner of Scientology.</p> <p>6.	Unmanageable difficulties seem to exist in the application of Scientology.</p> <p>7.	Correction lists have become a part of “Standard Scientology.”</p> <p>8.	A closer look at Scientology shows a lack of application of the principle of poka-yoke.</p> <p>9.	Mindfulness is the key to successes in Scientology auditing.</p> <p>10.	Scientology does not seem to put emphasis on Mindfulness.</p> <p>11.	Scientology takes up aspects of mindfulness on TR0, Obnosis, and Data Series, but it fails to treat mindfulness systematically, and fails to highlight its importance in auditing.</p> <p>12.	The principles of Mindfulness were first elucidated by Buddha 2600 years ago.</p> <p>13.	Mindfulness seems to provide poka-yoke to Scientology processes.</p> <p>14.	The principles of Mindfulness are presented under KHTK Mindfulness on this blog.</p> <p>15.	Here is an example of application of mindfulness to Scientology processes – Running Scientology Grade 0 with Mindfulness (Part 1)</p> <p>16.	Here is a closer look at Scientology Auditing.</p> <p>For details, please see,</p> <p><a href="http://vinaire.me/2012/10/03/a-look-at-scientology/" rel="nofollow"><b>A LOOK AT SCIENTOLOGY</b></a><br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329492"> 		<div id="comment-329492"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/49ed6e7cf2468fde53c09f451cae310f?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/discoqueen' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>discoqueen</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329492"> 				February 5, 2015 at 12:23 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329492#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329492", "329492", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to discoqueen'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>A very good point, Vinaire.  </p> <p>Can you also live better as a result of your auditing?  Once the euphoria has worn off, is life better, simpler, happier?  Are you more able to earn a good living?  Are you well physically?  </p> <p>I didn&#8217;t find many Scientologists whose lives had improved in spite of all the auditing they&#8217;d had.  My OT friends are having a hellish time.  So are my Clear friends.  And they can&#8217;t see it, that is, that their life was not much better.  </p> <p>Oh, you hear stories of how right in the middle of a proces, not even before it had ended, this wonderful thing had happened.  It was probably going to happen anyway.  A little down the road, you find out their spouse did them in, or their boss; or they got very ill; even died of cancer.  And so on.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329565"> 		<div id="comment-329565"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329565"> 				February 5, 2015 at 8:38 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329565#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329565", "329565", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Scientology has now pretty much reduced to a self-cannibalizing cult. I do not give it much staying power. Maybe ten years at the most.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov even depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330201"> 		<div id="comment-330201"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/742817c1603c6e5f9f5086f4763a57b5?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://valkovuddin.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>iamvalkov</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330201"> 				February 17, 2015 at 2:25 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330201#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330201", "330201", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to iamvalkov'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I don&#8217;t entirely agree with this because it depends on the process and intended EP.  If the EP is intended to be subjective,  eg &#8220;feeling good&#8221;,  then that&#8217;s it.   If the EP is intended to be &#8220;aa better meory&#8221;,  or &#8220;Higher IQ&#8221;,  if it does that, then that&#8217;s it.   Being &#8220;in touch with reality&#8221; is a possible goal or EP,  but it isn&#8217;t stated as such in most of what Hubbard wrote or said.   My grandfather didn&#8217;t approve of comic books or sci-fi,  because they were not reality oriented.   He was kinda suppressive in that way.   He didn&#8217;t see the value of fantasy or even imagination unless they were placed in service of &#8220;reality&#8221;.   In fact I kinda agree that &#8220;agreement with reality&#8221; is not a very worthy goal,  especially when it is enforced.  As when cops beat people up for not mindlessly complying with their  their commands.   Obviously it is the cops&#8217; reality ythat their commands must be obeyed,  or else.   What kind of freedom is that?  Makes me wonder about some of the statements posted by commenters here,  who appear to be trying to enforce their view of Hubbard on everyone else.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330205"> 		<div id="comment-330205"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330205"> 				February 17, 2015 at 8:01 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330205#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330205", "330205", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Valkov, good to see you back. You were missed.</p> <p>My definition of reality seems to be different from yours. I see reality as the lack of inconsistency resulting in harmony. To the degree there is inconsistency and disharmony something is unreal. </p> <p>Reality includes both physical and spiritual aspects.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov even depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330223"> 		<div id="comment-330223"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/742817c1603c6e5f9f5086f4763a57b5?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://valkovuddin.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>iamvalkov</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330223"> 				February 17, 2015 at 3:47 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330223#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330223", "330223", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to iamvalkov'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thanks for the welcome Vin.  I don&#8217;t know,  maybe our meanings for reality differ.  Reality to me has subjective aspects and it has objective aspects.  Subjective aspects can be targetted,  and objective aspects can be dealt with also.   There is a lot about these in Scientology,  as I&#8217;m sure you are aware.  The old-school differentiation is &#8220;inner&#8221; vs. &#8220;outer&#8221;.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330252"> 		<div id="comment-330252"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330252"> 				February 17, 2015 at 7:29 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330252#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330252", "330252", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>What I am saying is that if there is some inconsistency even between &#8220;inner&#8221; and &#8220;outer&#8221;; or between &#8220;subjective&#8221; and &#8220;objective&#8221; then there is lack of harmony and also unreality.</p> <p>To me, REALITY = CONSISTENCY AND HARMONY.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330297"> 		<div id="comment-330297"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/6a992ac788eab4b8b7c88d9c086aae4a?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">FOTF2012</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330297"> 				February 18, 2015 at 3:05 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330297#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330297", "330297", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to FOTF2012'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I agree with that. This relates to ontology, which is the study being, reality, etc. Some thoughts.</p> <p>In terms of ontology I myself fall in the range of constructivist and post positivist.</p> <p>Constructivism holds that what we consider reality Is constructed by ourselves. To me this is nearly self-evident as it relates to things like beliefs, religion, culture, and so forth. This can be correlated to be subjective reality whether within an individual or a group.</p> <p>Positivism holds that there is a universe independent of human considerations and that the truths of the universe can be determined. Post positivism makes a qualification. It asserts that we can get closer and closer to understanding the universe, but most likely we can never get there 100%. Positivism and post positivism correlate to objective reality.</p> <p>While Scientology as a constructed, subjective reality and culture Is pretty much immune from having to prove itself (like religion in general), it makes a number of objective claims that do not stand up to scrutiny and which can be and have been falsified, and/or for which no objective evidence has been brought forward.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329253"> 		<div id="comment-329253"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/87e14f750c932bc3c4ac9adccf42ebfd?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='https://plus.google.com/105599518456815048425' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Gene Trujillo</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329253"> 				February 3, 2015 at 3:17 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329253#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329253", "329253", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Gene Trujillo'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hubbard tricked CofSers into using hypnotic, domination techniques. For example, a lot of CofS policy directed towards the handling of disagreements, dissidents etc come straight out of what Hubbard called &#8220;The Brainwashing Manual&#8221;, he merely used a trick of semantics to rename them for propaganda purposes, then introduced them into CofS policy while telling his followers that it was to &#8220;help&#8221; when it was order to make a self enclosed thought bubble to entrap the minds of his followers. Apparently, he wanted everyone to be his slave under hypnotic control.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329605"> 		<div id="comment-329605"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/3ead379e00d768d7733bc84889e9a363?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/aprilfool' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>aprilfool</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329605"> 				February 6, 2015 at 4:23 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329605#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329605", "329605", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to aprilfool'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Agreed, Gene Trujillo.  The SO and most staff behave like robots, carrying out orders without such rightness and without any real thought about what they&#8217;re actually doing.  </p> <p>I believe we were all in this state to one degree or another and that is why it took so many of us so long to see and to leave.  This is a hell of an evaluation, I know.  If it is a wrong indication to you, scrap it.  </p> <p>However, it does answer the question I&#8217;ve asked of myself many times, Why did I wait two decades to make my move?  Others longer than that?  And in that very first decade I was as unhappy as hell &#8211; but I stayed!!!</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329187"> 		<div id="comment-329187"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/6076825d544a506c28aa1faf66f54c19?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Daisy</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329187"> 				February 3, 2015 at 10:50 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329187#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329187", "329187", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Daisy'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thanks for this. same thing. There were some powerful magicians. I think Jesus was one of them. Don&#8217;t you believe in magic?  Isn&#8217;t magic part of the Scientology belief system also?<br /> Not sure why you fundamentalists always discount it.</p> <p>“But mysticism/occultism isn’t our source. Our source, actually, is magic. Magic is something that, today, is performed on a stage with prestidigitation. But magic actually has a much more vivid and noble history than a stage magician. It is quite remarkable that the magician attempts directly to use spirits to perform his will. And that is his basic modus operandi. That is his goal in practicing magic.”from a Lecture given on 29 January 1958, The History of Clearing by L Ron Hubbard.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li (KSW policy).<br /> -Coerced abortions.<br /> It goes on.<br /> The fact that Scientology places so little value on human life should be cause for great concern.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329232"> 		<div id="comment-329232"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/7b2882f82da469cf44676e667e9587c9?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Roger From Switzerland Thought</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329232"> 				February 3, 2015 at 1:34 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329232#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329232", "329232", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Roger From Switzerland Thought'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>&#8220;The fact that Scientology places so little value on human life should be cause for great concern.&#8221;<br /> !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!<br /> This is a very sad TRUTH.
