I remember a yound Marc Valliers from my days on Flagship during the 70&#8217;s.</p> <p>I don&#8217;t know if Scientology dogma advocates death, but it does discount individual life in favor of the survival of the Church of Scientology. I regrad the following beliefs in Scientology to be false.</p> <p>(1) A soul (thetan) is believed to exist indpendent of the body, and even to move to another body after the death of a previous body. This is not the belief in Buddhism or in other Eastern religions, which differentiate spiritual elements from soul. A soul is a configuration of spiritual elements. This configuration is temporary and it disintegrates after death. The spiritual elements may continue like the physical elements (atoms and molecules), but not a particular configuration as a body or a soul.</p> <p>(2) That LRH continues to exists as a being is a false belief. His soul is disintegrated just like his body. The concept of &#8220;reincarnation&#8221;  is misunderstood in the western society. It is no a being that gets reborn. It is simply a new configuration of spiritual and physical elements. It is not only a new body, but also a new soul. The spiritual elements that made up Hubbard&#8217;s soul may continue like the physical elements that made up up his body. But they are long absorbed in new bodies and souls.</p> <p>Scientology has simply exploited the ignorance of western cultures in these matters.<br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329245"> 		<div id="comment-329245"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>In my understanding, Buddha was talking about different configurations of spiritual elements that he was aware of. Each configuration was a different &#8220;I&#8221;. For details, please see</p> <p><a href="http://vinaire.me/2012/05/11/khtk-11a-the-structure-of-i/" rel="nofollow"><b>THE STRUCTURE OF “I”</b></a><br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329976"> 		<div id="comment-329976"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/b38557e51e256dac2907a7dd1f51e808?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/99whitegm' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Path of Buddha</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329976"> 				February 10, 2015 at 10:29 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329976#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329976", "329976", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Path of Buddha'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>marildi,</p> <p>&#8220;Then why did Buddha say he recalled many of his own past lives, and that he had been “born for the last time”?&#8221;<br />      In original Buddhism, the Buddha does speak of a few past lives.  However,  the details of the past lives would today seem &#8220;culture bound.&#8221;<br /> They are mostly restricted to India.  The point is that the Buddha was<br /> more concerned about a level of knowledge which reaches the expression of the &#8220;regularity of karma&#8221;.  In other words, the idea of the Samsaric cycle.<br /> The Buddha stated &#8220;born for the last time&#8221; after enlightenment.<br /> Many of the past life accounts found in later texts such as the Jataka are disputed.<br />      The idea of past life is only important in the context of the Four Noble Truths.   By the way, this is not a very good translation.  It is more like<br /> &#8220;facts of existence.&#8221;<br />    May all beings be well and happy!<br /> GMW</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329985"> 		<div id="comment-329985"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/b38557e51e256dac2907a7dd1f51e808?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/99whitegm' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Path of Buddha</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329985"> 				February 10, 2015 at 3:37 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329985#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329985", "329985", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Path of Buddha'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>marildi,<br />    I have one other piece of information on this.  The Buddha recalled past lives in blocks 10, 100, 1,000, 10,000, 100,000 etc. .  It seemed odd to me at first, but he is looking at the overall pattern.  In Theravada, we do not use<br /> past lives.  In fact, I know of an interesting story in Thailand in the early 1900&#8217;s.<br /> A Nun wanted a certain monk to be her teacher.  She never stopped talking about past lives despite his pleas.  He finally tossed her out.  She came back and listened to him and attained sainthood.<br /> May all beings be well, happy and peaceful!</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329987"> 		<div id="comment-329987"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/df446e55d540b29e3179a8b84bcee235?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Letting go</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329987"> 				February 10, 2015 at 4:27 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329987#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329987", "329987", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Letting go'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thank you for writing your book. It is a liberating experience and came at the perfect time.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329996"> 		<div id="comment-329996"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/b38557e51e256dac2907a7dd1f51e808?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/99whitegm' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Path of Buddha</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329996"> 				February 10, 2015 at 6:19 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329996#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329996", "329996", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Path of Buddha'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Lettin go,<br />    You are welcome.  I changed while writing it.  Recalling thought<br /> patterns from 25 years ago was an experience.<br /> May all liberated beings be well and happy!</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330005"> 		<div id="comment-330005"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330005"> 				February 10, 2015 at 9:47 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330005#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330005", "330005", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Path of Buddha: &#8220;The Buddha stated &#8216;born for the last time&#8217; after enlightenment.&#8221;</p> <p>The above seems to say that the soul / self / thetan does exist &#8211; although not permanently, as it ceases to exist when enlightenment is achieved. </p> <p>Sometimes it seems to be a matter of semantics as regards the question of &#8220;soul or no-soul?&#8221; </p> <p>At the top of one of the columns of the Chart of Attitudes (40.0), the &#8220;attitude&#8221; is  &#8220;Everyone&#8221;. Below that, in the same column (at 22.0), is “I am an individual as I please.”  So it would seem to be a matter of position on a scale where there is no matter, energy, space or time at the top.</p> <p>Also, I think the idea of &#8220;Everyone&#8221; would correspond to &#8220;co-existence of static&#8221; in the following axiom:</p> <p>“Axiom 25. Affinity is a scale of attitudes which falls away from the co-existence of static, through the inter-positions of distance and energy, to create identity…”</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330022"> 		<div id="comment-330022"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/b38557e51e256dac2907a7dd1f51e808?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/99whitegm' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Path of Buddha</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330022"> 				February 11, 2015 at 7:28 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330022#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330022", "330022", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Path of Buddha'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>marilidi,<br />     In Original Buddhism, the idea of &#8220;no self&#8221; or &#8220;no soul,&#8221; which is a stretch, is a working construct not a fixed idea.   The monk Sati tried to corner the Buddha when he asked about the soul.  The Buddha replied  that he never taught that doctrine.  In ancient India, the Vedas had inspired the doctrine of<br /> transmigration.  The Buddha was breaking from that tradition.  His idea of<br /> &#8220;no self&#8221; or no soul was new.  This is not correctly reported in Scientology so it is important.  In another meeting, the Buddha when pressed about the soul and was silent.  This gets back to the idea of the working construct of the idea of &#8220;no self&#8221;.  The Buddha was very clear that theoretical issues were to be avoided as no one could prove the existence of the soul.  At the mundane level of awareness, the soul is evident as an awareness because of the grasping better called in this case &#8220;bhava kamma&#8221;.  This is an aspect of kamma restrcted to the idea of the soul.  The Buddha was also clear in the doctrine that the universe, in his view, had no beginning.  This contradicts Scientology&#8217;s &#8220;Before the beginning was a cause&#8221;.  At the surpramundane level in early Buddhism, the idea of soul is examined in a four fold void corresponding to the Noble Truths.  The Buddha clearly stated that he had to do this.  In phenomenological reality the working constucts of soul and &#8220;no self&#8221; are used to see multiple causes or Karma with a capital K.  Thus Buddha instructed us to keep away from theoretical discussions of the soul.<br /> The structure of the universe in Original Buddhism is vast and complex,<br /> but centered on one point which is not a soul.<br />   Axiom 25 would not apply.  Co-existence of static violates the primary dictum of Buddhism.  Everything is impermanent.  Existence or co-existence is &#8220;bhava kamma&#8221;.  This is a hinderance to knowledge.<br />    The Chart of Atitudes also does not apply.  The Buddha does not use MEST in the same way as Hubbard.  The Buddha clearly stated that the elements of the universe are physical atoms and mind.  Mind is not a spirit, soul or theta.<br /> It is dependent on matter for awareness. This is complex stuff better left for now.<br />    A better topic to discuss is Meta or loving-kindness.  This operates on a far higher plane than affinity.<br />     At any rate, the primary point is that &#8220;no self&#8221; is a working construct used<br /> in meditation.  Thetans in Buddhisms are impermanent gods subject to the laws of kamma.  These gods come in many flavors.</p> <p>GMW</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330039"> 		<div id="comment-330039"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330039"> 				February 11, 2015 at 10:10 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330039#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330039", "330039", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>G, thanks very much for your learned comments. Very helpful. Buddha&#8217;s idea of &#8220;no self&#8221; as a working construct makes more sense, put in that way.  </p> <p>You also wrote: &#8220;The structure of the universe in Original Buddhism is vast and complex, but centered on one point which is not a soul.&#8221;</p> <p>Is that one point karma (with or without the capital &#8220;K&#8221;)? </p> <p>I get a sense of what is meant by karma as being a sort of inevitable flow of things, and that makes sense to me too. However, it would be a completely deterministic viewpoint if there exists no free will / choice &#8211; so how does that fit in? You also said:</p> <p>&#8220;The Buddha clearly stated that the elements of the universe are physical atoms and mind. Mind is not a spirit, soul or theta.&#8221;</p> <p>If there is nothing but atoms and mind, &#8220;who&#8221; or &#8220;what&#8221; is making the choices in life that will determine the karma and whether or not there will be rebirth for that &#8220;who&#8221; or &#8220;what&#8221;?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-8 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330085"> 		<div id="comment-330085"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/b38557e51e256dac2907a7dd1f51e808?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/99whitegm' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Path of Buddha</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330085"> 				February 13, 2015 at 10:04 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330085#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330085", "330085", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Path of Buddha'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Marildi,<br />    Free will fits into the idea of Karma because the individual or the &#8220;I&#8221; is actually accountable for its position in the cycle of birth/rebirth.  This<br /> sounds contradictory because there is &#8220;no self.&#8221;  The contradiction is<br /> handled because the point of self/no self is an inflection point.  The<br /> forces of karma are manifested in a series of mental contaminations.  The Buddha used a word which translates as &#8220;fermentations&#8221; or &#8220;pickled&#8221;.<br /> Imagine a person soaked in Bud Light.  The brain is in fermentation.  This is the analogy on the level of thought.  Free will is not possible when picked.Since the<br /> goal is cessation, free will is really the idea of stillness.  You do not have the idea of free will in the modern sense of capitalism in Buddhism.  Gain/loss are lower levels.<br />     The centered point is not Karma with a capital &#8220;K&#8221;.  Buddha uses the idea of<br /> the &#8220;centered point&#8221; to get the idea that &#8220;all you need for salvation is within your five or six foot body&#8221;.  You don&#8217;t need anything else. Time in original Buddhism is not linear.  Thus you cannot apply the idea of MEST.  There is no beginning in Buddhism.  Also, the past and the future are infinite.  However, you can center yourself in the universe through meditation.  It sounds strange.  But remember Time is non-linear.<br /> The individual thus has an input of both determinism and free will at the same time.  Free will in Buddhism is better defined as the removal of black karma.<br /> Karma with a capital &#8220;K&#8221; is the grand accountant of the universe.  It is<br /> like a debit and credit card that does not go away.<br />    The &#8220;who&#8221; or &#8220;what&#8221; is impermanent and temporary.  The being comes from nowhere and goes nowhere.  There is no &#8220;doer&#8221; in Buddhism.<br />     You can look at all of Buddhism as birth/existence/death.  Buddha taught this  as a fundamental building block.  Hubbard&#8217;s create, create, create would<br /> have been rejected as temporary.  The cosmic cycle in Buddhism extends over more than 91 big bangs but there is no end.  Buddha said it went on and on beyond.  Moral Thetans are accounted for in Buddhism.  They actually hang around in a special place waiting for the next big bang.  They never go clear until Nirvana or Nibbana.  They are impermanent.<br /> GMW</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-9 highlander-comment" My brain is no doubt too pickled <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-smile' title=':)'>:)</span> to fully grasp what you wrote; however, I still get a sense of possible semantical differences only. One reference that comes to mind is a short paragraph from 8-8008, which describes a state above 40.0, the highest level on the tone scale: </p> <p>&#8220;Space is not necessary to the beingness of a thetan when the thetan is above the tone level of 40.0 and can create space at will. He creates space to have specific beingness. AT 40.0 space and beingness can be considered to be interchangeable. BEINGNESS CAN EXIST WITHOUT ANY ENERGY OR MATTER, WHICH IS TO SAY, WITHOUT TIME [my caps].</p> <p>Another part of Hubbard&#8217;s cosmology would be the Gradient Scale of Exteriorization (COHA). At the top of the scale is &#8220;a true Static&#8221; &#8211; that might correspond to the description of Nirvana as &#8220;stillness&#8221;. Here it is:</p> <p>“There is a gradient scale of exteriorization which could be described as follows:<br /> &#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8211;<br /> First, the thetan without contact with a universe;<br /> Then, a thetan in full contact with a universe;<br /> Then, a thetan in contact with part of a universe, who considers the remainder of the universe barred to him;<br /> Then, a thetan in a universe without any contact with any part of the universe;<br /> Then, a thetan unknowingly in contact with a large part of a universe.<br /> &#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8211;</p> <p>“The first condition would be a true Static. The last condition is called, colloquially, in Scientology, ‘buttered all over the universe.’</p> <p>“As it is with a universe, such as the physical universe, so it is with physical bodies. The thetan, who has already gone through the cycle on the universe itself, may be in contact with a physical body in the same order:</p> <p>&#8220;At first he would be without association with a physical body;<br /> Then, with occasional contact with bodies;<br /> Then, with a fixed contact on one body but exteriorized;<br /> Then, interiorized into a body but easy to exteriorize;<br /> Then, in contact with and interiorized into a body, but withdrawn from the various parts of the body;<br /> Then, obsessively ‘buttered all through the body’;<br /> Then, obsessively and unknowingly drawn down to some small portion of the body, and so forth.</p> <p>“This is the gradient scale which includes inversion and then inversion of the inversion. The auditor will discover preclears are very variable in the matter of exteriorization. Some preclears, even when they have a dark field, exteriorize rather easily. Others, after a great deal of work, are still found to be difficult to exteriorize. The matter of exteriorization is the matter of which level of inversion the preclear is in.</p> <p>“One of the more difficult levels to work is so inverted that he thinks that a thetan is running him. In other words, here is a thetan functioning in a body and actually running it through various covert communication lines, who yet believes he is a body to such an extent that he considers himself, or any life around him to be some other being&#8230;&#8221;</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330116"> 		<div id="comment-330116"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/b38557e51e256dac2907a7dd1f51e808?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/99whitegm' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Path of Buddha</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330116"> 				February 14, 2015 at 8:22 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hi M,<br />     Great response.   I&#8217;m happy you laughed at &#8220;pickled.&#8221; The critical issues boil down to the definition of a body and &#8220;potential&#8221;.<br />      Exteriorization from the body is a step beyond mindfulness which does not apply to Buddhism.  In Scientology, Hubbard talks about the body as an<br /> object.  He does this over and over.  In the scripture that you posted above,<br /> it is a central theme.  Hubbard uses the idea of the &#8220;genetic entity&#8221; as the conductor of the body.  This body is used in transmigration.  This theory fails at the outset because it ends in the dichotomy  of theta and mest.  In original Buddhism the body is a product of physical matter and Karma with a capital &#8220;K&#8221;.  The internal world and the external world are linked together into a unified whole with mind.  The difference in regard to the thetan is related to Hubbard&#8217;s &#8220;potential&#8221;  In other words, the thetan  has the ability to return or transmigrate.  In Buddhism, nibbana or cessation is bliss and it is not necessary to return.<br /> It is &#8220;letting go&#8221;.  Hubbard wanted to keep grasping or clinging in the picture.<br /> You can come up with any scale you want 40.0 or 400.0, you are still stuck in the Max Planck constant.  You could also call it Hubbard&#8217;s paradox.</p> <p>“As it is with a universe, such as the physical universe, so it is with physical bodies. The thetan, who has already gone through the cycle on the universe itself, may be in contact with a physical body in the same order:&#8221;</p> <p>The above merits discussion.<br />     Hubbard separates the universe from the thetan and implies that they go through the same cycle.  In Buddhism, there is an integerated view.  Mind and matter exist.  The idea of the thetan is derived.  It is not primary.  There is<br /> no description of nirvana which includes anything like a thetan or potential.<br /> Think of Buddha&#8217;s definition as a live shell you would find on the beach.<br /> A child not knowing about these animals knows there is something inside but<br /> cannot describe it.  Hubbard does not know what the universe is, but describes it with the thetan.  In reality, what is in the shell and how it was formed is far more complex.  The thetan would be the child drawing conclusions with no understanding.</p> <p>“Space is not necessary to the beingness of a thetan when the thetan is above the tone level of 40.0 and can create space at will. He creates space to have specific beingness. AT 40.0 space and beingness can be considered to be interchangeable. BEINGNESS CAN EXIST WITHOUT ANY ENERGY OR MATTER, WHICH IS TO SAY, WITHOUT TIME [my caps].</p> <p>In Physics, it is not proven that  beingness can exist without time.<br /> What Hubbard is talking about here is theoretical.  There is no experiment that proves this.  You could use quantum physics.  However most of these experiments were done in the 1930&#8217;s and Hubbard does not define them.<br /> They are not proven.  The observer is not defined in science.<br />   If a person wants to accept Hubbard on faith, that is clearly an option.<br /> Beingness without time is a derivative of the exteriorization of the thetan<br /> which is also not proven.  We are into some wild speculation which is beyond science.  These axioms you quote are not convincing.<br />     In Buddhism, it is not important if beingness is &#8220;in time&#8221; or &#8220;out of time&#8221;<br /> The process is more important.  </p> <p>May all pickled beings be well and happy!</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330160"> 		<div id="comment-330160"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330160"> 				February 15, 2015 at 6:46 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hi G,</p> <p>&#8220;May all pickled beings be well and happy!&#8221; You got a hearty lol on that one. <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-bigsmile' title=':D'>:D</span></p> <p>G: &#8220;Beingness without time is a derivative of the exteriorization of the thetan which is also not proven.&#8221;</p> <p>As a matter of fact, there is a lot of scientific evidence of exteriorization (easily found on the internet) in spite of the fact that scientists in general and thus the media (especially in this country) don&#8217;t pay it much heed. Based on this evidence, you essentially made the case for individual beingness (soul/thetan) where you said that from exteriorization one can derive beingness without time. </p> <p>That is actually what I understood Hubbard to mean where he wrote that ABOVE the scale (a scale of physical universe wavelengths) &#8220;beingness can exist without any energy or matter, which is to say, without time.&#8221; </p> <p>More to the point of our overall discussion, the word &#8220;can&#8221; in the above quote seems to me to be the same idea as what you said about nibbana (or nirvana) &#8211; i.e. that &#8220;it is not necessary to return.&#8221;  In other words, &#8220;not necessary&#8221; seems to be another way to say &#8220;can&#8221;. So I am back to seeing different constructs &#8211; which amount to semantical differences only. Which pickles me pink. (Sorry for the corn, but I liked the alliteration. <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-smile' title=':)'>:)</span> )</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330161"> 		<div id="comment-330161"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330161"> 				February 15, 2015 at 6:57 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>One very compelling out-of body (exteriorization) experiment was described by Tom Campbell in his book *My Big TOE* (TOE = Theory of Everything). Campbell is a NASA physicist and a researcher of “consciousness” for several decades. As a scientist, he used scientific protocol in experiments involving his and others&#8217; OOB experiences. He and a research partner named Dennis Mennerich started out being skeptical (but open-minded), as any good scientist would be. They had quite a moment when they got the first proof that their OOB experiences were real. Below is an excerpt from Campbell&#8217;s book *My Big TOE*.</p> <p>—————————<br /> “One of our first experiments was for Dennis and me to take a trip (experience) in the nonphysical together. Our independent descriptions of what we were experiencing should correlate closely if the experience were real and independent of either of us. From the beginning of our training, we had learned to give real-time descriptions of whatever we experienced. A microphone was suspended from the ceiling above each of our heads. What we said was recorded on tape. Dennis and I could not hear each other because we were in separate soundproof chambers.</p> <p>“Dennis and I quickly achieved the appropriate altered state, left our bodies, and met in the nonphysical as planned. It was a long adventure. We went places, saw things, had conversations with each other and with several nonphysical beings we happened to run into along the way.</p> <p>“Bob had let us go a long time before he ended the session and called us back. We pulled off our EEG and GSR electrodes and stumbled out of the darkness into the hallway of the lab.</p> <p>“In the control room, Bob was waiting for us. After a quick exchange, we knew that this would be a good test because we both had experienced many specific interactions. But were they the same interactions? Bob looked at us deadpan. ‘So you two think you were together?’ he asked, trying to sound disappointed. We looked at each other and shrugged our shoulders.</p> <p>“‘Maybe,’ Dennis said tentatively, ‘at least we perceived meeting each other.’</p> <p>“‘Listen to this!’ Bob said emphatically. The tapes, rewound as we disconnected electrodes and climbed out of our chambers, began to roll forward. We sat down and listened. The correlation was astonishing. For almost two hours we sat there with our mouths open, hooting and exclaiming, filling in the details for each other. Bob was now grinning. ‘Now that tells you something, doesn’t it?’ he exclaimed beaming. He was every bit as excited as we were.</p> <p>“I was dumbfounded. There was only one good explanation: THIS STUFF WAS REAL! […]</p> <p>We repeated that experiment with similar results. It wasn’t a phenomenon that depended on the two of us. Nancy Lea and I shared equally astonishing joint experiences. We tried other things as well. We read three and four digit numbers written on a blackboard next to the control room. Somebody would write a random number and we would read it while our bodies lay asleep. Then they would erase it and write another one, and so on and on. We went places – to people’s homes – and saw what they were doing, then called them or talked to them the next day to check it out…” </p> <p>(Thomas Campbell – *My Big TOE*)<br /> —————————-</p> <p>Here’s the link, if you want to continue reading where the above leaves off (the whole book can be read for free on Google books):</p> <p><a href="http://books.google.com/books?id=RYHtBPiZVgsC&#038;pg=PA84&#038;dq=%22trip+%28experience%29+in+the+nonphysical+together%22&#038;hl=en&#038;ei=750HTtqMKsvEswbvp9TbDA&#038;sa=X&#038;oi=book_result&#038;ct=result&#038;resnum=1&#038;ved=0CCsQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&#038;q=%22trip%20(experience)%20in%20the%20nonphysical%20together%22&#038;f=false" rel="nofollow">http://books.google.com/books?id=RYHtBPiZVgsC&#038;pg=PA84&#038;dq=%22trip+%28experience%29+in+the+nonphysical+together%22&#038;hl=en&#038;ei=750HTtqMKsvEswbvp9TbDA&#038;sa=X&#038;oi=book_result&#038;ct=result&#038;resnum=1&#038;ved=0CCsQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&#038;q=%22trip%20(experience)%20in%20the%20nonphysical%20together%22&#038;f=false</a></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330162"> 		<div id="comment-330162"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330162"> 				February 15, 2015 at 7:04 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>p.s. Just to note – “Bob” is Bob Monroe, who at the time was already well known for his book *Journeys out of the Body*. He recruited the two scientists, Tom and Dennis, to do scientific experiments on OOB experiments. He also founded the famous Monroe Institute.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330497"> 		<div id="comment-330497"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/f4dd23d6f380e5693407c8da3aed3807?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">MarkNR</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330497"> 				February 22, 2015 at 4:53 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Good afternoon G. Excellent article you wrote to Marildi.</p> <p>I have spent a few thousand hours investigating this subject and have written many of my observations.  Perhaps you would like to see them.  They are at minimum entertaining, possibly thought provoking.  The information I have was a bit hard won, but I am glad to share.  Maybe you will recognize a few of the principals and can add further detail  and align some of the occurrences.  I am always searching for further understanding.</p> <p>Your assistance would be welcome.<br /> I am continuing with my metallurgical research with the assistance of Marshal Space Flight  Center, and have become the communicator to my family with my mother after her stroke.  But time is a created thing and I have found that to be a valuable skill lately.<br /> Mark</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330228"> 		<div id="comment-330228"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/742817c1603c6e5f9f5086f4763a57b5?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://valkovuddin.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>iamvalkov</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330228"> 				February 17, 2015 at 4:10 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330228#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330228", "330228", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to iamvalkov'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>There are various perspectives possible,  on death.  Here is a book that reflects some American attitudes.  It is a largely unexamined subject,  compared to some other cultures.   Look at the traditional Japaness attitudes towards death and suicide in particular.  That was a culture in which suicide was actually institutionalized and called for under some circumstances.    What I am saying is,  a culture&#8217;s attitiudes towards death and suicide in particular,  usually constitute a &#8220;bubble&#8221; of its own,  apart from any &#8220;objective&#8221; reality of death.  I don&#8217;t think we know much about what happens,  and this makes us susceptible to &#8220;stories&#8221; about it.    Early Christians were notoriously fearless of death,  as are today&#8217;s &#8220;Islamic&#8221; suicide bombers.    They were disliked by secular rulers then,  and are just as disliked by today&#8217;s powers-that-be,  because not fearing death, they are difficult or impossible to control.   Even in recent history,  was it not Patrick Henry who said &#8220;Give me Liberty, or give me death!&#8221; ?<br /> Hubbard did write a funeral service that I liked,  because it validates the idea that the person is not entirely &#8220;dead and gone&#8221; but has moved on into the future.   Its a comforting thought.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov even depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330230"> id="li-comment-329212"> 		<div id="comment-329212"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' Miscavige has mental/social issues.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329302"> 		<div id="comment-329302"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/dd0266a358d284fbeaba203b4c0f7f11?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">threefeetback</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329302"> 				February 3, 2015 at 9:31 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329302#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329302", "329302", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to threefeetback'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hubbard: more problems than his pop pyschology or Problems Release can ever resolve. you are finally there&#8230;. hope you remember all those deleted messages&#8230;.. but&#8230;. so glad you are here, welcome Marty.</p> <p>Big hello from LRHs Bulgravia.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329218"> 		<div id="comment-329218"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/610112c9fcc9b657498443eb352a5899?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">No Standard Tech</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329218"> 				February 3, 2015 at 12:35 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329218#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329218", "329218", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to No Standard Tech'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>@rogers100. As a Libertarian I respect your religious beliefs and your right to speak freely of them. I also respect the rights of others to speak freely about anything they wish to comment on. Yeah, things get messy when free speech is practiced, but freedom by its very nature is messy. If one values freedom, one has to learn to tolerate all that freedom others are exercising too. Or one could just live in a neat and tidy tyranny if that is what they prefer. Having said all that, I would like to say this about the standard tech you mentioned. I got into Scientology via DMSMH back in the 70s. That book promised eidetic memory when Clear was reached.  It also promised alleviation from all psychosomatic ills. After 30 years  of &#8220;standard tech&#8221; I never even came close to eidetic memory.  And I have the same psychosomatic illnesses I was hoping to deal with back in the 70s.  When you say people are &#8220;winning&#8221; with standard tech, that is just too vague for me. I had specific, clear-cut gains I was going for based on promises from Hubbard, yet these were never forthcoming despite lots and lots and lots and lots of auditing (through the OT levels by the way), including tons of repairs, O/W pulling, PTS handlings etc etc etc. Sure, I had &#8220;wins&#8221; all the time whereby I was temporarily elated. However, those specific goals never happened and I justified the lack of achievement of those specific goals for literally decades.  But no longer.  I am sorry to have to question &#8220;standard tech&#8221;. But with all due respect to you and your beliefs, I do.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330232"> 		<div id="comment-330232"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/742817c1603c6e5f9f5086f4763a57b5?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://valkovuddin.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>iamvalkov</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330232"> 				February 17, 2015 at 4:20 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330232#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330232", "330232", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to iamvalkov'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I think &#8220;standard tech&#8221; ought to be studied without regard for what Hubbard &#8220;promised&#8221; it would deliver,  but objectively as to what it actually does deliver.  What changes of state does it actually produce?  That to me is the main question.   I have used assists, for example, on people who had never heard of scientology,  and gotten good results.   So clearly,  often, something does happen.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330264"> 		<div id="comment-330264"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330264"> 				February 17, 2015 at 8:06 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330264#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330264", "330264", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>One needs to investigate what really works. of mindfulness.</p> <p>.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" iamvalkov'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Marty has actually addressed that.  He never said there was nothing of value in Scientology,  just that it was very difficult to sift out the wheat from the chaff, to such an extent that he thought it was probably not worth recommending to most people,  because help and wisdom were available in less contaminated forms.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire I have never found a more powerful tool for doing so. Even though there was an auditor there I was using the tool &#8211; not the auditor. From this causative viewpoint i have discovered amazing things. It has led to an amazingly successful life.</p> <p>That doesn&#8217;t mean I subscribe to scientology &#8220;beliefs&#8221;. There is a fantastic amount of BS connected to the subject. It just means that I have found it to be a very powerful and valuable tool.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" 	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329261"> 		<div id="comment-329261"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/c1b1d7db0f52bb43958512a6fd5ade03?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">sara</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329261"> 				February 3, 2015 at 4:00 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' sara'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>This is then the real &#8216;Truth Revealed&#8217;.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329262"> 		<div id="comment-329262"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/29dcfeba3e87700f98744ea6a73bf8a6?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Another Thought</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329262"> 				February 3, 2015 at 4:04 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329262#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329262", "329262", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Another Thought'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Not wrong at all on any of this. Perhaps I would add that for the vast majority of those still in and many who are out, that the &#8220;game&#8221; of Scn. is having these &#8220;mysteries&#8221; revealed to one as they progress.</p> <p>1. The &#8220;Prison Earth&#8221; idea is expressed in one&#8217;s training as early as the first auditor course one does. It is strongly bookend-ed by information on the ARC=U, session procedures, etc., &#8211; but it is still an indoctrination item regards what things are wrong with a person.<br /> 2. Xenu never comes up until one is well into their progress into higher levels and training. However, those that &#8220;know&#8221; are well-trained to generally keep their mouth shut and present themselves as &#8220;knowing the mystery&#8221; below what is wrong with who they are talking to. I&#8217;ve heard this expressed as an ingenious trap, and the fact of hearing this and such statements in conversations with the intiated leave one feeling that there is something to know and drives one to the goal. So, again, another indoctrination to continuing up to discover the mystery.<br /> 3. &#8220;Psychs&#8221; being the root of all evil is heavily promoted and a firmly held belief, and a strongly run indoctrinational point very quickly for those who are new to the subject.<br /> 4. Hubbard&#8217;s &#8220;discovery&#8221; of the mysteries, and development of the only technology to walk through the construct is another strong indoctrination in his &#8220;Keeping Scientology Working&#8221; writings. Reinforced each time a new development is announced, in most technical writings on the subject, and so on.<br /> 5. &#8220;Behaving as Ron&#8221;, the most blatant example of this indoctrination is how he recommends handling a post in an organization or otherwise. &#8220;What would Ron do?&#8221;<br /> 6. &#8220;Enemies&#8221; are firmly established by his writings, but most specifically covered in his &#8220;Conditions Formulas&#8221; works and the Suppressive Persons, Potential Trouble Source writings. To the latter, again, a fairly early piece of church indoctrination.<br /> 7. The technology itself, I am personally only beginning to see the hypnotic aspects of it, although I do have some reality on the &#8220;pop psychology&#8221; reference. In short, what I have presently come to understand is that the whole &#8220;present time&#8221; aspects are possibly the most theraputic aspects of anything Hubbard wrote, which I have also found are expressed countless times in many self-help and religious works, as well as sport and artistic fields. &#8220;Being in the moment&#8221;, &#8220;being in the zone&#8221;, etc. Sitting down and interiorizing on past upsets, transgressions, etc. to then change one&#8217;s mind about them to then &#8220;come to present time&#8221;, from an outsider point of view, seems a long way around the mulberry bush to simply just handling the present environment as it is. Lots of time was wasted by me to find irrelevant root causes to things I should and could simply handle in the now. Ultimately I find life taught me a much better lesson than Hubbard could, and to that, I am much more fulfilled as a result. However, I begin to really feel for those who lost or weaked their abilities to simply just have their full attention on their environment at will, and those that bought the promise that auditing will restore it. Each time they buy, is another step to &#8220;resolving the ultimate mystery&#8221;.<br /> 8. Unfortunately this is so true as a working practice, I am hard pressed to argue about this not being a &#8220;belief&#8221;. In my own area, I have seen suicides, persons who are to a significant degree &#8220;undersireable&#8221; or not qualified to access higher levels of the Promise of Scn. due to their physical being, sexual orientation, or even age. &#8220;They need to drop their body&#8221; is a common refrain. Ultimately, were I pressed to determine why this was so common in my own area, I would have to identify those factors in the works of Hubbard and how he desired public indoctrinated. Hence, yes, a belief and faith in what he wrote being the only answer to the problems noted above.</p> <p>Not a pretty nor politically correct distillation of the core of Scientology, but personally resonating and true, none-the-less.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329351"> 		<div id="comment-329351"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329351"> 				February 4, 2015 at 9:57 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329351#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329351", "329351", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hubbard was intetriorized into &#8220;I&#8221;, and Scientology is an expression of that. Thinking in terms of &#8220;terminals&#8221; and not in terms of &#8220;processes&#8221; is a symptom of this interiorization. Focusing on &#8220;what&#8221; and not on &#8220;how&#8221; or &#8220;why&#8221; is also a symptom of this interiorization. And so we have a terminal named &#8220;Xenu&#8221; in Scientology. It is much more solid than the terminal called &#8220;God&#8221; in Christianity.</p> <p>Most rational is the view of &#8220;I&#8221; and &#8220;God&#8221; as a process in Eastern philosophies.<br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329352"> 		<div I was not aware of spiritual interference. The whole space opera story I really didn&#8217;t attach much interest or significance to.  It was the idea of extending further into the supernatural that interested me.</p> <p>To be able to step into the invisible and be at home in that space. </p> <p>When I took a look there were a lot of interesting things to see. Can&#8217;t say I have ever thought of &#8220;BT&#8217;s&#8221; although I have used the word for the benefit of communicating to an auditor.  They were not part of my body, they were part of my soul. There were people that were part of my soul. A lot of them, in a better place than I was. I didn&#8217;t feel any need to distance myself from that, I mean,it just didn&#8217;t bother me.  Some were there because of unfinished conversations. Most were there because of the laws of ARC, and occupying the same space for that reason. Some were just earlier versions of me, that I parked in a closet. Per the laws of ARC you know, you occupy the same space through affinity. Not through engrams.  That is what was true for me. But if you loved someone, and you were pushed off a cliff together,and you were both killed, do you think that could really create distance between you?</p> <p>Yes,it is sometimes noisy in your space when you can hear one another&#8217;s thoughts. That noise comforts me. I have learned a lot from these conversations. A lot of valuable information.</p> <p>Hubbard said magicians use spirits to do their bidding, as a goal.  I can see how he thought that, but it is not a goal for everyone involved in magic. I don&#8217;t do that myself.</p> <p>You find many people on Earth that say they are doing &#8220;God&#8217;s&#8221; bidding.</p> <p>I feel there many Gods. And I care to remain in favor with them.</p> <p>The here and now is not very relevant to me. I have someplace I am going to be,in the future.  And where I am going to be about 1,000 years from now, is important to me.</p> <p>I am just gathering an education.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329934"> 		<div id="comment-329934"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329934"> 				February 9, 2015 at 4:54 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>If the word &#8220;BT&#8221; is replaced by the word &#8220;inconsistency&#8221; one will get better results on upper OT Level. See, it wasn&#8217;t so ill intended as you thought.</p> <p>Any looking is better than no looking. Being attuned to and being cognitive of the inner world of limitless imaginings and states of being, the endless filters of mind that color our true nature as raw power, light and being is truly a hero&#8217;s journey indeed. As Joseph Campbell has stated,&#8221;Some mystics drown in the mystery and some become good swimmers&#8221; (paraphrase)</p> <p>So for you the OT 3 materials were a metaphor or a good excuse to go diving inwards and look?</p> <p>If I&#8217;m getting you correctly, OT3 materials are not literal. Xenu was simply an idea of Hubbard&#8217;s from his Sci Fi imagination? And 75,000,000 years ago, just his imagination.</p> <p>Do you believe Hubbard believed it? And in your opinion, could running this level and assigning cause to one&#8217;s problems on this level create distortions in one&#8217;s capacity to directly perceive truth? If in fact what is being run is not true.</p> <p>That is, if our problems are not our own, but something outside of ourselves, or more exactly, some alien creature attached to us.</p> <p>Can you see that this approach can be the cause of mental delusions for some? Believing in imaginings as realities?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329979"> 		<div id="comment-329979"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329979"> 				February 10, 2015 at 11:59 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I understand there are people who think they should be protected from radical ideas.  That they should be illegal.  It&#8217;s a big planet. I think most of those people do gravitate to areas where ideas are closely monitored.  There are still many places like that. Not sure if the entire planet should be lock down.  South Korea and places like that provide for people en danged by ideas and communication that is &#8220;out of the box&#8221;. Not sure what your thoughts are on past or future lives. This is taboo in many places also.  People will find what is comfortable as time goes on. Where they belong. Yesterday is really part of &#8220;past life&#8221; in some forbidden alleys. Ideas can be very terrifying to some people.  Some people think the freedom in the U.S. is a plague. For them, it is.</p> <p>Some people are just in cross purposes. I wouldn&#8217;t stand in the way of anyone seeking shelter from ideas they consider dangerous.  I just don&#8217;t wan the burden of inheriting their fear. I don&#8217;t care to attack ideas. They are things put out there the same as traffic lights.  But if you were traveling down a road in 1329 and came upon a traffic light, I am sure it could have been a very terrifying experience.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329980"> 		<div id="comment-329980"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329980"> 				February 10, 2015 at 12:07 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>If you have ideas that counter other ideas. New ideas about it have been laid on the table.  That changed the course of life in many countries.</p> <p>I have faith in my fellow man. At night, when no one is around, every night. Out comes the bottle. Some think it&#8217;s like medicine, but it only corrupts.</p> <p>The Himalayan Musk Deer secretes a strong perfume in the middle of it&#8217;s belly. It smells it and goes mad trying to find it&#8217;s source. The nose cannot reach that part of it&#8217;s underbelly and goes searching here and there, outside of itself.</p> <p>It gets agitated and goes crazy trying to find the source. Some have flung themselves off a cliff to their demise in that mad attempt to locate the source.</p> <p>Human beings are like that. </p> <p>It was always within us, what we are looking for. </p> <p>When the student is ready, the teacher appears. The true Preceptor leads the student to his/her own under belly through a practice that reverses the search lights of the senses back into the source from whence we have come . </p> <p>The source of all we are looking for. Immortality, bliss, power, true knowledge and wisdom, guidance. It&#8217;s there for the taking. It is like you are insisting that the question, &#8220;Do you still beat your wife?&#8221; be answered with a yes or a no.</p> <p>Xenu and BTs seems to provide a certain framework for auditing at OT3. It is not the belief in this framework that produces actual auditing results. But some people literally start to believe in that framework and lose their rationality. </p> <p>This may not happen with everybody though. Some may not believe in the framework of Xenu and BTs, but may just find that there are some auditing results.</p> <p>What produces actual auditing results (without the hypnotic &#8220;feel good&#8221; effect) is mindfulness. There is this factor of mindfulness in scientology auditing, but it occurs very infrequently right in the geginning of one&#8217;s auditing, or never at all.</p> <p>Personally, using the framework of Xenu and BTs is completely unnecessary. It is a product of convoluted mind of Hubbard. Straight application of the Scientific Method with mindfulness is much more effective. Please see</p> <p><a href="http://vinaire.me/2015/01/19/solving-real-life-problems/" rel="nofollow"><b>Solving Real-Life Problems</b></a><br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-8 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329841"> 		<div id="comment-329841"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/ecd994d7f918147adaa53571480babdb?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Brian</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329841"> 				February 8, 2015 at 12:54 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329841#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329841", "329841", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Brian'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>&#8220;you are generating in others a fear of being misinterpreted&#8221;</p> <p>Sometimes I seek out being misinterpreted so I can deal with the fear. Once the fear is gone, there is no more need to be understood by others. It is a wonderful practice. Then it it easy to love those who think we are jerks because we realize that all experience is self generated. Then we don&#8217;t take others personal issues so personally any more.</p> <p>But in Hubbard&#8217;s Lientology it is considered powerful to be misinterpreted. Being misduplicated in Scientology has been given the power to take away one&#8217;s &#8220;wins&#8221;. </p> <p>How certain is a certainty that can be invalidated by know it all fools like me?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329886"> 		<div id="comment-329886"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/29dcfeba3e87700f98744ea6a73bf8a6?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Another Thought</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329886"> 				February 9, 2015 at 1:03 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329886#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329886", "329886", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Another Thought'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Who cares if she does, and what would it matter if she did? I really don&#8217;t know Karen that much, but she, as was Mark and Mike, quite helpful and instrumental in my settling myself when I decided to leave after a few decades myself. She offered to audit me, which was a rather soothing balm as I went through what essentially was my withdrawal period. Though I never took her up on the offer, just the fact of knowing that helped me dramatically, I think. My point was mainly that I found she served a worthwhile purpose in being ready to service what I though I needed as I settled out into my life without Scn, and I am sure there are many, many more like myself.</p> <p>How many others on the edge, but still indoctrinated heavily into the Hubbard system Mark summarized above can be released from it by persons who can service in accordance to those procedures while at the same time, opening their clients&#8217; eyes to the idea it might all be a placebo after all. So, I&#8217;m a little protective of this valuable potential in forums like this because this really can the the trickle that becomes the flood of people stepping away from the bs.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330192"> 		<div id="comment-330192"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/ecd994d7f918147adaa53571480babdb?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Brian</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330192"> 				February 16, 2015 at 11:36 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330192#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330192", "330192", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Brian'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Got it Another Thought. Your characterization and judgment  of my question says more about you Oracle. It&#8217;s only a question.</p> <p>I&#8217;ve found it interesting that folks can&#8217;t even say his name. It&#8217;s like Lord Valdomort in Harry Potter and people can&#8217;t speak his name.</p> <p>Oracle, I truly believe this happens because of years and years and years of being asked the question, &#8220;have you ever had a critical thought of L Ron Hubbard.&#8221;</p> <p>Think of it. Year after year, knowing full well that if your secret judgment or disagreement was picked up by the needle it potentially meant:</p> <p>1) word clearing<br /> 2) Ethics<br /> 3) Declare<br /> 4) being declared PTS<br /> 5) If declared loosing family<br /> 6) if declared loosing friends<br /> 7) if declared loosing your &#8220;only road to spiritual freedom&#8221;<br /> 8) if working for or with Scientologists, loosing your job<br /> 9) being seen as an SP by family and friends.</p> <p>All of these fears being cemented in association with criticism of Hubbard. So if you do not want to experience any of the above. Keep your mouth shut and deny what your feel and perceive. Better yet, if you do have these thoughts, it&#8217;s because of your evil intentions. You are evil for criticizing Ron. </p> <p>I have felt that blow back. But it&#8217;s fine. It&#8217;s all good. It&#8217;s good practice for me to be centered when folks think I&#8217;m a jerk. Great learning and I appreciate every one.</p> <p>No wonder people have a hard time. The command to never have a critical thought is laid in like cement.</p> <p>The outcome of this hypnotic command is to explode with anger towards critics Ron. It is diabolical Oracle: evil beyond a doubt.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329919"> 		<div id="comment-329919"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/0badc5640af149979f85ab7346205e34?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/jumpingjack' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Jumping Jack</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329919"> 				February 9, 2015 at 2:09 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329919#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329919", "329919", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Jumping Jack'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>So well said. If you had God power could you use it responsibly, if the universe were inhabited by countless Gods whose “will” would dominate, still here witnessing</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329308"> 		<div id="comment-329308"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/fd6b38d53f70dc698efd193ba2ae7c12?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">scilonschools</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329308"> 				February 3, 2015 at 10:18 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329308#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329308", "329308", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to scilonschools'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>IF you can keep your head when all about you<br /> Are losing theirs and blaming it on you,<br /> If you can trust yourself when all men doubt you,<br /> But make allowance for their doubting too;<br /> If you can wait and not be tired by waiting,<br /> Or being lied about, don&#8217;t deal in lies,<br /> Or being hated, don&#8217;t give way to hating,<br /> And yet don&#8217;t look too good, nor talk too wise:</p> <p>If you can dream &#8211; and not make dreams your master;<br /> If you can think &#8211; and not make thoughts your aim;<br /> If you can meet with Triumph and Disaster<br /> And treat those two impostors just the same;<br /> If you can bear to hear the truth you&#8217;ve spoken<br /> Twisted by knaves to make a trap for fools,<br /> Or watch the things you gave your life to, broken,<br /> And stoop and build &#8217;em up with worn-out tools:</p> <p>If you can make one heap of all your winnings<br /> And risk it on one turn of pitch-and-toss,<br /> And lose, and start again at your beginnings<br /> And never breathe a word about your loss;<br /> If you can force your heart and nerve and sinew<br /> To serve your turn long after they are gone,<br /> And so hold on when there is nothing in you<br /> Except the Will which says to them: &#8216;Hold on!&#8217;</p> <p>If you can talk with crowds and keep your virtue,<br /> &#8216; Or walk with Kings &#8211; nor lose the common touch,<br /> if neither foes nor loving friends can hurt you,<br /> If all men count with you, but none too much;<br /> If you can fill the unforgiving minute<br /> With sixty seconds&#8217; worth of distance run,<br /> Yours is the Earth and everything that&#8217;s in it,<br /> And &#8211; which is more &#8211; you&#8217;ll be a Man, my son!</p> </div>  	</div><!-- I thought it was clear as a bell. But this is why I got labeled &#8220;reasonable&#8221;.  But it comes down to mathematics doesn&#8217;t it?</p> <p>If the purpose of the Sea Org is to put ethics in on the planet. And ethics is removing all &#8220;counter intention&#8221; from the environment, and then, all &#8220;other intention&#8221; from the environment. Who will be left in the environment?</p> <p>I mean, if you are sleeping and you are woken by a siren, that is counter intention. Traffic is counter intention. Other intention.</p> <p>Counter intention and other intention is also known as co existance.</p> <p>If you lived in a world with no counter intention and no other intention, what kind of world would you live in?</p> <p>When you think about purpose, you have to have some idea of why you would align yourself with a purpose right?</p> <p>The purpose of ethics then, within the Scientology framework, and the purpose of the Sea Org, is that no counter intention or other intention exists.</p> <p>But if there is only one other person on the planet besides yourself, you are going to have other intention.</p> <p>So, this entire premise that the ethics structure is built on, in the Church, is anti social in itself.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li
