About this whole ethics subject and the way it is set up.  And it seems very clear to me about what it is. But I got slammed by a &#8220;KSW fanatic&#8221; as &#8220;railing against ethics and justice&#8221; (therefore labeled whatever&#8230;)</p> <p>Well, what about theta being repelled by entheta?  Doesn&#8217;t that count for anything?</p> <p>See, you can rail against the entire system. But it doesn&#8217;t unfold, the pieces that do not work, unless you pull a little string.</p> <p>What is so theta and in ethics about the KSW series? Look at the purposes a person is supposed to align themselves with that.</p> <p>Hammer out of existence ?</p> <p>Closing the door?</p> <p>Hubbard states, &#8220;I know what a group of people will do and how insane they will go in accepting unworkable &#8216;technology&#8217;.</p> <p>How about that unworkable ethics technology? How insane have people gone in that group accepting unworkable ethics technology? The Orgs are empty. The Sea Org has made more SP&#8217;s than Clears!!!!!!!!!  There is more counter intention towards the Church than ever because of the people that got set up for losses with the ethics sections of the Church.</p> <p>The leader of the Organization is running domestic terrorism crews!</p> <p>I am not railing against ethics and justice!!!  I am railing against unworkable technology!!  Anti social technology.</p> <p>This environment is a CO OPERATIVE.  You can&#8217;t just remove others from it because they have counter or other intentions.</p> <p>If you can&#8217;t through ARC and reasoning, bring people over to your side to support you, what does that say about your own communication skills? The product you are selling. </p> <p>Police and soldiers do not have the same effect on people they did 50 years ago.  It is no longer a police power or a soldier power civilization for the majority of the planet.</p> <p>This is not the same planet Hubbard lived on when he wrote these notes and ideas.</p> <p>And isn&#8217;t &#8221; removing all counter intention and other intention from the environment&#8221;, the exact complaint against Xenu?</p> <p>The purpose of the Sea Org aligns with Xenu!</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-oraclemysticism odd alt depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330245"> 		<div id="comment-330245"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/oraclemysticism' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>The Oracle</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330245"> 				February 17, 2015 at 6:53 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330245#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330245", "330245", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to The Oracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>And, I mean, O.K., the ethics formulas are fine. That is very helpful. Except for the lists you are given to choose from.  &#8220;harm attack or suppress&#8221;.  What if your item is not on this list?  What if one of those just doesn&#8217;t feel right for the situation?  You still have to pick one or all of them to graduate up!  A person should come up with their OWN idea of how they want to deal with it.</p> <p>And then there are the comm evs. That doesn&#8217;t work because by the time the comm ev members sit down, they are all out ruds on the person being comm eved. In fact, from what I have seen, by the time they convene, they have already decided the person they are comm eving, should be harmed attacked and suppressed!  If they are in a lower condition, and they have to be at least be in doubt about this person or they wouldn&#8217;t be comm eving him, </p> <p>Ordering people for sec checks?  Public, at their own expense so the org can feel secure?  That&#8217;s crazy. </p> <p>You see, so much of it doesn&#8217;t help the person or the group at all.  </p> <p>Yes, there are situations. There are sociopaths. Information about their treason and hidden agendas and sabotage and their usual social intercourse needs to be shared for damage control.  But these are rare.<br /> They are discovered rather quickly as one for one they are pathological liars. They need to be to cover their tracks.</p> <p>But if you groom someone to unmock anyone in their path who has counter or other intentions, aren&#8217;t you creating sociopaths? </p> <p>And why is it considered technology at all?  It&#8217;s  rules. customs ,traditions and ceremonies. I mean, it&#8217;s SOOO bad that in the ethics book under &#8220;Rewards and Penalties&#8221;,  there are NO rewards listed!!!</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-yvonneschick even thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329314"> 		<div id="comment-329314"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/b03adc3dcf60513e0bb220bee6a3cf4e?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/yvonneschick' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>yvonneschick</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329314"> 				February 3, 2015 at 10:47 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329314#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329314", "329314", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to yvonneschick'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thank you, Marty, for once again summarizing the crux of the matter in a concise and understandable few words.</p> <p>Since I used this forum to announce my leaving the cult of cofs four years ago, and given Marty&#8217;s profound summary here, I would like to update my status. I do not consider myself a scientologist; independent or otherwise. Yes, I had gains while participating in scientology. I also was very accomplished in life before scn and had many gains in other practices as well. I consider myself to be a person who could obtain gains in life because that was my viewpoint on life &#8211; gains to be had. </p> <p>Four years ago, I still retained respect for Ron Hubbard. Now I see him very differently.  Time and investigation and feeling safe to evaluate for myself, I see LRH and his probably intentions differently. </p> <p>Life is good.  Joy and happiness are here for my taking. Kindness is my religious practice.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329347"> 		<div id="comment-329347"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/99042b27e92ea8b8a84572067b693908?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Eileen</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329347"> 				February 4, 2015 at 8:48 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329347#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329347", "329347", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Eileen'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Congratulations! Berry</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329322"> 				February 4, 2015 at 12:09 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329322#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329322", "329322", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Victoria A. Berry'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Lots of integral info in a nutshell article, when they can&#8217;t convey anything meaningful in a full page ad. Hate seeing this waste.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329323"> 		<div id="comment-329323"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/cf9852fde6b900f07e118db09bf76344?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Crepuscule</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329323"> 				February 4, 2015 at 12:19 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329323#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329323", "329323", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Crepuscule'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>BINGO!</p> <p>Next, and final stage: all these beliefs were systematically implanted into the minds of Scientologists as a distraction from the original, single intention of extracting cash from them.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329325"> 		<div id="comment-329325"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://i2.wp.com/graph.facebook.com/v2.2/638982191/picture?q=type%3Dlarge&#038;resize=48%2C48' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.facebook.com/638982191' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Dan Locke</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329325"> 				February 4, 2015 at 12:34 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329325#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329325", "329325", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Dan Locke'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>A good perspective to read this from is to pay special attention to the sentence that precedes these points: &#8220;In plain English, here are the core religious beliefs of scientology&#8230;&#8221;</p> <p>Almost all that follows are observations of what Scientologists believe to be true, save point #7. People who believe point #7 to be true could not any longer be Scientologists, could they? That would be like a Christian saying &#8220;I am a Christian, even though I only am a Christian because the writings and practices were carefully designed and administered so as to lead me and other Christians to wholeheartedly accept and live according to my beliefs.&#8221; </p> <p>So, I think an earlier commenter (aotc) here was right in saying that #7 is what Marty (and many others here) believe to be true. Someone dissed aotc for that, but the disser was not as careful a reader as aotc. </p> <p>One of the core beliefs I have not seen mentioned here is, I think, the principle and most core belief of Scientology. That belief is &#8220;Ron is 100% right and none of the tech can be argued against.&#8221; This smothered out of existence a &#8220;belief&#8221; put forth in Scientology Zero materials: &#8220;What is true for you is what you have observed yourself to be true&#8221;, etc. This essay on personal integrity worked as a good TR4 to the newcomers&#8217; qualms when they first get in, but, after not very long, that stable datum was shaken and was replaced with KSW 1 and KSW 2 (Safeguarding Technology). It&#8217;s never, ever been right for a  true Scientology believer to consider for a moment that Ron could be wrong in anything, as far as I can tell. </p> <p>But the belief that Ron was always right and the &#8220;only one&#8221; who could be Source is the most important belief of all to inspect and then discard. Once a person does that, he can assign relative importances to all the various data of Scientology. That&#8217;s how I can still value much of Scientology, and disregard, or relegate to the trash heap, so much that is not of value or is harmful. </p> <p>We might liken Scientology to the notes of some  brilliant 18th century chemist who managed some break throughs. Trained chemists now might still marvel at some of this fellow&#8217;s discoveries and insight, but blush or shake their heads at other things once asserted as truth, that just did not turn out to be so. </p> <p>While looking at the other points, remember Marty introduces them as &#8220;religious beliefs&#8221;. Remember the etymology of religion &#8211; it&#8217;s from the Latin &#8220;religare&#8221; &#8211; a binding together. It&#8217;s things that a group or people hold together to be true. </p> <p>There is little or no distinction in this post or in the comments here between the beliefs of Ron and Scientologists and the technology of auditing. And it would be of more benefit in this discussion if such a distinction were made. </p> <p>Consider: </p> <p>a)if a person were to be audited all the way from Life Repair, through his Grades and Power Processing, even up to OT 2, and </p> <p>b) was not subjected to the indoctrination that is continually brought to a student or parishioner by virtue of course materials, books, policy letters, registrars, promotional pieces and events, then </p> <p>c) he might not believe ANY of the things brought up my Marty here. Consider: <b><i>He might not even have thought any of those things, let alone believe in them, without those sorts of influence.</i></b> </p> <p><i>These beliefs are not borne out of realizations attendant to auditing sessions. They are borne out of indoctrination brought to people by course materials, books, policy letters, registrars, ethics officers, FSMs, promo pieces, taped lectures, confidential briefings and upper level materials, etc.</i></p> <p>That may be why there are still a few people refusing to succumb to the ex-Church people who now want to lump all of their Scientology experience together and call it &#8220;bad&#8221;. </p> <p>I think that it might be therapeutic for some here to sit alone at a table and write out answers to these questions: &#8220;Have I benefited from Scientology?&#8221; &#8220;If so, how?&#8221;</p> <p>I&#8217;ve done that several times and it&#8217;s always been fun. You can call that hypnotism, if you like, you and John Atack can call it &#8220;increased levels of dopamine&#8221;, if you like. You can call it whatever you want. </p> <p>Call it &#8220;hypnotism&#8221; though, and I will respond with, &#8220;Yes, and what, exactly, is not hypnotism?&#8221; Cheering for your favorite Super Bowl team or anything else is a sort of hypnotism. Having good manners or a certain way of addressing elders is a programming, in some respects. Much of life is, for most of us, spent in a sort of hypnotized state. The red pill or the blue? Even the red pill is an illusion. </p> <p>If you are one of the blessed few for which life is not at least in part a hypnotic trance, I kneel before you in awe of your awesomeness. Cause baby, you&#8217;ve got it. </p> <p>Increased levels of dopamine? Running does that, and so does getting laid. These things are now wrong? Should we just be injecting ourselves with the stuff instead, or working to run or have sex without having increased levels of dopamine? </p> <p>I begrudge the use of the term &#8220;pop psychology&#8221; to dismiss any subject. I would not want to put ANY subject under that umbrella, not even bumper sticker stuff or facebook feel good memes. I don&#8217;t think of Marty as being snarky, but that feels snarky to me. In being described, the subject deserves better than that. </p> <p>Scientology has not been asserted in to our lives. It&#8217;s not some cruel demonic inky black stuff that engulfed us that we now have to exorcise from our lives. It&#8217;s a subject that we thrived in, toiled under, found thrills in, and feel betrayed by. It&#8217;s a lot like every other area of life. </p> <p>So, why be miserable about it? I know Jews that whine about their upbringing, and Catholics too. I think that less than 1% of us have been brought up properly. And we&#8217;re assaulted by undue influence on a daily basis by marketers and politicians. </p> <p>So what? There&#8217;s always been something rough going on here, making life a bit of a bitch. Once it was saber tooth tigers and tar pits. Now we have politicians, marketers and religions. About the same thing, I think.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329365"> 		<div id="comment-329365"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329365"> 				February 4, 2015 at 12:57 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329365#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329365", "329365", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p><b>SCIENTOLOGY (minus) INDOCTRINATION &amp; id="li-comment-329570"> 		<div id="comment-329570"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I hope you have a more balanced view now, instead of going from one extreme to another extreme.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329415"> 		<div id="comment-329415"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/cf9852fde6b900f07e118db09bf76344?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Crepuscule</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329415"> 				February 4, 2015 at 9:55 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329415#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329415", "329415", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Crepuscule'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><blockquote><p> . . . There is little or no distinction in this post or in the comments here between the beliefs of Ron and Scientologists and the technology of auditing. And it would be of more benefit in this discussion if such a distinction were made. </p> <p>Consider:</p> <p>a)if a person were to be audited all the way from Life Repair, through his Grades and Power Processing, even up to OT 2, and</p> <p>b) was not subjected to the indoctrination that is continually brought to a student or parishioner by virtue of course materials, books, policy letters, registrars, promotional pieces and events, then</p> <p>c) he might not believe ANY of the things brought up my Marty here. Consider: He might not even have thought any of those things, let alone believe in them, without those sorts of influence.</p> <p>These beliefs are not borne out of realizations attendant to auditing sessions. They are borne out of indoctrination brought to people by course materials, books, policy letters, registrars, ethics officers, FSMs, promo pieces, taped lectures, confidential briefings and upper level materials, etc . . . </p></blockquote> <p>It would appear that your consideration is invalid in that it seeks to draw a differentiation where none exists. </p> <p>Sure, by applying just the technology of auditing, a person may well not have certainty or even know about any of the items mentioned in the OP. However, if a person was subject to auditing outside of the cult infrastructure up to OT 2, that person would still be required to believe lots and lots of L Ron Hubbard&#8217;s bullshit, just as the auditor does. Things like the &#8220;reactive mind&#8221;. There is no evidence for a &#8220;reactive mind&#8221;, so how can anyone insist it exists? The most likely background to the concept of the &#8220;reactive mind&#8221; is that its a perverse fusion of Freud&#8217;s &#8220;unconscious mind&#8221; and Korzybski&#8217;s theory of identification. Freud only ever used his concept as a model for understanding, whereas L Ron Hubbard insists that the reactive mind is an actuality, and then he jammed in things called &#8220;engrams&#8221;.  It doesn&#8217;t take too many keystrokes to source scientific evidence &#8211; which L Ron Hubbard helped compile &#8211; confirming there is no such thing as an &#8220;engram&#8221; as defined by L Ron Hubbard. Then there&#8217;s the e-meter which, according to the technology of auditing. &#8220;. . . passes a tiny current through the preclear&#8217;s body. This current is influenced by the mental masses, pictures, circuits and machinery. When the unclear pc thinks of something, these mental items shift and this registers on the meter . . . &#8221; Again, this is utter bullshit. The e-meter certainly measures something, but it is not what L Ron Hubbard says it is even if L Ron Hubbard believed it when he wrote it. </p> <p>And so it goes on. Bit by bit, gradient by gradient: the auditor&#8217;s attempt to slowly inject L Ron Hubbard&#8217;s beliefs, which the auditor has adopted as their own, into the mind of the PC. Accordingly, there can be no differentiation between the beliefs of L Ron Hubbard and the technology of auditing.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329459"> 		<div id="comment-329459"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov odd alt depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330239"> 		<div id="comment-330239"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/742817c1603c6e5f9f5086f4763a57b5?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://valkovuddin.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>iamvalkov</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330239"> 				February 17, 2015 at 5:28 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330239#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330239", "330239", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to iamvalkov'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I&#8217;m sorry,  but if you don&#8217;t know what the emeter measures, then how do you know it does not measure what Hubbard said it measured?</p> <p>Also,  &#8220;reactive mind&#8221; is as good a term as any in psychology or psychoanalysis.  It pretty clearly differentiates functions taking place &#8220;below the level of awareness of a person&#8221;,  from those that are consciously monitored/initiated.   Anyone who has observed/studied post-hypnotic suggestion can see that.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330338"> 		<div id="comment-330338"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/cf9852fde6b900f07e118db09bf76344?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Crepuscule</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330338"> 				February 19, 2015 at 10:16 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330338#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330338", "330338", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Crepuscule'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><blockquote><p> . . . you don’t know what the emeter measures, then how do you know it does not measure what Hubbard said it measured?</p></blockquote> <p>Science. </p> <blockquote><p> . . . Also, “reactive mind” is as good a term as any in psychology or psychoanalysis. It pretty clearly differentiates functions taking place “below the level of awareness of a person”, from those that are consciously monitored/initiated. </p></blockquote> <p>Huh? The term &#8220;reactive mind&#8221; makes no such differentiation. Think about it: reactions can be entirely conscious and monitored, they can even be pre-determined.  A more accurate term which does make the differentiation you describe is &#8220;sub-conscious&#8221;.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov odd alt depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330351"> 		<div id="comment-330351"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/742817c1603c6e5f9f5086f4763a57b5?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://valkovuddin.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>iamvalkov</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330351"> 				February 19, 2015 at 4:31 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330351#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330351", "330351", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to iamvalkov'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>&#8220;Below the level of awareness&#8221;,  &#8220;sub-conscious&#8221;,  you think there is a fundamentl difference in meaning?  It sounds like quibbly nit-picky word-play to me.   As I mentioned in a discussion with Vin recently,  any language,  any words are &#8220;filters&#8221;.  They point to realities but do not necessarily delineate them with absolute precision.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330379"> 		<div id="comment-330379"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/cf9852fde6b900f07e118db09bf76344?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Crepuscule.</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330379"> 				February 20, 2015 at 7:52 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330379#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330379", "330379", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Crepuscule.'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><blockquote><p>“Below the level of awareness”, “sub-conscious”, you think there is a fundamentl difference in meaning? . . . </p></blockquote> <p>No, and I never suggested there was. Flunk for fallacy of equivocation.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov odd alt depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330416"> 		<div id="comment-330416"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/742817c1603c6e5f9f5086f4763a57b5?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://valkovuddin.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>iamvalkov</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330416"> 				February 20, 2015 at 5:05 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330416#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330416", "330416", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to iamvalkov'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Well,  I don&#8217;t know what a &#8220;fallacy of equivocation&#8221; is,  but here is your post I was responding to,  in which you seemed to clearly saying there is a difference:<br /> &#8220;Huh? The term “reactive mind” makes no such differentiation. Think about it: reactions can be entirely conscious and monitored, they can even be pre-determined. A more accurate term which does make the differentiation you describe is “sub-conscious”.<br /> The reactive mind is defined as operating below the level of a person&#8217;s awareness,  as is (to me), the &#8220;subconscious mind&#8221;.<br /> So it appears that &#8220;reactive mind&#8221; and &#8220;subconscious mind&#8221; are pretty much  referring to the same phenomena.   I use &#8220;reaction&#8221; as denoting stimulus-response, rather than consciously intended, planned, or volitional actions.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329498"> 		<div id="comment-329498"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329498"> 				February 5, 2015 at 12:40 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329498#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329498", "329498", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Consider:</p> <p>a)if a person were to be audited all the way from Life Repair, through his Grades and Power Processing, even up to OT 2, and</p> <p>b) was not subjected to the indoctrination that is continually brought to a student or parishioner by virtue of course materials, books, policy letters, registrars, promotional pieces and events, then</p> <p>c) he might not believe ANY of the things brought up my Marty here. Consider: He might not even have thought any of those things, let alone believe in them, without those sorts of influence.</p> <p>I am living with a such person. He did the entire bridge and has never stepped foot in a Church.  He does not consider himself a Scientologist.<br /> He did everything in a few years and just kept on moving forward with out a hangover, or any trace of the items listed above. </p> <p>But how could he have done that without an auditor, who was &#8220;indoctrinated&#8221; with course materials and books?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329539"> 		<div id="comment-329539"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://i2.wp.com/graph.facebook.com/v2.2/638982191/picture?q=type%3Dlarge%26_md5%3D7d7a6c4a804508fb5f05b049a1fafd91&#038;resize=48%2C48' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.facebook.com/638982191' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Dan Locke</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329539"> 				February 5, 2015 at 5:00 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329539#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329539", "329539", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Dan Locke'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>All I was wanting to point out is that such a person as the person you are living with would not find himself believing the various things that Mark Rathbun says are the beliefs of Scientology. Unless this person was also indoctrinated thusly. </p> <p>Fundamental Christianity has in it some pretty barbaric aspects, particularly in the Old Testament. There we have stonings, whole populations being rubbed out by a vengeful God, etc. The New Testament, while less barbaric, doesn&#8217;t sit well with a lot of today&#8217;s sophisticated people for various reasons, including Paul&#8217;s views about women and homosexuality. </p> <p>Various Christian thinkers have managed to get past the &#8220;it&#8217;s ALL God&#8217;s Word and it&#8217;s ALL got to be followed&#8221;, and have basically asked themselves, &#8220;What&#8217;s workable and generally improves conditions?&#8221; and they take those things and preach and practice on the workable and leave all else alone. Ernest Holme&#8217;s Church of Religious Science is an excellent example of this. Hinduism is full of brilliant information and guidance; it&#8217;s also full of myth. Certainly there&#8217;s many people who have been able to decipher the difference between the good and bad. </p> <p>Islam is another example, with the most dangerous being those who want to follow all the Prophet&#8217;s words, and it&#8217;s unfortunate that his later teachings were venomous; his earliest teachings very loving. So there are fundamentalists there beheading and stoning, and other&#8217;s who have filtered out the hatred.</p> <p>Such <i>could be</i>a &#8220;new way&#8221; to teach Scientology. Label the balderdash and non-sensical and harmful any way you want, but move it off the line up.  I think there&#8217;s many in the Indie Field doing just that. Although these beliefs Marty has enumerated are certainly embedded in the Church and in many church-goers; there is lots and lots of material that are not influenced by these beliefs and do much to bring relief and a clearer view of things to people. There&#8217;s a lot left over. </p> <p>I think that there&#8217;s many people who have benefited from Scientology in a similar fashion to your roommate or partner. And there&#8217;s also lots of people who held on to their personal integrity while being on org lines studying. Just because these points have been put forward by Ron and then advanced by many, there are plenty of people who filter these nonsensical or harmful things out. Very few people at the Washington Times personally advanced the aims of their owner, the Unification Church. We are not infected with the principles of Christian Science if we read the Monitor&#8217;s book and movie reviews. </p> <p>Here we are on Marty&#8217;s blog. Perhaps a few thousand of us have commented over the years. How many of us have employed Scientology in  such a way as to hurt another since we have left the Church? I think there are very few or any of us here who have done that. </p> <p>I think that most of those still active in the corporate Church are tolerating these beliefs. less than accepting them. And I think that is true with many of us here. And, just as there was a &#8220;breaking point&#8221; for us, there will be a &#8220;breaking point&#8221; for many of them. The ranks of &#8220;exes&#8221; bailing is greater every day. There are 3 people who have told me they are under the radar to every one person I know who has said publicly that they have left.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329548"> 		<div id="comment-329548"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329548"> 				February 5, 2015 at 6:46 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329548#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329548", "329548", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Good points. All. I really enjoy reading your posts.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329595"> 		<div id="comment-329595"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://i2.wp.com/graph.facebook.com/v2.2/638982191/picture?q=type%3Dlarge&#038;resize=48%2C48' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.facebook.com/638982191' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Dan Locke</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329595"> 				February 6, 2015 at 1:02 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329595#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329595", "329595", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Dan Locke'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thank you! I think we should get together and establish a pop psychology practice. Let&#8217;s call it it &#8220;Playology&#8221; A lot like Scientology, but without ethics policies, bad guys and space opera. Here&#8217;s my proposed 8 beliefs:</p> <p>1. Planet Earth is a playground. The vast majority of human beings – and billions of invisible other beings – are your team mates. We are here to express and experience freedom, growth and joy. </p> <p>2. Steve Irwin (aka &#8220;The Crocodile Hunter&#8221;) was the name of the hero of our pop psychologist group. Steve established Earth as a playground and transported billions of beings to serve as our fellow team mates. </p> <p>3. Our continued state of play is assured by stand up comedians, late-night talk show hosts, friendly people we meet in day to day life, ex-Scientologists and people who write critically about Scientology without having any first hand experience with it. The males are from Mars, and the girls are from Venus. </p> <p>4. Dan Locke and The Oracle were all amongst the first few billion to have discovered the truth of 1 through 3 above, and are not the only ones who have devised means of enjoying life on this planet, and wanting to immerse themselves in the experience of it, and can&#8217;t imagine why anyone would want to escape from it.</p> <p>5. It&#8217;s of vital importance in our group that we don&#8217;t consider there&#8217;s only one hole in any wall and that it&#8217;s typically not necessary to navigate through holes in walls. It&#8217;s usually fine to let a hole in a wall just continue to be there, and not go through it. If one decides to go through a hole in a wall, it&#8217;s usually only necessary to determine if the any of the available holes are wide enough to pass through or can be made wide enough, and this can be done usually without skills in navigation. </p> <p>We also recognize that going around the wall or through  a door are frequently available options. </p> <p>It is also important to answer the age-old question many of us have suffered with over the ages, that being the question, &#8220;What wall???&#8221; </p> <p>6. Playologists don&#8217;t have enemies.  About as bad as it gets for a playologist is to encounter people they haven&#8217;t yet quite figured out.  </p> <p>7. Playology ‘technology’ consists of a sophisticated mix of &#8220;pop&#8221; psychology and hypnotism carefully designed and administered so as to lead people to wholeheartedly accept and live according to these beliefs. In keeping with &#8220;pop culture&#8221;, we do our best to keep up with what&#8217;s trending, and mod clothing. We are pretty split on the whole Justin Bieber thing. </p> <p>8. When a playologist has expended all of his best efforts in the vibrant pursuit of these beliefs he is expected to belch loudly and shout &#8220;Huzzah&#8221; and laugh as others wonder what &#8220;huzzah&#8221; means. All playologists eventually &#8220;die&#8221;, usually while laughing or after extraordinarily satisfying sex.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329684"> 		<div id="comment-329684"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329684"> 				February 6, 2015 at 7:32 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329684#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329684", "329684", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>LAUGHTER!   I am so recruited!!!  Laughter!  And sugar cane crops and grape vineyards are government funded&#8230;..wine and rum should be human rights,not privileges!</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov odd alt depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330241"> 		<div id="comment-330241"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/742817c1603c6e5f9f5086f4763a57b5?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://valkovuddin.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>iamvalkov</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330241"> 				February 17, 2015 at 5:34 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330241#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330241", "330241", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to iamvalkov'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>For sure count me in!  <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-smile' title=':)'>:)</span></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329593"> 		<div id="comment-329593"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/cf9852fde6b900f07e118db09bf76344?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Crepuscule</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329593"> 				February 6, 2015 at 12:07 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329593#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329593", "329593", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Crepuscule'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><blockquote><p>All I was wanting to point out is that such a person as the person you are living with would not find himself believing the various things that Mark Rathbun says are the beliefs of Scientology. Unless this person was also indoctrinated thusly . . . </p></blockquote> <p>Huh? Just like any regular poster here at &#8220;Movin&#8217; On Up&#8221;, the person TO is living with is not in any way a Scientologist by Scientology&#8217;s own definition. This person doesn&#8217;t call themself a Scientologist. The OP is talking about Scientology beliefs &#8211; why on Earth would any non-Scientologist believe any Scientology let alone the core beliefs as delineated by Marty? </p> <p>The remainder of your comment, I suggest, is invalid in that it seeks to draw a false equivalence. This is because Scientology is not a religion. For it to be valid to describe Scientology as a religion the definition of the term &#8220;religion&#8221; would have to include as a qualifier something like this:</p> <blockquote><p> &#8220;an organisation which systematically and covertly applies hypnotic-like practises against adherents in order to gain deeply personal and other information for subsequent use against the person so as to extract cash and/or protect the on-going functioning of the organisation&#8221;.</p></blockquote> <p>Now, while that qualifier is an accurate description of the day-to-day and on-going core business of Scientology, it also excludes Scientology for consideration as a religion. </p> <p>A valid equivalence with which to measure Scientology would be with criminal organisations such as the Mafia, the Hells Angels, the Tongs, the Triads, and so on. Just like Scientology, each of those criminal organisations has facets which could be described as religious in nature, but not one of them can  be described as a religion.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov odd alt depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330243"> 		<div id="comment-330243"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/742817c1603c6e5f9f5086f4763a57b5?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://valkovuddin.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>iamvalkov</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330243"> 				February 17, 2015 at 5:50 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330243#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330243", "330243", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to iamvalkov'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>crep,  I believe the differentiation was between the &#8220;believers&#8221; in the church and a person who was &#8220;audited&#8221; up through,  say,  Clear,  outside the church,  by auditor or listener or facilitator using perhaps the Clearbird materials  which are distillation of the procedures,   apart from any indoctrination into the beliefs outlined by Marty.<br /> That is what some of us are talking about,  and what some refer to as &#8220;core scientology&#8221;.   I think it is a differentiation worth making.  One might call it &#8220;decontaminated scientology tech&#8221;.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330248"> 		<div id="comment-330248"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' He does a petty good exposition of the roles of each in and the different realms of knowledge involved in ech. From my own pre-scientology experiece, here is an example:  Back in the 1960s, I took some LSD,  and prmptly went out the top of my head(not &#8220;3 feet behind it&#8221;, but straight up). &#8220;hallucination&#8221;  or &#8220;delusion&#8221;.<br /> How in the world could they know what it was?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329326"> 		<div id="comment-329326"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://i2.wp.com/graph.facebook.com/v2.2/638982191/picture?q=type%3Dlarge&#038;resize=48%2C48' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.facebook.com/638982191' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Dan Locke</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329326"> 				February 4, 2015 at 1:05 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329326#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329326", "329326", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Dan Locke'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I&#8217;m &#8220;coming out&#8221; as &#8220;pro-pop psychology&#8221;. </p> <p>Defined: &#8220;Popular psychology (or pop psychology or pop psych) is the concepts and theories about human mental life and behavior that are purportedly based on psychology and that find credence among and pass muster with the populace. The concept is cognate with the human potential movement of the 1950s and &#8217;60s.<br /> Popular psychology &#8211; Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia<br /> en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Popular_psychology&#8221;</p> <p>Ron&#8217;s and Scientology&#8217;s claims that Dianetics inaugurated the human potential movement of the 50&#8217;s and 60&#8217;s are true, I think. It even preceded &#8220;The Power of Positive Thinking&#8221; by two years. Living in the USA, prior to 1950, if you wanted to find encouragement and validation for &#8220;being you&#8221; and being alive, you found it from a family member or from a popular song lyrics, not from a non-fiction book. It&#8217;s true that there was psychology before Dianetics, but it was not popular, and it did not validate or encourage human potential or &#8220;being awake&#8221;.</p> <p>I think that &#8220;pop psychology&#8221; has been a &#8220;It&#8217;s a Wonderful Life&#8221;&#8216;s George Bailey type of influence on our culture &#8211; and that&#8217;s brought a lot of good. If it had never been &#8220;born&#8221;, the world would not be as nice a place. </p> <p>My turn to be snarky! Nyah ha ha! Take THAT, you scoundrels!</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329327"> 		<div id="comment-329327"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/b4e1c4cfb3baf5d0110c888632ec3b75?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Joe Pendleton</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329327"> 				February 4, 2015 at 1:36 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329327#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329327", "329327", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Joe Pendleton'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Let me be the first to state that I do not &#8230; I repeat DO NOT include Dr. Phil in #3 above. this a number of times as you continually use your truth to make less of other beings&#8217; truths on this matter. I understand the sources for what indicates to you as truth, as you have noted these in you essays.  I would never actually question what indicates to you as truth, as I do not feel that my personal truth (or L. Ron Hubbard&#8217;s) is in any way superior to yours. Now if your answer is that your truth indicates to you more or feels more right, why not just say s0?  That would be real to me. As far as I&#8217;m concerned it is open season for all to battle out any philosophers&#8217; ideas. I didn&#8217;t think I was &#8220;attacking&#8221; you. I was just interested a bit more in your certainty of viewpoint. That&#8217;s all. Your answer that you are not sure of the absolute truth is appreciated.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329613"> 		<div id="comment-329613"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329613"> 				February 6, 2015 at 7:28 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329613#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329613", "329613", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p><a href="http://vinaire.me/2014/06/04/the-absolute-truth/" rel="nofollow"><b>The Quest for Certainty</b></a></p> <p>Buddha declared.</p> <p><b>&#8220;The Absolute Truth is that there is nothing absolute in the world, that everything is relative, conditioned and impermanent, and that there is no unchanging, everlasting, absolute substance like Self, Soul, or Atman within or without.&#8221;</b></p> <p><strong><em>DEFINITION: Absolute means, “Viewed independently; not comparative or relative; ultimate; intrinsic.”</em></strong></p> <p>This postulate may appear self-contradictory to some, but it essentially says, “There are no absolute certainties.” This is reflected in one of the most ancient hymns, <strong><a href="http://vinaire.me/2011/04/08/the-creation-hymn-of-rig-veda/" rel="nofollow">The Creation Hymn of Rig Veda</a></strong>.</p> <p>All certainties are relative. This statement does not degrade any certainty we have. It simply means that one can always come up with a better certainty.</p> <p>That is how science makes progress. Einstein declared the speed of light to be a universal constant. This is a certainty for now, but there may possibly be a wider context in which the speed of light is a special case.</p> <p>Similarly, in the field of spirituality, we cannot be absolutely certain that self or soul is permanent. The phenomenon that is described as self or soul must be open to further investigation.</p> <p>There is little progress possible for a person who believes his certainties are absolute.</p> <p>One can always improve upon a certainty one has.<br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329713"> 		<div id="comment-329713"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/b4e1c4cfb3baf5d0110c888632ec3b75?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Joe Pendleton</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329713"> 				February 7, 2015 at 8:20 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329713#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329713", "329713", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Joe Pendleton'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Vinaire, I agree.</p> <p>But &#8230; is the Buddha&#8217;s statement about absolute truth &#8230; an absolute truth?</p> <p>Probably is.  Maybe 99.99999999% of the time anyway.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-8 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329719"> 		<div id="comment-329719"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329487"> 		<div id="comment-329487"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/e7becb03c5b940c25177e04f9d36c61e?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/imcramer' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Don Cramer</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329487"> 				February 5, 2015 at 11:44 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329487#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329487", "329487", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Don Cramer'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I wish to give you a long overdue thank you for a post you made in  2013 and to present it here once again as I have often referred to it when discussing the cult with others. I could go into an ego-reinforcing description of exactly how and why I am grateful, but I believe it is self evident to anyone who practices mindfulness and has undergone the Scientology indoctrination process (technical training as a Snr. C/S in my case).</p> <p>Don </p> <p>I shall give you THE FALSE DATUM of Scientology that is embedded in Scientology Axiom #1, and which is expressed here in Scientology 8-8008:</p> <p>“One of the control mechanisms which has been used on thetans is that when they rise in potential they are led to believe themselves one with the universe. This is distinctly untrue. Thetans are individuals. They do not as they rise up the scale, merge with other individualities. They have the power of becoming anything they wish while still retaining their own individuality. They are first and foremost themselves. There is evidently no Nirvana. It is the feeling that one will merge and lose his own individuality that restrains the thetan from attempting to remedy his lot. His merging with the rest of the universe would be his becoming matter. This is the ultimate in cohesiveness and the ultimate in affinity, and is at the lowest point of the tone-scale. One declines into a brotherhood with the universe.”</p> <p>There goes love, compassion and kindness in Scientology with the US versus THEY thinking of THETA-MEST theory. MEST does not come from theta to entrap theta. Individuality does not merge with MEST in Nirvana. That is Hubbard bullshit. </p> <p>Theta and MEST are two aspects of the same system. In Nirvana there is neither MEST nor individuality to serve as the boundary. There is simply no boundary.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-martyrathbun09 comment-author-is-site-member bypostauthor even depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329511"> 		<div id="comment-329511"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/c2d94d163a566268e73c8b0195b6c03a?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Mark C.
