Not at you or what you shared but at the insanity of this world, this cosmos.  Over the seeming years I have imagined many scenarios regarding the who, what, where and why of this character L. Ron Hubbard.  Finally, I came to recognize that this identity emerged in my experience of consciousness as a projection, a manifestation, of my own unconscious guilt, fear and self-hate.  I have played this particular story line so, so many times (like portrayed in the movie Ground Hog Day) never waking up, never getting the lesson and the experience always having the same outcome.  This time, though, something happened, and I finally made a different choice.  A choice that put me on the path of waking up and getting a very important lesson.  For me, L. Ron Hubbard has never existed except as a character I imagined and inserted into my seemingly endless dream of an existence in an unreal world that I have totally believed is real.</p> <p>It wasn&#8217;t truth that I couldn&#8217;t recognize all along, it was the lies.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329691"> 		<div id="comment-329691"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329691"> 				February 7, 2015 at 12:10 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329691#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329691", "329691", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hi Monte. Nice post.  You reminded me of a Wayne Dyer quote: </p> <p>&#8220;When you change the way you look at things, the things you look at will change.&#8221; </p> <p>This may be the biggest reason why people view scientology, or anything else, and see such different things. </p> <p><span class='embed-youtube' style='text-align:center; display: block;'><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='500' height='312' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/urQPraeeY0w?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' frameborder='0' allowfullscreen='true'></iframe></span></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330030"> 		<div id="comment-330030"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/d616319c9b45470e765e5dca0049c183?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Monte</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330030"> 				February 11, 2015 at 2:49 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330030#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330030", "330030", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Monte'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hello marildi!  Thanks for the video clip of Wayne Dyer.  I have seen this particular presentation of his on PBS numerous times in its entirety and always benefited by doing so.</p> <p>His quote that you shared is one of those that requires absolutely no debate but invites one to embark on the simple journey of personal exploration and experience.  How difficult could it be for one to pick something that they hold a belief on as to how that something is, then choose to change the way they look at it and and observe how the perception of that &#8216;something&#8217; changes (or not) after doing so?</p> <p>Personally, just taking the subjects of L. Ron Hubbard and Scientology&#8230;I couldn&#8217;t begin to count the number of times I have changed the way I look at them. And with each change in view came a change in perception and interpretation.</p> <p>The world I see is the world I have invented through both my conscious and unconscious beliefs about the world.  Everything I perceive means to me what I have decided for it to mean thus there is no truth or facts in time that I can share with what would seem to be another.  All that I am able to share in the seeming journey through time and space is my interpretation of what I perceive.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-8 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330042"> 		<div id="comment-330042"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330042"> 				February 12, 2015 at 2:33 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330042#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330042", "330042", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Monte: &#8220;The world I see is the world I have invented through both my conscious and unconscious beliefs about the world. Everything I perceive means to me what I have decided for it to mean&#8230;:</p> <p>I think there is a lot of truth to what you say. However, dear Monte, I&#8217;m not sure I would agree with what you wrote here:</p> <p>&#8220;&#8230;thus there is no truth or facts in time that I can share with what would seem to be another.&#8221;</p> <p>Tell me what you think of this passage from Dan Brown&#8217;s book *The Lost Symbol*, in which a speaker by the name of Peter Solomon is addressing a student body:</p> <p>&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8211;<br /> &#8230;Solomon said, “I find it wondrous to note that throughout history, all of mankind’s disparate philosophies have all concurred on one thing – that a great enlightenment is coming. In every culture in every era, in every corner of the world, the human dream has focused on the same exact concept – the coming apotheosis of man…the impending transformation of our human minds into their true potentiality.“ he smiled. “What could possibly explain such a synchronicity of beliefs?”</p> <p>“Truth,” said a quiet voice in the crowd. </p> <p>Solomon wheeled. “Who said that?”</p> <p>The hand that went up belonged to a tiny Asian boy whose soft features suggested he might be Nepalese or Tibetan. “Maybe there is a universal truth embedded in everyone’s soul. Maybe we ALL have the same story hiding inside, like a shared constant in our DNA. Maybe this collective TRUTH is responsible for the similarity in all of our stories.”</p> <p>Solomon was beaming as he pressed his hands together and bowed reverently to the boy. “Thank you.”</p> <p>Everyone was quiet.</p> <p>“Truth”, Solomon said, addressing the room. “Truth has power. And if we all gravitate toward similar ideas, maybe we do so because those ideas are TRUE . . . written deep within us. And when we hear the truth, even if we don’t understand it, we feel that truth resonate within us . . . vibrating with our unconscious wisdom. Perhaps the truth is not LEARNED by us, but rather, the truth is re-called . . .re-membered . . . re-cognized . . . as that which is already inside us.”<br /> &#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;-<br /> <a href="http://bookspot.ro/file.axd?file=2012%2F1%2FDan+Brown+-+The_Lost_Symbol.pdf" rel="nofollow">http://bookspot.ro/file.axd?file=2012%2F1%2FDan+Brown+-+The_Lost_Symbol.pdf</a></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330086"> 		<div id="comment-330086"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/d616319c9b45470e765e5dca0049c183?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Monte</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330086"> 				February 13, 2015 at 10:14 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330086#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330086", "330086", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Monte'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>marildi, thanks for the excerpt from Dan Brown&#8217;s book.  It&#8217;s profound.  I&#8217;ll give you my interpretation of what is communicated in the last paragraph of the excerpt and then some. <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-smile' title=':)'>:)</span>  That paragraph being:</p> <p>“Truth has power. And if we all gravitate toward similar ideas, maybe we do so because those ideas are TRUE . . . written deep within us. And when we hear the truth, even if we don’t understand it, we feel that truth resonate within us . . . vibrating with our unconscious wisdom. Perhaps the truth is not LEARNED by us, but rather, the truth is re-called . . .re-membered . . . re-cognized . . . as that which is already inside us.”</p> <p>TRUTH IS.  I am, you are, we are TRUTH.  TRUTH is not fragmented, there are no degrees of when it comes to TRUTH.  TRUTH is not just &#8216;inside us&#8217; it is us.  However, in our identifying with the human condition we believe that TRUTH exists outside of us and needs to be sought for, discovered and learned.  We do not know that WE ARE and we are terrified of knowing who WE REALLY ARE.  Therefore, we have made a universe of perception that appears to have a subject and object, a cause and an effect and in this universe we hide from TRUTH.  In the fragmented universe of perception where each seeming individual identity can determine their own truth and where truth is always seen to exist outside of the individual&#8230;TRUTH is obscured.  You could say that TRUTH is the ever shinning Sun and perception is the system of clouds that continually block the light of the Sun.</p> <p>In the universe of perception all I can perceive through my senses is the past.  BTW, my senses constantly affirm that there is indeed a world of form that exists outside of myself and in perception &#8216;myself&#8217; is nothing but a construct.that I identify with.  What resembles truth in the universe of perception is based on observations, comparisons, evaluations and judgments that are filtered through myriad belief systems that exist both consciously and unconsciously. In the universe of perception no two individuals will ever join in an exact truth.</p> <p>The universe of perception is nothing but a dream that we believe to be quite real and we act toward it as if it is real.  The universe of perception is a very strange place indeed.  It is a place where the individual is never complete and there is always more to want and more to get.  The good news is though, that regardless of how incredibly inventive we get, we can never escape from being who and what WE REALLY ARE. </p> <p>WE ARE TRUTH. WE ARE KNOWLEDGE. WE ARE LOVE. WE ARE ETERNAL. WE ARE EVERYTHING AND WE ARE NO THING.</p> <p>Isn&#8217;t it interesting that the very things we want and are in constant pursuit of in the world of perception i.e., truth, knowledge, love and immortality&#8230;are the very things WE ARE and always will be.  Indeed, WE have never been anything else,  This is why ALL paths taken in the universe of perception eventually and inevitably arrive at the same place&#8230;TRUTH.  It cannot be otherwise.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330105"> 		<div id="comment-330105"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330105"> 				February 13, 2015 at 10:38 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Monte, beautifully said. What you wrote in the following rings of truth. <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-wink' title=';)'>;)</span> </p> <p>&#8220;WE ARE TRUTH. WE ARE KNOWLEDGE. WE ARE LOVE. WE ARE ETERNAL. WE ARE EVERYTHING AND WE ARE NO THING.&#8221;</p> <p>The only thing you&#8217;ve said that still doesn&#8217;t ring as truth for me is that we are all &#8220;one&#8221; and not individuals. It seems to me that even apart from the universe of perception, there could exist an infinity of individuals &#8211; each one truth, love, eternal. When I look &#8220;inside&#8221;, I feel/know that &#8220;I am&#8221;, not that &#8220;I am one with all&#8221;. </p> <p>Over to you Count Monte. And have a Happy &#8220;Valentine&#8217;s&#8221; Day. <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-smile' title=':)'>:)</span></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330136"> 		<div id="comment-330136"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330136"> 				February 14, 2015 at 4:35 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hi Marildi<br /> This idea that we are &#8220;one with all&#8221; is one of the most elusive teachings in ACIM, but if embraced it brings about TOTAL RESPONSIBILITY.  </p> <p>How can you not love your brother if in TRUTH  you and he are one.  Obviously we are speaking from a spiritual dimension, so gender does not apply.</p> <p>Lots of love<br /> Pip</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330170"> 		<div id="comment-330170"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330170"> 				February 16, 2015 at 4:55 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>My dear Pip, have you forgotten that article by UCSF Professor Arthur Deikman? You introduced me to it about a year ago, right here on Marty&#8217;s. The title is &#8220;&#8216;I&#8217; = Awareness&#8221;. Here&#8217;s the abstract:</p> <p>&#8220;Introspection reveals that the core of subjectivity — the `I&#8217; — is identical to awareness. This `I&#8217; should be differentiated from the various aspects of the physical person and its mental contents which form the `self&#8217;. Most discussions of consciousness confuse the `I&#8217; and the `self&#8217;. In fact, our experience is fundamentally dualistic — not the dualism of mind and matter — but that of the `I&#8217; and that which is observed. The identity of awareness and the `I&#8217; means that we know awareness by being it, thus solving the problem of the infinite regress of observers. It follows that whatever our ontology of awareness may be, it must also be the same for `I&#8217;.&#8221;</p> <p>The article is summed up with the following:</p> <p>&#8220;KNOWING BY BEING THAT WHICH IS KNOWN [my caps] is ontologically different from perceptual knowledge. That is why someone might introspect and not see awareness or the `I&#8217;, concluding&#8230;that it doesn&#8217;t exist. But thought experiments and introspective meditation techniques are able to extract the one who is looking from what is seen, restoring the missing centre.&#8221;</p> <p>&#8220;Once we grant the identity of `I&#8217; and awareness we are compelled to extend to the core subjective self whatever ontological propositions seem appropriate for awareness. If awareness is non-local, so is the essential self. If awareness transcends material reality so does the `I&#8217;. If awareness is declared to be non-existent then that same conclusion must apply to the `I&#8217;. No matter what one&#8217;s ontological bias, recognition that `I&#8217; = awareness has profound implications for our theoretical and personal perspective.&#8221;</p> <p><a href="http://www.imprint.co.uk/online/Deikman.html" rel="nofollow">http://www.imprint.co.uk/online/Deikman.html</a></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330173"> 		<div id="comment-330173"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330173"> 				February 16, 2015 at 8:35 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Marildi, this is human self-centric view of awareness. It is a very narrow view.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330187"> 		<div id="comment-330187"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330187"> 				February 16, 2015 at 10:08 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>No, it&#8217;s cousciousness-centric. <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-tongue' title=':P'>:P</span></p> <p>And that has been proven by quantum physics with the experiment that went beyond the double-slit &#8211; that is, the delayed-choice quantum eraser experiment:</p> <p><span class='embed-youtube' style='text-align:center; display: block;'><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='500' height='312' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/H6HLjpj4Nt4?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' frameborder='0' allowfullscreen='true'></iframe></span></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330328"> 		<div id="comment-330328"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330328"> 				February 19, 2015 at 6:45 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Vinaire for once we are in agreement.  Please see my reply to Marildi.  This article is still confusing the &#8220;I&#8221; with &#8220;Me&#8221; which I would agree is &#8220;self-centric&#8221;.<br /> Regards<br /> Pip</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330325"> 		<div id="comment-330325"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330325"> 				February 19, 2015 at 6:37 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>My dear Marildi<br /> How could I have forgotten the article by Professor Arthur Deikman.  I originally came across that article when exploring AWARENESS of AWARENESS on Google.  </p> <p>Ever since I was &#8220;EXPELLED&#8221; and yes! I said expelled from the Church of Scientology I have continued to test the assertions of Scientology against known data in the larger world.</p> <p>Awareness of awareness is one of the fundamental tenants of Scientology, and at the time this article by Arthur Deikman came nearest to my understanding of awareness of awareness.  It isn&#8217;t quite there as demonstrated in  the title &#8220;I&#8221; = Awareness.  If this was true then anything that had awareness would be an &#8220;I&#8221;, no! it should be &#8220;I&#8221; = Awareness of Awareness.  Awareness is the beingness of ME not THE &#8220;I&#8221;.</p> <p>I have just revisited AWARENESS of AWARENESS on Google and this most interesting site came up<br /> <a href="http://www.albigen.com/uarelove/awa_clarification.htm" rel="nofollow">http://www.albigen.com/uarelove/awa_clarification.htm</a> </p> <p>To my mind it is the best example I have come across of what OT TRO is. Please have a look.</p> <p>Lots and lots of love<br /> Pip</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov even depth-10 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>My dear ol’ Pip <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-wink' title=';)'>;)</span></p> <p>Now that you put my attention on it, I think  Deikman’s article was mis-titled, in that he actually describes “I” as an awareness of awareness, although it&#8217;s only implied. He came pretty close to articulating it in the &#8220;Conclusion&#8221;, where he said “Knowing by being that which is known is ontologically different from perceptual knowledge. That is why someone might introspect and not SEE awareness or the `I’ &#8211; concluding…that it doesn’t exist. To me, “SEE awareness” is another way of saying “aware of being aware” or “awareness of awareness.” </p> <p>But the article you posted the link to explicitly expresses the idea of &#8220;awareness of awareness&#8221;  And I would agree – it is a very good description of OT-TR0.</p> <p>I think we&#8217;re also in agreement that plants and many animals (perhaps not all) are &#8220;aware&#8221; (obviously) but not &#8220;aware of being aware&#8221; &#8211; and thus, it would seem, they are &#8220;one with the universe&#8221; (their environment).</p> <p>marildi xo</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330601"> 		<div id="comment-330601"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330601"> 				February 24, 2015 at 6:02 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Not so much of the &#8216;Ol&#8217;!<br /> Yes for me and I know for you it is the concept of the AWARENESS of AWARENESS that sets Scientology apart from most other attempts to figure out how the mind works. #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330186"> 		<div id="comment-330186"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hi again Pip,<br /> Spyros reminded me of the bulletin &#8220;O/W, A Limited Theory&#8221;. It has everything to do with this idea of unconditional love &#8211; expressed by Jesus as &#8220;Love thy neighbor&#8221; &#8211; and it bridges the gap between ARC and universal love. In other words, one can indeed reach Love through Understanding &#8211; which only makes sense if you think about it.</p> <p>I hadn&#8217;t thought about this before but the bulletin also correlates with physics. In the realm of aberration, the principle in operation is from Newton physics &#8211; which is linear. But there is also a correlation with quantum physics &#8211; in the sense of life units being entangled. And experiments have now shown that not just particles but life itself can be entangled. (Yet another example of LRH&#8217;s insights being &#8220;re-discovered&#8221;.)</p> <p>Here&#8217;s the relevant excerpt from the bulletin (my caps for emphasis):</p> <p>&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;-<br /> &#8220;The theory that what you do to others will then happen to you is a punishment control mechanism peculiar to this universe. It derives from a deteriorated willingness to duplicate. IT IS THE LAW OF PHYSICS OF INTERACTION &#8211; FOR EVERY ACTION THERE IS AN EQUAL AND CONTRARY REACTION.</p> <p>&#8220;&#8216;Love thy neighbor&#8217;, when it is no longer a willingness, is enforced by the theory of O/W. &#8216;Love thy neighbor&#8217; can exist only when help, control and communication are high. When all these go, then O-W comes into vogue as a method of enforcing peace.</p> <p>&#8220;O-W is a theory which sets in when aberration sets in. It is not a high natural law. It is junior to the various laws of Communication, Control and Help.</p> <p>&#8220;O-W can occur only when help has failed. Help is a CO-JOINING OF VECTORS OF LIFE.</p> <p>&#8220;When two BEINGS WHO HAVE JOINED FORCES to help fail each other, only then does O-W come into existence.</p> <p>&#8220;THE FORCES OF TWO BEINGS CANNOT COME INTO DISPUTE UNTIL AFTER THEY HAVE FIRST JOINED. Thus there is no war like that seen between brothers or husband and wife.&#8221;</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330329"> 		<div id="comment-330329"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330329"> 				February 19, 2015 at 7:12 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hello again Marildi</p> <p>That directive by Jesus to &#8220;love thy neighbour&#8221; is not complete, the rest is &#8220;as you love yourself&#8221;.  It is literally impossible to love your neighbour more than yourself for the simple reason your neighbour IS YOUR SELF.  Also this is the second of the two great commandments, the first is &#8220;you shall love the lord your god with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your strength, and with all your mind; ……”Luke 10:27.  And then “your neighbor as yourself.&#8221; NAS bible.</p> <p>When Jesus is speaking he is never talking about natural love (the ego), but DIVINE LOVE, (the true self)</p> <p>Your last point “The forces of two beings cannot come into dispute until after they have first joined”, is so true and can equally be summed up with ARC ALWAYS PROCEEDS AN ARC BREAK.</p> <p>Lots of love with understanding<br /> Pip x</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330130"> 		<div id="comment-330130"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330130"> 				February 14, 2015 at 4:15 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hi Monte<br /> As I have said before I have been aware of and have studied ACIM for the past 15 years and although I still read and post on miracle_e_pals_uk@yahoogroups I am aware the Course Students have quite a back off where Scientology is concerned, and in fact many of them would believe that ACIM is closer to Buddhism than Christianity.</p> <p>My attention was drawn to your thoughts concerning who and what we really are.  I was particularly interested in your last statement &#8220;WE ARE NO THING&#8221; this is where Scientology makes its fundamental mistake.  Having first established that man is a NO THING that is THETA, it then goes on to speaking about a THETAN.  So WHO YOU TRULY ARE is THETA,  WHO YOU REALLY ARE IS A THETAN.  In other words you are A THETAN by AGREEMENT.  This handles the apparent paradox of how we can be ONE and separate INDIVIDUALS at the same time, in fact, INDIVISIBLE and INDIVIDUAL come from the same root, as I have said before.</p> <p>Love and Understanding<br /> Pip</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-iamvalkov odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330256"> 		<div id="comment-330256"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/742817c1603c6e5f9f5086f4763a57b5?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://valkovuddin.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>iamvalkov</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330256"> 				February 17, 2015 at 7:37 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Deikman&#8217;s essay makes some sense to me. Mindfulness can exist without &#8220;I&#8221;.</p> <p>Mindfulness is attentiveness. The function of mindfulness is to bring clarity to what is being perceived. The basic approach is:</p> <p>“Observe things as they are, without assuming anything.”</p> <p>For details, please see: <a href="http://vinaire.me/2013/09/05/the-12-aspects-of-mindfulness-revised/" One was that I have a friend who was a last-lifetime Clear, who remembers his experience between lives as simply being aware &#8211; without an “identity” in any physical universe sense. In other words, not the previous life identity or any other . Just an awareness of his existence. </p> <p>The other thing I thought of is the time you experienced a communion with me(!) <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-smile' title=':)'>:)</span> one morning, and then you wrote about it in a comment here. It was a communion of spirit only (obviously).  So my question is &#8211; what is your understanding of that kind of experience (in light of what Rupert had to say in the vid)?</p> <p>One thing he said was “As the localization [of mind] disperses, its contents are still in consciousness.” That seems to say that the “localizations” are permanent in some sense.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330600"> 		<div id="comment-330600"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330600"> 				February 24, 2015 at 5:55 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thanks Monte for the video. You ask what, in light of what Rupert is saying, my understanding is of the experience of our spiritual communion.  Well marildi, this is going to possibly seem like a cop out on my part, but I have to say that I don&#8217;t have an understanding of that experience.  However, there is the experience and somehow I know that there is the experience.  I could easily fabricate some understanding of the experience and perhaps even present this understanding in a convincing manner that would at least give it merit enough to appear worthy of your consideration.  And, marildi, not all that long ago this is a likely scenario as to how I would have responded to your question.  Now, though, I realize that when it comes to that which is abstract e.g., consciousness, the mind, eternity, love, truth, knowledge, and so on&#8230;I do not know or understand anything.  Now that being said, I must add that I do not recognize any other individual that seemingly appears to me as being one who knows or understands either.  I do, though, seem to benefit in examining the interpretations, in their many creative forms, as offered by others&#8230;even if they are offering what they&#8217;re saying as being true (that, I believe, is the result of an incredibly common training program).  As long as one realizes that when it comes to addressing the abstract from the realm of perception there is no truth or understanding to be had, one can remain free to explore, look and adjust their desires, beliefs and interpretations as they see fit.</p> <p>Take care marildi.  I always enjoy our exchanges.  Much Love, Monte</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330520"> 		<div id="comment-330520"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329728"> 		<div id="comment-329728"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/ecd994d7f918147adaa53571480babdb?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Brian</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329728"> 				February 7, 2015 at 11:19 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329728#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329728", "329728", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Brian'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>no doubt Monte that to a large degree others are defined by our experience of them, colored by our own views and biases.</p> <p>but others do have an independent existence outside of our mental understanding and projection of them.</p> <p>I am coming to a conclusion as a result of the past few years of blogging here.</p> <p> I was a true believer for 11 years. Ran with Scientology celebrities, was in the Sea Org, was the first artist to perform at celebrity center when Yvonne got the OK to restart Celebrity Center on La Brea, was a Missionaire to find a new New York Org directly connected to Ron in the early seventies.<br /> So I have experience.</p> <p>My present view of Ron now, I know this can sound crazy to some, is that he is a sort of Raksaha as is talked about in Indian scriptures. He is a lower class of being who has certain powers and is inherently opposed to Righteousness and Dharma. </p> <p>He preaches a doctrine which is completely the opposite of any sage. He preaches a doctrine of eternal seperateness, eternal ego and hates Christ, hates Yoga, hates the concept of God as omnipresent, puts hate above sympathy on the tone scale, loves Crowley, says he&#8217;s the Prince of Darkness, say&#8217;s he&#8217;s Lucifer, says he&#8217;s the Beast 666.</p> <p>Metaphysically speaking L Ron Hubbard is NOT a being of the Light. </p> <p>Empathy and sympathy is considered a weakness by him.</p> <p>The family unit is made into the product of genetic ghosts and IS doctrinal source of all this family agony.</p> <p>L Ron Hubbard metaphysically speaking is a being from the dark side. Just look at the fruits. </p> <p>He knew and had certain hypnotic abilities and he used them not just in a stage entertainment way, he used them in a nefarious metaphysical way to create an empire of the cult of personality, power, money and control.</p> <p>Ask yourselves this question. When you think of the concepts or reality of God, where does your mind go? </p> <p>L Ron Hubbard hated God. L Ron Hubbard said that the only god that ever was is you. He said that, I read that.</p> <p>L Ron Hubbard payed no homage to any reality other than if it is true for you it is true.</p> <p>L Ron Hubbard was who he said he was. The Prince of Darkness, Lucifer and the Beast 666.</p> <p>What I mean by that is not that he was actually these symbolic personalities, but that because he enjoyed the monikers with a chuckle on one of his tapes, he reveals his own spiritual state as a man who is repulsed by common standards of decency.</p> <p>And beyond simple common standards of decency he was on the dark side of the metaphysical spectrum.</p> <p>He hate Christ. Christ stood for love.</p> <p>You and I were duped by a dark ignorant soul who had some psychic powers of manifestation, and a con mans understanding of the mind and spirit.</p> <p>&#8220;the truth though always fought, always in the end prevails&#8221; L Ron Hubbard</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-7 highlander-comment" 	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330031"> 		<div id="comment-330031"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330031"> 				February 11, 2015 at 3:03 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330031#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330031", "330031", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Monte'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Brian, I too used to believe this&#8230;&#8221;but others do have an independent existence outside of our mental understanding and projection of them.&#8221;  However, this belief ever so gradually gave way to the belief that the idea of there being individual beings is a misperception where what is unreal is accepted as being real.  While I cannot begin to conceive of, describe, define or explain&#8230;I believe that nonduality is actuality.  This is where my mind goes Brian when I think of the concepts of God and Reality, which is really, for me, beyond concepts and symbols.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-8 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330040"> 		<div id="comment-330040"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/ecd994d7f918147adaa53571480babdb?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Brian</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330040"> 				February 11, 2015 at 11:39 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330040#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330040", "330040", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Brian'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I see what you mean.  But, two different truths can be simultaneously opposed and in agreement.</p> <p>There is the absolute and the relative. In the absolute we are one. In the relative we are individual. The wave is the ocean and the ocean is the wave. But there are individual waves, are there not? Where does the wave begin and the ocean end?</p> <p> If we are the same individual then I want your car because it is mine. Hand it over bud!</p> <p>This is a great discussion Monte. Just marvelous.</p> <p>To play chess there is only one square chess board and many individual squares. How many squares to a chess board?</p> <p>Only one in reality, but many imaginary lines of demarcation to play the game.</p> <p>We are both the Unified Field that is omnipresent and the reflection of that omnipresence in our individual forms. </p> <p>We are both because we are One with the Grand Dreamer of dreams who dreams individual souls and universes for fun and play. In Sanskrit it is called Lila: The Lord&#8217;s Play or Sport</p> <p>We are made in It&#8217;s Image. Jesus said,&#8221;I and my Father are One.&#8221;</p> <p>Tat Tvam Asi&#8230;&#8230;&#8230;. Thou Art That</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330090"> 		<div id="comment-330090"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/d616319c9b45470e765e5dca0049c183?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Monte</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330090"> 				February 13, 2015 at 12:10 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330090#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330090", "330090", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Monte'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Brian, I could not begin to conceive of, explain or describe the abstract, which the word &#8216;absolute points to.  Yet, somehow I know of it and I feel pulled to it as do we all whether it is recognized or not.</p> <p>A few synonyms for the symbol &#8216;absolute&#8217; :  truth, knowledge, love, eternal, peace, consistency, mind, consciousness, God, light.  In the relative (what I refer to as being the universe of perception) these symbols point to the abstract that is beyond the relative as the relative and absolute cannot exist simultaneously.  Being that we cannot define or explain the abstract we invent all manner of symbols, stories, metaphors and allegories to point to the ineffable.  Unfortunately, though, the pointers are all to often interpreted to be literal and conflict with one another.</p> <p>The relative is both fragmented and fragmenting. It is constantly dividing, subdividing and compartmentalizing.   It is complex and complicated.  Everything that exists within the relative exists in a perpetual state of incompleteness.  In the relative MORE and LESS in are symbolized and manifested in form in seemingly infinite ways.  MORE and LESS sit as the ever ruling Gods of the relative and demand measurement, comparison and judgement of everything perceived.  In the relative where nothing is seen as being complete but is always in a state of needing, wanting more&#8230;all of the conflicting wants bring about a constant state of chaos.</p> <p>Brian, is it possible for there to be more than everything?  Can the waves ever really leave the ocean?  Can a singularity ever leave itself?  Can an absolute ever not be an absolute?</p> <p>I would say no to all the above questions.  However, the existence of a relative seems to prove otherwise doesn&#8217;t it.?  Personally, though, I believe that the relative and all its components is an unreality, an illusion, a dream, an hallucination.  I believe that we can never be anything other that what we are.  This is where I am in my beliefs now but I know that my beliefs are not true.  I know that I don&#8217;t know yet I continue to climb metaphors and allegories and symbols to the abstract.</p> <p>Rule of thumb:  if it can be measured it&#8217;s relative.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330147"> 		<div id="comment-330147"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/ecd994d7f918147adaa53571480babdb?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Brian</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330147"> 				February 14, 2015 at 7:55 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Both states of<br /> 1) Absolute Being, undifferentiated consciousness<br /> 2) a reflection of that Absolute radiating through our personalities.<br /> Are, the same thing. </p> <p>But we, consciousness, Are the dreamer and experiencer in all this.</p> <p>There is a state of consciousness called Nirvakalpa Samadhi. It is a state whereby the soul is simultaneously aware of having a body and living a life and being absorbed in Omnipresence within: All knowing</p> <p>That state is unshakable because the experiencer, the witness, of that state, has cognited on the root causes of matter itself. </p> <p>The double blind experiment, on waves vs particle, which would become Quantum Mechanics, was found to have the influence of the consciousness of the observer out outcomes.</p> <p>We are both the Absolute and the relative because we are the fulcrum upon which duality swings or stays still.</p> <p>That is what I mean, we are the fulcrum. Both duality and an absolutely stillness depend on a third factor: Consciousness; the fulcrum. Untouched by change yet its the reason the scales can sway.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330189"> 		<div id="comment-330189"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330189"> 				February 16, 2015 at 10:27 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>&#8220;We are both the Absolute and the relative because we are the fulcrum upon which duality swings or stays still.&#8221;</p> <p>Great line. Individuality does have it&#8217;s place, equal to that of &#8216;oneness&#8217;.  To ignore either is to lose half the truth.  Hubbard was quite correct in that work toward oneness ALONE will drive an individual down toward MEST and interiorize him into a solidity.  But he missed half the picture.  I used to believe that he eventually found the rest of the story and I simply hadn&#8217;t read or heard later lectures explaining it, but no, he didn&#8217;t.</p> <p> And the answer was just beyond the tips of his fingers.  But I long ago dispensed with the attitude that the tips of HIS fingers were my limit.<br /> Mark</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329725"> 		<div id="comment-329725"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/e7becb03c5b940c25177e04f9d36c61e?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/imcramer' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Don Cramer</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329725"> 				February 7, 2015 at 10:53 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329725#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329725", "329725", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Don Cramer'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thank you, Mark. Of course the ego (&#8220;I&#8221;) can be a useful tool if one can perceive it for what it is (an artificial construct) and not be controlled by it. But it should never be confused with consciousness (the &#8220;observer&#8221;) itself.  Living life as though awake in a dream gives one a sense of it.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329797"> 		<div id="comment-329797"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/f4dd23d6f380e5693407c8da3aed3807?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">MarkNR</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329797"> 				February 8, 2015 at 12:25 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329797#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329797", "329797", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to MarkNR'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Don said:<br /> &#8221; Living life as though awake in a dream gives one a sense of it.&#8221;</p> <p>What a fascinating analogy.<br /> Funny thing though.  I can never recall, so far, to an early point in which I did not feel as an individual.  Even when I was playing the part of several individuals at the same time, I always considered myself as me, myself.  Even when I knew I was everything and everyone around me, I still had a central sense of Me. </p> <p>There have been several times lately, of great affinity, when I was the same person as another.  I was not joined with that other, I was not intimately connected with the other, I was the same person as he or she while myself at the same time. </p> <p>I have learned a few things, but I still have a long way to go.<br /> Mark</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329867"> 		<div id="comment-329867"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/e7becb03c5b940c25177e04f9d36c61e?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/imcramer' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Don Cramer</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329867"> 				February 8, 2015 at 6:50 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329867#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329867", "329867", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Don Cramer'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>&#8220;I was the same person as he or she while myself at the same time&#8221;. I have pondered that before as well. The word &#8220;as&#8221; meaning &#8220;the same&#8221; does correspond to a unity with.<br /> But with all things, Ron he is expert at inconsistency. What is Greatness vs Destroy Utterly for example.</p> <p>Surviving &#8220;as&#8221; the dynamics vs. merging into the Unified Field Of Consciousness is a downed toned becoming MEST.</p> <p>So that would make the 6th Dynamic: surviving as and for the Material Universe null and void.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329880"> 		<div id="comment-329880"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/f4dd23d6f380e5693407c8da3aed3807?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">MarkNR</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329880"> 				February 8, 2015 at 11:20 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329880#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329880", "329880", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to MarkNR'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Acting as, or working toward, or Being the dynamics is a gradient thing with occasional and temporary leap as one becomes aware or more aware of something. At it&#8217;s height, being the dynamics fully does not mean losing your self.  It means gaining everything else.  &#8216;Me&#8217; need not be lost, but expanded, broadened.  Human words fail.  </p> <p>When an artist becomes, say, one with his violin, it becomes an extension of his hands, the sound comes forth with barely a notice of the position of the bow or fingers, his individuality is not reduced.  When in a late night   perfect conversation with a good friend, and you begin to think the same things and answer questions before they are asked, one is not diminished by it.  As one expands, self is not lessened.  Physical and emotional love, when perfect, is a slightly higher gradient.  There are higher gradients still.<br /> I will try to explain in a more duplicatable manner in the future.<br /> Mark</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329898"> 		<div id="comment-329898"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329898"> 				February 9, 2015 at 3:07 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329898#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329898", "329898", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Mark, somewhere LRH said a thetan can be anything he wants to be while still remaining himself. Once one has decided to be something, how does he completely release that and decide to be something else.  How do you completely release experience while retaining the knowledge and experience gained.  A long sought piece of information.</p> <p>Well, I&#8217;ll keep at it and keep you informed.<br /> Mark</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329935"> 		<div id="comment-329935"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329935"> 				February 9, 2015 at 4:57 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329935#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329935", "329935", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>There is no &#8220;self&#8221; Do you man that the dynamics are the component parts of self and in their whole make up the self?<br /> It was my thought that the dynamics are a description of the activities of the self, but do not define the self itself.</p> <p>Hmmmmm. Your statement suggests that the individual consists entirely of it&#8217;s activities.<br /> Mark</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330504"> 		<div id="comment-330504"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330504"> 				February 22, 2015 at 7:07 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330504#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330504", "330504", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>The concept of DYNAMICS by Hubbard is a perfect human-centric view of life and existence. It is built on the idea of human self.</p> <p>Centered on the human self is the family, then human groups of increasing sizes, and then the whole mankind. These are the first four dynamics.</p> <p>At fifth dynamic we have life other than mankind. It provides us with a human-centric view of life.</p> <p>At sixth and seventh dynamics we find a sharp division between spirit and matter. This again is a human-centric view that elevates spirit over matter. They are looked upon as separate existences that interact to produce life.</p> <p>At eighth dynamic we have the concept of Supreme Being. It is the concept of pure Cause that produces the universe. It projects itself outwards as spirit which impinges on dead and inert matter to produce life.</p> <p><b>The human-centric view projects humanlike “beingness” as Cause of this universe.</b></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330543"> 		<div id="comment-330543"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/ecd994d7f918147adaa53571480babdb?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://deleted' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Brian</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330543"> 				February 23, 2015 at 2:47 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I am thinking MarkNR that maybe Vinaire does not have a self. Vinaire&#8217;s self is changing every moment and there is no permanent or immortall core underlying it.</p> <p>Brian, it is my turn to ask you a direct question.</p> <p><b>1) Do you believe that there is an eternal thetan? Or an immortal soul?</b> (Both are the same thing by the way.)</p> <p> This is on the same level as your Xenu question.<br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330505"> 		<div id="comment-330505"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330505"> 				February 22, 2015 at 7:09 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330505#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330505", "330505", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>If we look with mindfulness, we find that the dichotomy “Cause-effect” is an integral aspect of the Universe. Cause does not lie outside of the Universe since the boundary of universe is not marked by effect.</p> <p>“Cause-effect” may be represented by a scale made up of infinite gradients. The two ends shall stretch into infinity in opposite directions. Neither cause  nor effect are absolute. It would be nice to think of Eighth Dynamic as “absolute cause” but that appears to be inconsistent.</p> <p><b>The postulate of Eighth Dynamic as “absolute cause” indicates human-centric fixation.</b></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330572"> 		<div id="comment-330572"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/f4dd23d6f380e5693407c8da3aed3807?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">MarkNR</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330572"> 				February 23, 2015 at 11:35 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Vin.<br /> Your view and my view differ significantly. If there is any beingness at Eighth Dynamic, it is the whole Universe with nothing excluded. This is the superset of all existence real or imagined, rational or irrational. This beingness extends beyond the human dynamics of self, family, groups and mankind to all other life and substances and the underlying spiritual and material aspects.</p> <p><b>The Eighth Dynamic is the complete spectrum of awareness and motion.</b></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330507"> 		<div id="comment-330507"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330507"> 				February 22, 2015 at 7:11 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330507#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330507", "330507", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>The boundary of the universe is, thus, marked by no awareness and no motion. The major aspects of the Universe are awareness (spirit) and motion (matter), which are expressed as seventh and sixth dynamics. These two aspects go hand-in-hand. Even inanimate matter is composed of motion and awareness at atomic level. “Spirit” or awareness cannot be isolated as some absolute condition existing by itself. It would be nice to think of spirit as “superior” but that appears to be a human-centric fixation.</p> <p><b>The Seventh and Sixth Dynamics describe the two key aspects of the Eighth Dynamic.</b></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330578"> 		<div id="comment-330578"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/f4dd23d6f380e5693407c8da3aed3807?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">MarkNR</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330578"> 				February 24, 2015 at 12:48 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Vinaire.<br /> You have sparked a realization in myself that i had not expected. 	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-9 highlander-comment"
