vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Awareness (spirit) and motion (matter) evolve together from simplicity toward complexity. Thus we have electromagnetic radiation, fundamental particles, atoms, molecules, material combinations, cells, organisms, plants, animals and finally humans. This evolution is covered by the Fifth and Fourth Dynamics.</p> <p><b>The Fifth and Fourth Dynamics describe the evolution of awareness and motion as life.</b></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330509"> 		<div id="comment-330509"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330509"> 				February 22, 2015 at 7:15 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330509#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330509", "330509", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Humans as the Fourth Dynamic seems to be the ultimate in evolution of life. It is a very complex combination of motion and awareness. Human species operated at first on instincts alone. Interaction with different geographies and climates produced different races over time. As human awareness evolved under different conditions, different cultures and political subdivisions came about.</p> <p><b>The Third Dynamic came about as human awareness evolved into races, cultures and political groups.</b></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330510"> 		<div id="comment-330510"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330510"> 				February 22, 2015 at 7:17 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330510#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330510", "330510", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Families have been the product of cultural evolution. It provided an environment in which children could be raised to become productive members of the society. The sex act was always there, but the family structure now provided a better organization of the need to reproduce, protect and rear children.</p> <p><b>The Second Dynamic came about as a better organization of the need to reproduce, protect and rear children.</b></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330511"> 		<div id="comment-330511"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330511"> 				February 22, 2015 at 7:18 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330511#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330511", "330511", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Human ability to solve problems also evolved with awareness. With this ability arose differences among people and thus the sense of  self. The earliest focus was on areas of basic sustenance, such as, food, shelter and security. This was followed by barter. Communities evolved around these needs and the knowledge to meet them. Travel required the study of stars in heavens as guides. Birth and death lead to speculations. Religion became a repository of knowledge and a guide to social organization. Increasingly, problems were solved by individuals. Self was perceived as the source of action.</p> <p><b>The First Dynamic came about with the recognition of problem-solving abilities.</b></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330512"> 		<div id="comment-330512"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330512"> 				February 22, 2015 at 7:20 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330512#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330512", "330512", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>As the individual problem-solving abilities have grown, so have the knowledge and awareness of the Universe. Science has focused on improving physical comforts of life because it is easier to look at physical phenomena objectively. It has been more difficult to look at the spiritual phenomena objectively. But this is the direction to take to further improve the problem-solving abilities.</p> <p><b>To improve problem-solving abilities we need to start looking at the spiritual phenomena more objectively.</b></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330513"> 		<div id="comment-330513"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330513"> 				February 22, 2015 at 7:23 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330513#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330513", "330513", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>The Eighth Dynamic has essentially evolved into the seven dynamics below it. It is the evolution of motion and awareness toward increasing complex configurations. Trouble spots occur when inconsistencies are introduced and harmony is disturbed. But that is part of evolution.</p> <p><b>Any harmony and disharmony is part of evolution.</b></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330515"> 		<div id="comment-330515"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330515"> 				February 22, 2015 at 7:25 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330515#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330515", "330515", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>The Universe is a spectrum of motion and awareness. It seems to come about as a transition from no motion and non-awareness. It may transition back into no motion and non-awareness. The expanded Eighth Dynamic shall include motion and awareness as well as no-motion and non-awareness.</p> <p><b>The expanded Eighth Dynamic consists of the Universe cycling between awareness and non-awareness.</b></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329364"> 		<div id="comment-329364"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329364"> 				February 4, 2015 at 12:31 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329364#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329364", "329364", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>And, here is my criticism of the belief contained in Scientology FACTOR  #1:</p> <p><a href="http://vinaire.me/2012/10/23/scientology-factor-1/" rel="nofollow"><b>An Analysis of Scientology Factor # 1</b></a><br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329332"> 		<div id="comment-329332"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/ebc6d41df2d8f0b6c29205ac19ae1679?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Kim</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329332"> 				February 4, 2015 at 2:15 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329332#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329332", "329332", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Kim'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thanks for the post marty.<br /> It helps me as a non scientologist get a frame of reference.<br /> I have to say though, that the materials for me, seems really absolutely way out there. This has been going on for at least 7 years, hot and heavy. Not only that, but the pressure is still high for trainees from orgs, OTs redoing their Bridge with GAT 2, and such. In short, the &#8220;true believers&#8221;. Local orgs, if not ideal, essentially don&#8217;t have the right to hold on to their public, apparently. The &#8216;net really doesn&#8217;t have much to do with it. True believers don&#8217;t look at it anyway. Any outward advertising is targeted mainly to keep the true believers convinced the church is expanding. It&#8217;s pretty sordid.</p> <p>Millions of people is a pretty high number. I hope you are counting since 1950 and also the ripple effect for people who actually got better. That said, that number is a bit out of your hat as well. What possible factual figures would you be looking at?</p> <p>Yup &#8211; there are haters for sure. There are lots. Getting out of the church is a pretty daunting experience for many. Lots of odd emotional responses, and lots of confusion. However, there are easily many, many more who are trying to come to grips about what they have experienced, and how they let that happen to themselves, and so on.</p> <p>Personally I really don&#8217;t think DM is the problem, and he is an easy target. I think the more germane problem is how many let him get away with what he does. Once, when I was working in an org, there was an HCO interog regarding using physical violence against people in Scn. I can only imagine those poor MAA&#8217;s faces when they started realizing how far up the org board it went. And I would bet real money all many ultimately did was disconnect from the truth. When I realized how far up it did go, I simply stopped supporting anything Scn related, myself.</p> <p>However, many have quite loudly and vocally left and begun to call attention to those abuses, and I believe this is actually the ultimate undoing of the organization. Still, it is a hard pill to swallow when you see the church promoting HUman RIghts when the highest ecclisiastical members are regularly whistleblowing the lack thereof in their own organization. It&#8217;s like being a pornographer and supporting celibacy. Personally, I fail to see any good the church has done on the 4D. Following the logic of dynamics, it takes strong individuals to make strong groups to make strong impacts on a global scale. I don&#8217;t see how making slaves of one&#8217;s fellows is going to do any good for anyone, anywhere. Frankly, I don&#8217;t see how you can think so as well.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd There are no BELIEFS in Scientology.  It either works or it doesn’t work, it is basically a set of tools hence it really has nothing to do with belief.  On the other hand The Church of Scientology very definitely is a belief system, and it is impossible to embrace the belief system of the Church of Scientology and still maintain another belief system intact for the simple reason that for L.R.H. the Church of Scientology was and is his personal belief system hence he sees it as “the religion of religions” which I cannot help thinking may be where Alistair Crowley was coming from.</p> <p>Unfortunately once one has embraced the belief system of the Church of Scientology and found it wanting it is often the case that the person who has lost their faith in the “Church” also loses their belief in the workability of the technology of Scientology.</p> <p>It reminds me of what happens when a child loses respect for their parents and as a result rejects any good advice that those parents might offer.  The expression “Throw out the baby with the bath water” comes to mind. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Throw_out_the_baby_with_the_bath_water" rel="nofollow">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Throw_out_the_baby_with_the_bath_water</a>        </p> <p>Love with ARC<br /> Pip</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329356"> 		<div id="comment-329356"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://i2.wp.com/graph.facebook.com/v2.2/638982191/picture?q=type%3Dlarge&#038;resize=48%2C48' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.facebook.com/638982191' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Dan Locke</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329356"> 				February 4, 2015 at 10:43 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329356#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329356", "329356", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Dan Locke'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Well said. In short, all homosexuality is covertly hostile, out-of-valence and degenerate activity, correct? (As a dramatic example of SOS book technology.) Or, Pain and Sex are implants by the psychs of long ago? Just because someone can remember a past-life, does not also immediately mean he is covered with entities that challenge him at every go in life. This is all Scn. technology. And if you are not getting results with it then it ultimately comes down to what&#8217;s wrong with you, correct?</p> <p>My friend, they are not that different. There is plenty of Hubbard belief in the technology.Factually, Hubbard refers to his &#8220;admin tech&#8221; as 3D technology, and places it on par with 1D technology. I mean, really, what is your line between the two?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology even depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330057"> 		<div id="comment-330057"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330057"> 				February 12, 2015 at 8:15 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330057#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330057", "330057", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to christianscientology'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hi Another Thought</p> <p>Certainly any technology that doesn’t work, if you become critical and start to blame the technology, it has to be you misapplied it, had M.U’s or overts.  There is a line in A COURSE IN MIRACLES that says “the blameless cannot blame”.  Please note there are two definitions for the word ‘critical’.  One is continuing or making severe or negative judgements.  The second is containing analytical evaluations.  To be negative about anything is to choose disharmony rather than harmony.</p> <p>If a person truly knows “who they are” it is impossible to blame anyone or anything, because the truth is everything I see in my external world is only a projection of my internal world.</p> <p>As for homosexuality, well there has been a revolution in that area over the past twenty years or so, something for me as a 73 year old I am still trying to catch up with.  However promiscuity whether homo. or hetro. is an indication of a chronic low tone.</p> <p>Since I never got further than Clear in the Church my knowledge of implants and BT’S is very sketchy.  I got fabulous results from my study of Scientology but then I long since stopped thinking I might find unconditional love in the Church. </p> <p>I find no conflict between admin. tech and any of the other tech.  I use ethics tech. in my business and admin tech but the difference is I endeavour not to let the tech become senior to the THETA (LOVE).  Where is my line between the two? Scientology works, L.R.H.’s belief system and world view is interesting but is very definitely HIS PHILOSOPHY, which is available for me to “cherry pick” where and when or not at all as I choose.</p> <p>Love with Understanding<br /> Pip</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330144"> 		<div id="comment-330144"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/29dcfeba3e87700f98744ea6a73bf8a6?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Another Thought</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330144"> 				February 14, 2015 at 6:59 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330144#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330144", "330144", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Another Thought'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Removing any good or bad connotations, and Scientology in its most pure and simplest form is a system, and essentially like any other system. One can obviously cherry pick out what they want but then that is not a representation of what it actually is in its fullest form then, does it? One of the best lines that I felt suckered people into the subject is that it is not a belief system. It very surely is and Hubbard’s assertions to the contrary. </p> <p>Case in point, friction is friction, and will be produced regardless of whether one believes it will happen or not, whether one is critical of it or not, whether one has “overts” against whatever objects one is using to produce it or not. Nothing in Scientology can hold up against that test.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology even depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330322"> 		<div id="comment-330322"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330322"> 				February 19, 2015 at 6:07 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330322#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330322", "330322", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to christianscientology'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hi Another Thought<br /> From my viewpoint the basic observations in Scientology are in the same order of scientific fact, as is friction.  Take for instance the cycle of action that states that everything goes through a process of START-CHANGE-STOP.  Even friction must follow this &#8220;scientific principle&#8221;, if it didn&#8217;t your break pads would never wear out.</p> <p>I would be interested to hear any example you can conceive of where something in the physical universe violates the process of start-change-stop.</p> <p>Yours<br /> Pip</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Here is relevant information about Hinduism related to what you are referring to.</p> <p><a 	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-331001"> 		<div id="comment-331001"> 		<div 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-331001"> 				March 8, 2015 at 10:20 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I still maintain that Scientology is Cosmic Hinduism.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-pizzajack even depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330001"> 		<div id="comment-330001"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/0ddf391a6d27c629385d7419b3432688?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">mwesten</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330001"> 				February 10, 2015 at 7:56 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330001#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330001", "330001", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to mwesten'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>To measure whether a tool &#8220;works&#8221; one must first grasp its purpose. What was it created for? Is one using it in the manner it was intended?</p> <p>The &#8220;self-stated&#8221; purpose of Scientology is arguably the attainment of &#8220;OT&#8221; (via &#8220;the State of Clear&#8221;). Its pursuit obviously requires an acceptance this purpose is worthy. Broken down, this involves a belief in Hubbard and his authority. Belief in the existence of these states and that they can be achieved through one&#8217;s submission to, and participation in, Scientology therapy.</p> <p>Belief.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology odd alt depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330063"> 		<div id="comment-330063"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330063"> 				February 12, 2015 at 10:06 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330063#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330063", "330063", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to christianscientology'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thanks mwesten</p> <p>I agree with your first paragraph but let’s take an example of a Scientology tool.  Take for instance “Communication is the universal solvent”.  Here is a very workable tool.  If I want to know something I need to communicate.  I can’t think of a single activity that does not involve communication of one sort or another.</p> <p>The “self-stated” purpose of Scientology is best expressed through the definition of a Scientologist, namely “one who has found a way to a better life and is actively achieving it by studying the material of Scientology” and that is certainly true for me.</p> <p>However I was fortunate to get thrown out of the Church before I had done any more than the Clearing Course.  I am Clear nine hundred and something.</p> <p>I say fortunate because if I hadn’t been I may not of found Jesus Christ and I would still be craving the love that attracted me to Scientology in the first place.</p> <p>Every human being who gets into Scientology craves unconditional love, and hoped they would find it in The Church and all they found was UNDERSTANDING and although that satisfies the mind the heart remains bereft. Only by reconnecting with our creator can the heart be satisfied.</p> <p>Take it from me only when the void at the centre of each being has been filled will the desperate search for ultimate meaning be over.</p> <p>Love with Understanding<br /> Pip</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-melyanna even thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329353"> 		<div id="comment-329353"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/bddec305d33d9a0fd0af7c6bf2adb1d1?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://melyanna.tumblr.com/' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Melyanna</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329353"> 				February 4, 2015 at 10:17 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329353#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329353", "329353", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Melyanna'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Any cult that presented a smiliar set of beliefs in this exact way would be viewed by most people as a fad, while Scientology has a big number of followers (compared to other &#8220;recent&#8221; cults anyway).<br /> I wonder if the practice of limiting access to some of these points until a person is much deeper into the study of Scientology is the only thing that makes a difference, or if there is some other factor that helps making this cult stand out and have more credibility.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329370"> 		<div id="comment-329370"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329370"> 				February 4, 2015 at 1:22 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329370#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329370", "329370", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Good question! But there was a time when going into a Scientology Organization, (one far far away from&#8221;management&#8221; and the police force) meant having a lot of fun, with a lot of laid back people, who had very good intentions, were very helpful and respectful to the others. It was very fun and exciting and every one was having a really good time. It was very easy to buy courses and counseling. It was very accessible,nobody was paranoid,nobody was getting punished.  Really, you could do no wrong. THAT was a &#8220;safe environment where auditing could occur&#8221;.   That was when it was packed with curious (and educated) people.</p> <p>I do not think they have &#8221; a big number of followers&#8221; as you now suggest.</p> <p>It has been a real drag to walk into one of those places since 1982.  David Miscavige sent soldiers all the down into the streets and people&#8217;s living rooms to wipe out the missions (small intimate groups). Cutting off the feeder lines to the Orgs, and causing a mass exodus.</p> <p>You can see it reflected on these graphs in this article:</p> <p><a href="http://www.mikerindersblog.org/scientology-shriveling-media-take-note-they-lie-to-you/" rel="nofollow">http://www.mikerindersblog.org/scientology-shriveling-media-take-note-they-lie-to-you/</a></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329514"> 		<div id="comment-329514"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/0badc5640af149979f85ab7346205e34?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/jumpingjack' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Jumping Jack</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329514"> 				February 5, 2015 at 2:09 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329514#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329514", "329514", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Jumping Jack'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>&#8220;Big number of followers&#8221; &#8211; mmm&#8230;? One is &#8220;the clear cog&#8221; which is contained in Viktor Frankl&#8217;s books as well many other works. The service facsimile is a related subject, but the specifics of it have been very helpful to me in looking at myself (and others) and seeing where life went off track, was too painful to confront, and the resulting &#8220;solution&#8221; which ever after, was clung to as if to a life raft. Fascinating stuff to me. I have witnessed others making lasting, life-changing gains, as well &#8211; the kind that everyone who knew them would observe. There&#8217;s some good stuff, for sure, but I have gotten more gains with it on my own, using it as I see fit, than I did in the church, where there was a suppressing agenda. I like to be able to pick and choose, not only from what I have learned through scn, but from the whole wide world of knowledge that is available. I did not interpret LRH&#8217;s &#8220;discard&#8221; of his body to have anything to do with what I should do. I thought it was all about his research.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329393"> 		<div id="comment-329393"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://i2.wp.com/graph.facebook.com/v2.2/650211981/picture?q=type%3Dlarge%26_md5%3Da108e6178a1096a312524e6ce79bb90d&#038;resize=48%2C48' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.facebook.com/650211981' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Daron Ryan</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329393"> 				February 4, 2015 at 6:35 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329393#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329393", "329393", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Daron Ryan'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thank you for publishing a clear, simple and largely objective description of Scientology. I think that is where the craft got a little seedy.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329423"> 		<div id="comment-329423"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/fc21e21e4ae412d49feac4779a9e0dcd?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">palehorse</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329423"> 				February 4, 2015 at 10:31 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329423#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329423", "329423", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to palehorse'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Has no one noticed that Mark does not refer to himself as Marty? The problem is that at the very heart of existence is a profound MYSTERY which can only be approached by FAITH (Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen. – Hebrews 11:1 – King James Bible)</p> <p>What drew me into Scientology was the belief that I COULD KNOW but of course if you can know you don’t need faith, and without faith THERE IS NO HUMILITY, there is NO LOVE and certainly NO FORGIVENESS.</p> <p>For 40 years I have been communicating off and on with The Church of Scientology through the C.J.C here in England, and the reply is always the same “your only recourse is steps A to E, and my plea that I was never a Suppressive Person falls on deaf ears.</p> <p>You might well ask why do I persist. That is because I believe in the technology.  In the Seventies I was declared P.T.S. and was given an S &amp; D supervised by L.R.H. on board the then Royal Scotsman.  My item was SCIENTOLOGY – L.R.H. wrote in my P.C. folder “Give him his item and get him out of the area”. That left me two choices, 1) Handle my suppressive or 2) disconnect.  I chose the former, which brings us to P.T.</p> <p>It has been there in the Bible all along in the allegory of the Garden of Eden, we were never told we could not eat of the TREE OF LIFE but we were warned of the consequences of eating from the TREE OF THE KNOWLEDGE OF GOOD AND EVIL, and of course the rest is history.</p> <p>Talking of history this video graphically shows what the results are when we believe that knowledge brings certainty.  <a href="http://www.dailymotion.com/video/x20ohne_bbc-ascent-of-man-11-knowledge-or-certainty_tv" rel="nofollow">http://www.dailymotion.com/video/x20ohne_bbc-ascent-of-man-11-knowledge-or-certainty_tv</a> </p> <p>Love with ARC<br /> Pip</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329474"> 		<div id="comment-329474"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329474"> 				February 5, 2015 at 9:58 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329474#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329474", "329474", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>FIXED IDEAS = FALSE CERTAINTY = FALSE SECURITY = SCIENTOLOGY</p> <p>Why does one wants to be in good standing with Scientology? Why does one want the false security of Scientology? The &#8220;technology&#8221; that one has learnt from Scientology cannot be taken away from one even if the Church has declared one a suppressive person.</p> <p>So, why does one want to be back in good standing with Scientology?</p> <p>Because, one has been hypnotized into believing that one&#8217;s eternity depends on Scientology..</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- river cannot rise higher than its source, and for someone who follows L.R.H. exclusively and that includes most in the church, they will never develop anymore humility than they were graced with when they got involved.  Ron was a very capable man but humble he was not!</p> <p>The standard tests of humility he failed on miserably which are best expounded by Jesus in the Sermon on the Mount Matthew chapters 5-6. Namely “Turn the other cheek” ”love your enemies” “do good to those that persecute you” “walk the extra mile” etc. These are sadly missing in the tenants of Scientology.</p> <p>I don’t think L.R.H. lacked faith, he just saw no place for it in his world view.</p> <p>Love<br /> Pip</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330079"> 		<div id="comment-330079"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330079"> 				February 12, 2015 at 11:01 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330079#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330079", "330079", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Pip, LRH actually does talk about faith. It’s at the top of one of the columns of the Chart of Attitudes. And here’s what he says about it in a lecture:</p> <p>“The first cause, the first prime thought, is TO BE – moving from a state of not-beingness to a state of beingness. That is a decision and that is a postulate. And once that is undertaken it airs out into the spheres of motion or activity in life. To continue being, of course, one has to go through these various changes, because the whole environment shifts. So does the individual. But this decision TO BE is ahead of all these other decisions, and the only thing that can happen after TO BE is modification. You can’t close out that first decision. The consistency of that first decision is very powerful, very strong. </p> <p>“This is the first act below faith. Faith is sort of above all this and faith is actually a state of not-beingness. Faith is the word which describes the life static. That emerges from faith.<br /> […]<br /> “This situation of being faith or having faith is very interesting. You are faith!” </p> <p>(from “CAUSE AND EFFECT &#8211; PART I, a lecture given on 19 November 1951, Being and Not Being”)</p> <p>Here’s the link if you want to read the whole transcript: <a href="http://www.matrixfiles.com/Scientology%20Materials/Tapes%20in%20order/5100c00%20Tape%20Transcripts/TXT/5111C19A%20CAUSE%20AND%20EFFECT%20-%20PART%20I.txt" rel="nofollow">http://www.matrixfiles.com/Scientology%20Materials/Tapes%20in%20order/5100c00%20Tape%20Transcripts/TXT/5111C19A%20CAUSE%20AND%20EFFECT%20-%20PART%20I.txt</a></p> <p>Btw, I like this definition of “faith” from my Webster’s Seventh New Collegiate Dictionary: “complete confidence”</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology even depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330133"> 		<div id="comment-330133"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330133"> 				February 14, 2015 at 4:28 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330133#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330133", "330133", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to christianscientology'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hi Marildi<br /> Very interesting! &#8220;The first cause, the first prime thought, is TO BE&#8221;.  This is so true.  However as per the FACTORS it starts &#8220;BEFORE THE BEGINNING&#8221;, here is the SOURCE of FAITH.  As Ron says faith is above TO BE.  Scientology does not get involved in the area beyond TO BE (BEINGNESS) because beyond beingness the technology no longer applies.  This is the realm of UNCONDITIONAL LOVE, the realm of the EIGHTH DYNAMIC.  Here we find ONENESS instead of INDIVIDUALITY but where individuality is contained.  AFFINITY is a scale of attitudes that falls away from the CO-EXISTENCE OF STATIC, but LOVE (unconditional love) will forever be beyond affinity for affinity can not even exist unless DISTANCE is postulated.</p> <p>Thanks for that definition of faith and it works well in terms of M.E.S.T., but in terms of THETA I like UNDESERVED FAVOUR.</p> <p>Lots of love<br /> Pipx</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330165"> 		<div id="comment-330165"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330165"> 				February 15, 2015 at 10:06 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330165#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330165", "330165", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>&#8220;&#8230;affinity can not even exist unless DISTANCE is postulated.&#8221;</p> <p>Generally, yes. However, there is also the following definition of affinity: </p> <p>6 . in its truest definition which is coincidence of location and beingness, that is the ultimate in affinity. </p> <p>In that case, there would be no distance. And people do have this kind of experience. Here&#8217;s one description of it, where it&#8217;s jocularly referred to as OOB sex:</p> <p><span class='embed-youtube' style='text-align:center; display: block;'><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='500' height='312' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/mNORW0C2tpA?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' frameborder='0' allowfullscreen='true'></iframe></span></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology even depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330323"> 		<div id="comment-330323"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330323"> 				February 19, 2015 at 6:16 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330323#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330323", "330323", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to christianscientology'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hi loveliness!<br /> Let&#8217;s take your &#8220;6. in its truest definition which is coincidence of location and beingness, that is the ultimate in affinity.&#8221;  If we assume A THETAN is located in SPACE and TIME then by definition a thetan has MASS.  Now we know that &#8220;two objects may not occupy the same space at the same time and that if they do it will cause the vanishment of both objects. Hence if two thetans occupy the same space all MASS is &#8216;asised&#8217; and what is left is THETA which is unconditional love &#8211; NOT AFFINITY.</p> <p>As for OOB sex, bring it on.  Sounds like an extension of &#8220;phone sex&#8221; or maybe cyberspace sex, like we have, but of course in the &#8220;best possible taste&#8221;.</p> <p>Lots of love<br /> Pip</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-8 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330363"> 		<div id="comment-330363"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330363"> 				February 19, 2015 at 10:49 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330363#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330363", "330363", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hi Pip, my pet  <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-smile' title=':)'>:)</span></p> <p>The “combining of energies” (as worded in the video) in the same space would not be the same as any (or all) of the particles of those energies occupying the same space. class="comment-body"><p>Hi Sweet one!<br /> Energies can indeed combine, but that is in terms of sharing SIMILAR SPACES.  The Axioms of Scientology define ENERGY as &#8220;postulated particles in space&#8221; and since two particles may not occupy the same space at the same time without their vanishment it surely follows that two energies cannot occupy the same space at the same time, but that in no way precludes two energies interacting with each other. In Chapter One it says that “man is made in the image and likeness of God” and it also says “God is spirit”.  In the second Chapter of Genesis it says “man became a living being”, not man was but man became.  Just as in the Factors it says “Before the beginning was a cause and the entire purpose of the cause was the creation of effect, IN THE BEGINNING WAS THE DECISION AND THE DECISION WAS TO BE. ending for this lunacy.</p> <p> I recommend Edward Gibbon’s book “The History of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire: Abridge Edition”, particularly Chapter XV “The Progress of the Christian religion, and the Sentiments, Manners, Numbers, and Condition, of the primitive Christians.”</p> <p>The chapter is hilarious, written with Gibbon’s wit and humor. It is an uncanny description of Scientology and Scientologists behavior and beliefs system down to a T. </p> <p>The earlier so called Christians sects, whatever that meant, were universally mocked and rejected as Scientologists are today. </p> <p>The reasons why they were so ridiculed had nothing to do with the propaganda spun by the official Church for millennia.</p> <p>No, the original Christians were so despised because they misappropriated every pagan Mythos, ritual and belief system known in the ancient world and literalized it into historical facts.</p> <p>Proclaiming at all times their exclusivity to the truth, the uniqueness of their revelation and their entitlement to overlord the uncouth heathens.</p> <p>No, no, ONLY their Gospels had the verbatim word of God, and the ONLY way to salvation. Nobody in the entire history of the world had ever know anything of value, let alone state the same things these morons were preaching.</p> <p>Presumptuous, arrogant and stupid they brought down the Greco-Roman Civilization and sunk the West into a stupor for more than a thousand years.</p> <p>Scientology apologists are going to have a very rude awakening as the world pushes back on their stupidity.</p> <p>.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-martyrathbun09 comment-author-is-site-member bypostauthor odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329510"> 		<div id="comment-329510"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/c2d94d163a566268e73c8b0195b6c03a?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Mark C. Jesus was not a CHRISTIAN in fact, the rulers of the synagogues saw him as a heretic in Jewish terms. JESUS DID NOT COME TO START A NEW RELIGION, HE CAME TO RESTORE A RELATIONSHIP, FIRST WITH OUR MAKER AND THEN WITH OUR BROTHERS.</p> <p>Christian was not a name the followers of Jesus called themselves, this was a term of derision used by NONE-BELIEVERS (Acts 11:26), believers called themselves “Followers of the way” (Acts 9:2) Constantine historically was the first person to call himself “A CHRISTIAN” not because he followed Jesus but for political expedience.  I would argue that in fact Constantine was the first Christian and it was him and his followers that instigated Churchianity.  One only has to look at the number of schisms in Christianity to see how EXCLUSIVE it is.</p> <p>Jesus Christ is both totally inclusive and totally exclusive for his teachings are the ultimate paradox.  While inviting everyone to come to him at the same time He affirms that He is the only way, “Jesus said to him, &#8220;I am the way, and the truth, and the life; …….” John 14:6 NASB. This is because his was and is the way of UNCONDITIONAL LOVE and without such love one is ultimately excluded from The Kingdom of Heaven.</p> <p>Love with ARC<br /> Pip</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329875"> 		<div id="comment-329875"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/ecd994d7f918147adaa53571480babdb?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://deleted' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Brian</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329875"> 				February 8, 2015 at 9:19 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329875#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329875", "329875", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Brian'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Yes I understand this. My point is, in my opinion, a true Christian is one who follows the most important commandment. When Mathew asked him which one it was he said, and I know you know this already, but I am bringing it up to share my understanding of my relation with him:</p> <p>“&#8217;Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.&#8217; This is the first and greatest commandment. And the second is like it: &#8216;Love your neighbor as yourself.&#8217;</p> <p>This is the essence of Christianity for me. I need no cement walled church, nor authoritative interpreter of scripture, nor dogmatic &#8220;only way&#8221; theology to live this.</p> <p>It is free like the air, a portable joy and divine blueprint for human interaction. </p> <p>This law of the Spirit was the one Ron was most ignorant of. And in that ignorance, to a great degree, made it hard for Scientologists to develop a personal relation with the Supreme.</p> <p>When the ego is god, God is nowhere to be consciously found.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology odd alt depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329908"> 		<div id="comment-329908"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329908"> 				February 9, 2015 at 6:24 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329908#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329908", "329908", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to christianscientology'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hi Brian</p> <p>You make me smile, I love it when people change the goal posts.</p> <p>Your first post started off with “Christianity and Churchianity” and now it has changed to what “a TRUE Christian is”.  I would be interested to hear what you deem to be the difference between a Christian and a TRUE Christian is.</p> <p>I wonder if the same differentiation can be made between a Scientologist and a TRUE Scientologist.  I endeavour to be both a true Christian and a true Scientologist.</p> <p>Scientology for me is “knowing in the fullest sense of the word through study”, and that applies equally to the physical world as to the metaphysical world.</p> <p>Love with understanding<br /> Pip</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-8 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329952"> 		<div id="comment-329952"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/ecd994d7f918147adaa53571480babdb?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Brian</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329952"> 				February 9, 2015 at 6:22 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329952#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329952", "329952", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Brian'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>What Jesus said. And no, I haven&#8217;t been talking the usual line that the Church of Scientology does not equal Freezone/Independent Scientology, either.</p> <p>I only have respect and feel close to people like Anonymous because they indeed challenge suppression and oppression, and among other things, they are among the few people who instead of parroting the usual press lines about Greece (how we are all lazy etc) they viewed a different angle. An angle that I have observed too.</p> <p>People who represent suppressive religions and corporations who have been jolly well making profit out of the slave labor and brainwashing of others, are not my friends just because they attack the suppression and oppression within Scientology. Their talk is just disturbing to me, and means nothing more, as they talk about their beliefs or asserted beliefs and nothing that they personally know. Few are those who had experiences from inside, and not all of them say the same. And I don&#8217;t buy hypnotic suggestions such as &#8216;Satanism&#8217; and implied calls for crusades. You call for fanaticism. What do you have against then fanaticism of Scientology, then? </p> <p>This stoning and online court case calls for punishment. And I&#8217;m not interested in it. I would interested to discuss stuff like how to make things better. If you think that the deeds of some should deny the right of Scientologists to not have their pride and freedom to think and practice what they want, you are no better than what you supposedly fight against. You are indeed very arrogant and fanatic to think that you know &#8216;the right thing&#8217;, which would be a &#8216;right belief&#8217;.</p> <p>I don&#8217;t want Scientology either. So what? Is it my call? Should I lie and scare people about it so as to make it disappear? Should I seek for people to get punished? If I did that for each and every group I deem destructive, I would be doing nothing else. I rest my case.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329522"> 		<div id="comment-329522"> 		<div I think where he used the word &#8220;you&#8221; he meant the general you.</p> <p>&#8220;used to refer to any person or to people in general&#8221;<br /> Example: It grows on you.<br /> <a href="http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/you" rel="nofollow">http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/you</a></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329575"> 		<div id="comment-329575"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329575"> 				February 5, 2015 at 9:41 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329575#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329575", "329575", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Your frequent efforts to translate conversations to me suggest you think I am have problems duplicating. And a wrong item.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329578"> 		<div id="comment-329578"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329578"> 				February 5, 2015 at 9:48 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329578#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329578", "329578", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>In particular,the insinuation that you &#8220;get it&#8221; when I can not.</p> <p>I get it. I know how it goes.</p> <p>Generally speaking, I don&#8217;t quite get how the things you wrote about me connect to what I said before, nor before that.</p> <p>I have been reading anti-SCN stuff since before I got involved with SCN itself, and even after that, and I don&#8217;t see how much of that is related to SCN, either. </p> <p>I think freedom is not a nice excuse to smear-talk others in public and cause outrage against them. It would be something to take some freaking LRH text and analyse it, and another things to compare SCN with satanism and jihad and other stuff. One might bring about understanding, the other create impressions. Do you know the difference? The difference is similar to having a chat with somebody or having that somebody im-press his boot on your face, so you will get impressed.</p> <p>Most of the time I let people be hostile or whatever they are, whether I like it or not. Because I am a &#8216;Satanist&#8217; and agree with Crowley who said to do what you will and let others do the same too. But hey, today I reached a point I couldn&#8217;t even connect to the conversation at all, without being a liar. I had to tell passionate critics what I think about what they were writting. Do you think that&#8217;s part of my freedom, or are you gonna trace and beat me?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329573"> 		<div id="comment-329573"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329573"> 				February 5, 2015 at 9:40 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329573#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329573", "329573", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>&#8221; today I reached a point I couldn’t even connect to the conversation at all, without being a liar.&#8221;</p> <p>O.K., but you did connect to the conversation. It is extreme focus on I&#8230; I&#8230; I&#8230;  &#8220;I&#8221; this&#8230; &#8220;I&#8221; that&#8230; </p> <p>People are sort of interiorized into &#8220;I&#8221;, but Scientology has made a business out of it by creating the concept of &#8220;thetan,&#8221; glorifying it, and turning it into an ideal scene.</p> <p><b>If there is an implant in Scientology, it is sticking people into the concept of a thetan.</b></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329609"> 		<div id="comment-329609"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/df446e55d540b29e3179a8b84bcee235?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Letting go</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329609"> 				February 6, 2015 at 6:03 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329609#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329609", "329609", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Letting go'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>How else are you going to convey how the world looks from your vantage point than by using the word &#8220;I&#8221;? I understand that the very fact of a vantage point infers interiorisation, but then we all are observing and communicating from our perspective and understanding. Even you started out with &#8220;I see&#8221; as a reference. So what would non-localised communication of views look like in a localised setting? <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-tongue' title=':P'>:P</span></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329661"> 		<div id="comment-329661"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329661"> 				February 6, 2015 at 4:10 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329661#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329661", "329661", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Using &#8220;I&#8221; as a reference point does not necessarily mean an interiorization into &#8220;I&#8221;. It is like having a body and simply using it, without attention fixed on it. The body is simply there and doing what it does.</p> <p>When there is interiorization, there is fixed attention. The more fixed the attention is, the more interiorized one is.</p> <p>Interiorization into &#8220;I&#8221; is having attention fixed on &#8220;I&#8221;.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329699"> 		<div id="comment-329699"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/df446e55d540b29e3179a8b84bcee235?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">DollarMorgue</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329699"> 				February 7, 2015 at 5:31 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329699#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329699", "329699", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to DollarMorgue'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>That makes sense.
