This was Letting go posting under the alias I use on Mike&#8217;s blog. The question stands. What would a conversation look like where attention is not fixed on &#8220;I&#8221;?</p> <p>&#8220;I&#8221; am extremely curious <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-smile' title=':)'>:)</span></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329752"> 		<div id="comment-329752"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329752"> 				February 7, 2015 at 5:55 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329752#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329752", "329752", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>In that conversation there will be neither blaming nor admiring of any terminal. It would be simply be spotting things and the relationships among them for what they are.<br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329814"> 		<div id="comment-329814"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/df446e55d540b29e3179a8b84bcee235?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Letting go</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329814"> 				February 8, 2015 at 6:09 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>It seems that one of the basic motions of the basic building blocks (the cell, and below that negatively or positively charged proteins) is toward desirable and away from undesirable (my reference is Bruce Lipton&#8217;s Biology of Belief). If we are as such composite beings made from a cell colony and its responses to the environment (toward/away from) as well as processes (thoughts, emotions, sensations) that give rise to the apparency of an &#8220;I&#8221;, then how does attention arise and from what? And how is this attention supposed to &#8220;unstick&#8221; itself from the playing field of &#8220;toward/away from&#8221;?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329815"> 		<div id="comment-329815"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/df446e55d540b29e3179a8b84bcee235?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Letting go</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329815"> 				February 8, 2015 at 6:14 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Specifically, if the playing field, or parameters of toward/away from (same/not same?), give rise to attention, how can it possibly transcend the boundaries or reality it arises from?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329843"> 		<div id="comment-329843"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329843"> 				February 8, 2015 at 1:08 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Attention is &#8220;awareness with a direction.&#8221; Awareness is an aspect of motion. Motion is the inherent condition of this universe. Spectrum of motion forms the basis of Hubbard&#8217;s Theta-MEST theory.</p> <p>So, awareness is simply there as an inherent condition of this universe. Awareness in its specific characteristic may be called attention.</p> <p>So awareness is part of is-ness. It does not arise from anything though it may appear to do so. Like motion it is assuming different characteristics all the time and changing. This forms the changing attention.</p> <p>Just as motion may evolve by gaining frequency and mass, similarly attention may evolve by gaining fixedness and ego.</p> <p>Awareness (attention) and physical motion go hand in hand. They are not independent of each other.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329849"> 		<div id="comment-329849"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329849"> 				February 8, 2015 at 2:18 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Attention gains fixedness by gaining a structure. The only way to control that fixedness would be understanding that structure.</p> <p>It is not a matter of &#8220;sticking&#8221; or &#8220;unsticking&#8221; attention. It is a matter of understanding how a structure of attention comes about.</p> <p>Structure of attention shall be accompanied by structure of motion.  In macromolecules, like DNA, there are enough mobile electrons in the outer shells that can provide different arrangements, and each arrangement shall specify a certain value structure.</p> <p>With this understanding, attention at the level of macromolecules may be controlled.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329861"> 		<div id="comment-329861"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329861"> 				February 8, 2015 at 3:16 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p><i>Letting Go said, &#8220;Specifically, if the playing field, or parameters of toward/away from (same/not same?), give rise to attention, how can it possibly transcend the boundaries or reality it arises from?&#8221;</i></p> <p>That is a good question. Attention, as we find it, is narrow and broken and dispersed among a large number of egos. Recovery of attention depends on it becomeing whole and occupying the boundaries of reality completely. It is very far from that.</p> <p>I don&#8217;t know who came up with the stupid idea of &#8220;&#8221;transcending the boundaries or reality it arises from&#8221;?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329920"> 		<div id="comment-329920"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/df446e55d540b29e3179a8b84bcee235?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Letting go</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329920"> 				February 9, 2015 at 2:26 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p><i>vinaire said: Attention is “awareness with a direction.” Awareness is an aspect of motion. Motion is the inherent condition of this universe.</i></p> <p>So if an airplane is travelling from A to B, it is both moving and aware? Am I correct in assuming that awareness does not equal cognition?</p> <p>My desk is in motion at the atomic and sub-atomic level. Is it aware?</p> <p>Do thoughts, sensations and responses or whatever ultimately make up the concept of &#8220;I&#8221; have direction? If attention is awareness with a direction and thus by nature in motion, how can it be fixed?</p> <p><i>vinaire said: With this understanding, attention at the level of macromolecules may be controlled.</i></p> <p>Can you do so?</p> <p><i>vinaire said: I don’t know who came up with the stupid idea of “”transcending the boundaries or reality it arises from”?</i></p> <p>I wrote &#8220;transcend boundaries&#8221; because transcendence implies just that, moving beyond limits. Is the idea of transcendence false in your view?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-spyrosillusionist even depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329623"> 		<div id="comment-329623"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1e3a3898eb06ac9bec55d9581e9d1dd4?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://spyrosillusionist.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Spyros</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329623"> 				February 6, 2015 at 9:30 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329623#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329623", "329623", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Spyros'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Yes, Vinaire. It is the interiorization that makes them appear as cause points.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-spyrosillusionist even depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329627"> 		<div id="comment-329627"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1e3a3898eb06ac9bec55d9581e9d1dd4?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://spyrosillusionist.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Spyros</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329627"> 				February 6, 2015 at 11:06 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329627#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329627", "329627", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Spyros'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>And no Vinaire and others, I&#8217;m not trying to reduce your freedom of speech, merely because I disagree with you. I promise I&#8217;m not going to send anybody any ghost busters, nor dig his long past O/Ws, nor invent any, nor otherwise hold him accountable.</p> <p>There has been talk about Buddhism in here, about letting go of the past, the ego and so on. I think of this as a peaceful state. I think pointing out who is right and wrong is not a peaceful state. It can be done, of course. I just don&#8217;t think it is the state you describe. I have a very high idea of high states. And the universe that you have been talking about, Vinaire, includes me, Hubbard, you and everything else. If you deny some part of it, you deny the universe. If you oppose some part of it, you oppose the universe, no? Deny it and fight it if you will, but if you think you are the universe, and not some ego, then maybe you deny and fight yourself? </p> <p>I also had high expectations of OTs &#8212; higher than to have them &#8216;put ethics&#8217; (hold me accountable) on me, because they are RIGHT. And yeah maybe I have done that too a little bit, I just don&#8217;t have any illusions that is &#8216;OT&#8217;. And I aim higher than that. </p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329667"> 		<div id="comment-329667"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329667"> 				February 6, 2015 at 4:27 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329667#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329667", "329667", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Spyros, as long as you think that you are being cause, or, if you are being effect, you are simply being deluded. </p> <p><b>Looking at &#8220;I&#8221; as a cause  or effect is certainly an interiorization into &#8220;I&#8221;.</b></p> <p>Treat &#8220;I&#8221; like anything else that is around. It is simply a part of is-ness.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-spyrosillusionist even depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329556"> 		<div id="comment-329556"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1e3a3898eb06ac9bec55d9581e9d1dd4?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://spyrosillusionist.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Spyros</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329556"> 				February 5, 2015 at 7:45 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329556#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329556", "329556", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Spyros'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I was very young when I got involved with SCN and somehow my schools principal learned about it. So, he approached me and with an intimidative look told me &#8216;I know what that thing is about&#8230;you will not proselytize anyone in here.&#8217; I never intended to &#8216;proselytize&#8217; anybody, but it was something between tragic and funny to be told that by him in specific, as in school, I was being proselytised since 5 years old. I was forced to say my prayers, and learn and write good exams or else&#8230;(bad things would happen to me). So, from that alone, Christianity 1 Scientology 0. </p> <p>My point is regardless of outrageous or not beliefs, people should be free to believe&#8230;or not. I shouldn&#8217;t be afraid to become a Wiccan nor a Thelemite, if in the future I decide to do so &#8211;so that others wont boo-boo at me. I don&#8217;t give anybody the right to impose nor hinder any beliefs upon me. </p> <p>I&#8217;m glad some nasty practices get known so that people wont fall victims to them. I&#8217;m not glad to create dicrimination. I could have some #$#% to talk about some beliefs too, you know. Generally, I find it funny to hear by christians how &#8216;crazy&#8217; SCN is. Because a psychiatrist would be glad to hear from them how nice it is to chat with an old man in the heavens before they go to sleep every night.</p> <p>This is not personal about Marty. You misunderstood. But if I understood that Marty became like that then OK, I would let you all be. I just can&#8217;t fake it, and shit PR and pretend this would be OK with me. This time I reffered to other people.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329559"> 		<div </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329705"> 		<div id="comment-329705"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329705"> 				February 7, 2015 at 7:28 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329705#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329705", "329705", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Mindfulness is seeing things as they are. The filter of &#8220;I&#8221; is minimized or simply not there. The awareness belongs to the phenomenon itself.</p> <p>It is like the thinking being present in the thought. There is no one standing behind the thought thinking it.</p> <p>One may say that mindfulness results in the as-isness of the interiorization into &#8220;I&#8221;.</p> <p><a href="http://vinaire.me/2012/07/04/mindfulness/" rel="nofollow"><b>Mindfulness</b></a><br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-8 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329780"> 		<div id="comment-329780"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329780"> 				February 7, 2015 at 9:31 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329780#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329780", "329780", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Vinnie, it seems to me that you are using &#8220;I&#8221; with the meaning of &#8220;ego&#8221;. That&#8217;s not the way people use it in the context of a soul/thetan (which is the &#8220;I&#8221;). </p> <p>I don&#8217;t think anybody is disagreeing with the idea of &#8220;ego&#8221; being a filter &#8211; but not so of &#8220;I&#8221;. The &#8220;I&#8221; is what does the filtering, when filtering is being done.</p> <p>Are you using &#8220;I&#8221; and &#8220;ego&#8221; to mean the same thing?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329818"> 		<div id="comment-329818"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329818"> 				February 8, 2015 at 7:20 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329818#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329818", "329818", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I am using &#8220;I&#8221; as the &#8220;center of ego&#8221;. Just like there is mass and a &#8220;center of mass&#8221;, similarly, there is ego and a &#8220;center of ego.&#8221;</p> <p>Mass represents physical inertia, a state of physical motion trying to maintain its status quo. It resists any change to status quo.</p> <p>Similarly, Ego represents mental inertia,  a state of mental motion trying to maintain its status quo. It resists any change to status quo.</p> <p>Please see <a href="http://vinaire.me/2015/01/28/inertia-space-and-location/" rel="nofollow"><b>Inertia, Space and Location</b></a><br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329707"> 		<div id="comment-329707"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/b4e1c4cfb3baf5d0110c888632ec3b75?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Joe Pendleton</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329707"> 				February 7, 2015 at 8:02 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329707#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329707", "329707", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Joe Pendleton'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Marildi, I&#8217;m one being who LOVES the &#8220;I&#8221;. Yeah, confusion, duplication, understanding, realization, judgment.  I love it, REALLY great and highly applicable LRH lecture.  UNFORTUNATELY, my observation of people in the CoS is that they almost NEVER came out of duplication (which seemed to be the main challenge for them).  Of course, ACTUALLY spending the time to truly understand and work through to realization would &#8220;slow&#8221; one down in the eyes of the robotic supes and product officers, so folks very rarely got there.  The best auditors and CSs did.   Judgement?   Ha ha ha ha &#8230; PLEASE!  Using your judgement and not just &#8220;following orders&#8221; and complying in the church of scientology?  You&#8217;re kidding, right?  That&#8217;s what Ron wrought by insisting on obedience to &#8220;source&#8221; and the datum that YOU always had it wrong if you questioned his authority. &#8220;body&#8221;. The big problem is interiorization into &#8220;I&#8221;.</p> <p>I find the scientologists glorifying the inteririorization into &#8220;I&#8221;. They do this by focusing on a &#8220;terminal&#8221;, whether that terminal is individual or even God.</p> <p>They look at God as an individual. </p> <p>Focus on &#8220;individuality as cause&#8221; hides the underlying processes. href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329579#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329579", "329579", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Scientology creates ineriorization into &#8220;I&#8221;, and people don&#8217;t even know it.</p> <p><a href="http://vinaire.me/2015/01/08/interiorization-exteriorization/" rel="nofollow"><b>Interiorization &amp; Exteriorization</b></a><br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-spyrosillusionist odd alt depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329566"> 		<div id="comment-329566"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1e3a3898eb06ac9bec55d9581e9d1dd4?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://spyrosillusionist.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Spyros</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329566"> 				February 5, 2015 at 8:39 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329566#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329566", "329566", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Spyros'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>You know I think the liability of being somewhat free is you can get at odds with various groups people &#8211;much like Marty. You can get some rot about me by asking inside the COS, inside the FZ and elsewhere. I could be outside and still be friends with them all, but I am allergic to domination and it makes me become rude. I do it on purpose! I think it makes life a bitty more spicy. Still I don&#8217;t hold grunges against them in a way to seek revenge. If I think somebody boils, I let him boil, you know. Too bad for them. I&#8217;m not very mean &#8211;only temporarily, sometimes. </p> <p>I could come here and be nice with everybody, but I chose to be a little rude. I don&#8217;t know why I do it. I thought being nice while everybody else is rude is a bit too peaceful. Blame my fileclerk, for making me think so. </p> <p>I&#8217;m not with anybody. I&#8217;m with honest people, and I want freedom for all. A kind of freedom that wont be used to reduce the freedom of others. </p> <p>And I don&#8217;t think &#8216;do what you will&#8217; cancels ethics, because I think will (what thelemites call &#8216;true will&#8217;) and ethics go together. And people don&#8217;t need another to point that out to them. I don&#8217;t believe in imposing ethics.</p> <p>And I don&#8217;t feel at all victimised by that bashing at SCN. One because i&#8217;m not a SCNists. Two because I partially agree &#8211;but only partially. I just talk to talk. </p> <p>Hey, truth be told folks, I think SCN is some crazed sci fi thing, and magic like you said, and unrealistic, and I have no prob with that, to be honest. I have prob with some suppression involved with it. I think all religions and spiritualities have the &#8216;crazy&#8217; factor involved more or less. And I&#8217;m cool with it, because I don&#8217;t believe in psychiatry.</p> <p>I too think that to be cool with dumping your body is cool, in SCN. But it doesn&#8217;t mean suicide to me. Suicide is more like quiting, where dumping would be more like not feeling bad about it, because the body is their possession and not them, as spirits. I wouldn&#8217;t use that to justify coaxing another to die, though. Nor would I want a beloved person to me to die, nor others.  I&#8217;m sorry if it&#8217;s been used like that. And you have to admit SCNists usually look younger than the average &#8211;it must be because of the contracts with the devil.</p> <p>Anyway, I wish you all well. I&#8217;m not too serious about what I said. I just talked to talk.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329615"> 		<div id="comment-329615"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329615"> 				February 6, 2015 at 7:50 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329615#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329615", "329615", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>When a person is interiorized into &#8220;I&#8221; he may think he is free, but he is getting more and more confined into &#8220;I&#8221;.</p> <p>He is all the time using his &#8220;I&#8221; as the reference point to judge everything around him.</p> <p>He is just going around in circles. It is a form of insanity.</p> <p>This is what Scientology reduces one to. It is very unfortunate.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-spyrosillusionist odd alt depth-5 highlander-comment" is quite a phenomenon to watch.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329629"> 		<div id="comment-329629"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329629"> 				February 6, 2015 at 11:28 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329629#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329629", "329629", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Well, thanks for opening up in that way. You have found a place within this conversation where you belong.  My viewpoint is that if Marty writes something new, or you read something anywhere on the Internet that is a conversation going on, if you FEEL, FEEL something, you belong somewhere in that conversation.  Because the WORDS have conjured something up in you that wants or needs to be heard. </p> <p>So, if you read something, and the thoughts and words begin to flow, it concerns you in some way.</p> <p>On the Internet forums there are no obligations to anyone so I don&#8217;t think there is a lot of PR going on. </p> <p>I can see it is very disturbing to some people when they feel they have been privy to a secret society, that has been groomed in close conspiracies, when the curtain is drawn back and suddenly, the world can be included.  From the beginning I felt that Marty&#8217;s actions were bringing the Scientology down on to the streets.  David Miscavige has been burying it tombs.  The only way for it to bloom and grow, whatever is to be used, is to put it out on the streets.</p> <p>There is a condescending view amongst the Scientology community that &#8220;street people&#8221; or &#8220;wogs&#8221; can&#8217;t handle the ideas.  That one must have some spiritual supremacy and entitlement for these ideas. And mainly, one must be paid up in taxes to Int Management and registered as a member to know.</p> <p>When Hubbard wrote most of his ideas down, birth control pills were considered taboo.  This is not the same society.</p> <p>Marty gets attacked over and over and over and it is always for the same reason. He is bringing it out onto the street and he is INCLUDING others.</p> <p>Someone, had to grow some courage and do SOMETHING.  Because under David Miscavige, burying it all in vaults and paying people like mad to keep their mouths shut and working madly to bury the TRUTH in the shadows, this Scientology subject was DYING.</p> <p>Hubbard made huge headway with the subject of psychometry that will matter greatly as time moved forward.</p> <p>Marty chooses not to devalue and underestimate his fellow man or run the &#8220;spiritual supremacy&#8221; ser fac on people.  I think it is a good thing and if people had more faith in their fellow man and less concern about the economics involved with their secret societies, exclusive groups, and spiritual supremacy, the world would be a better place.</p> <p>That people take some of their faith and place it in people outside of the Church, has been taboo for too long.  The Nation of Islam is flying with Dianetics.  Bring it on down to the streets. Have a little faith in the street people.</p> <p>That is what I see right about Marty.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329643"> 		<div id="comment-329643"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329643"> 				February 6, 2015 at 12:14 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329643#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329643", "329643", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>And I do not take the obsessive efforts of a few street people who work 24/7 to reduce Hubbard&#8217;s ideas and life, and all of the curious who explored Scientology or the supernatural, into a minus value, as an index of everybody down on the streets.</p> <p>I have never gone into agreement that I should feel or be ashamed of myself or others, for being curious.  I don&#8217;t owe anyone an apology. I do not view myself as gullible or stupid.</p> <p>These guys that put together this HBO documentary, they are bringing some information down onto the streets and including a lot of people in the know. About real events. I don&#8217;t see that as an overt. I see it as a blessing.</p> <p>The Earth provides so much knowledge about conditions. You push a seed underground, bury it.  Look what comes back. A plant or tree that can feed a family.  Suppression is over rated.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329913"> 		<div id="comment-329913"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/49ed3747454eb55c10f4beccdb4fd4f6?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comments' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Conan</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329913"> 				February 9, 2015 at 1:20 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329913#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329913", "329913", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Conan'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Oracle,</p> <p>&#8220;And I do not take the obsessive efforts of a few street people who work 24/7 to reduce Hubbard’s ideas and life, and all of the curious who explored Scientology or the supernatural, into a minus value, as an index of everybody down on the streets.&#8221;</p> <p>By the time &#8220;a few street people &#8221; and create list for me. What disturbs me about you, is that someday in the near future, a woman is going to pick up a baby and feel unconditional love towards it.  Not knowing that baby was once you.  Bring you to breast or bottle to feed you. Sacrifice much for herself, to provide for you. Not knowing that when you had the freedom to care about the people in front of you, simple strangers, you couldn&#8217;t even mange good manners and respect.</p> <p>That is our lot.  And if you think I owe you more than that, by becoming a target of verbal or any abuse, you have bigger issues than Scientology to be concerned about.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329644"> 		<div id="comment-329644"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329644"> 				February 6, 2015 at 12:24 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329644#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329644", "329644", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Exposing the way some people choose to use &#8220;religion&#8221; to harm attack and suppress others, that is helping people know how to know.</p> <p>I do not see David Miscavige in this arena much longer. What happened with the Sea Organization, this lesson will serve you well in the future. David&#8217;s life, as a result of his actions and decisions, this is a life lesson. Your eternity is not being threatened, you are only being schooled.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-spyrosillusionist odd alt depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329673"> 		<div id="comment-329673"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1e3a3898eb06ac9bec55d9581e9d1dd4?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://spyrosillusionist.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Spyros</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329673"> 				February 6, 2015 at 5:02 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329673#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329673", "329673", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Spyros'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I think  it is admirable for somebody -in order to do what he thinks is right-  doesn&#8217;t care to be &#8216;nice&#8217; to some or everyone to have their alliance. And I try to be like that too.</p> <p>I don&#8217;t know how much you know/remember from what I have written. I am even more out of agreement with people than Marty, but I&#8217;m not popular and I don&#8217;t matter to the FZ nor the COS nor the anti-SCN people. In this trio I take no part, but I acknowledge the existence of good people in all sides. Plus, the &#8216;bad&#8217; thing about me is I disagree with things said about SCN as theory, as I have a different understanding about it. I think it&#8217;s better than usually said. But regardless of that, I too have thought that the way I have witnessed SCN, it would better off gone. In present time, I don&#8217;t really know. I leave it to each one to decide for himself. I don&#8217;t think it is my call to decide what each person should do, I think so, because not all view SCN to be the same thing.</p> <p>I don&#8217;t believe in any spiritual supremacy, nor any imposed ethics from the ethical ones towards the unethical ones.  I also think we all are -in our core- at the end of any possible spiritual path. All we have to do is realize it. </p> <p>I like Hubbard&#8217;s texts, though I don&#8217;t and wont audit.  I wont fight for them, either. He doesn&#8217;t fight them either. I don&#8217;t attribute all that has happened in the name of Scientology to him, either. </p> <p>Well, in any case, no matter what happens to SCN, it will be what is decided by it&#8217;s people.  It is kept alive due to some good people. And good people can do good SCN or not. I&#8217;m cool whatever happens, because I don&#8217;t think it is the only possible way. But Scientologists and all others should have the right to believe and practice &#8211;without harming others. And the ill-intended guys&#8230;I wouldn&#8217;t fight them either, because fighting perpetuates conditions, it doesn&#8217;t resolve them. Love, truth, assistance solve much better. I could have a hard time, or temporarily get a little harsh but, I never fall in apathy about solutions.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329736"> 		<div id="comment-329736"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329736"> 				February 7, 2015 at 2:38 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329736#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329736", "329736", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I do remember much of what you have written. I have always been appreciative of your thoughts.  I like the &#8220;middle road&#8221; and it&#8217;s calm winds myself.  On the middle road, it is only important for me personally not to run can&#8217;t haves or must have&#8217;s on others. Because these are things I do not tolerate very well when run on me. Mostly, I do  not want to run &#8220;can&#8217;t have ideas&#8221; on others. Unless those ideas lead to harming others.</p> <p>In a perfect world for me, Scientology would just be a bookstore outlet. Where people could go to buy the books or course packs.  Co audit in small groups and have meet ups in people&#8217;s living rooms. It would just be about that, people having interesting conversations with one another.</p> <p>I don&#8217;t like the ethics and justice system because it presumes people do not have an ethics system of their own. Or the one they have is not workable. I had my own code of ethics when I came in and it worked for me. I wasn&#8217;t interested in switching over. I haven&#8217;t met many people on this earth that don&#8217;t have a code of ethics. Maybe I never met anyone that didn&#8217;t have a code of ethics, even if it was unique.  These things have to be arranged by a person them self. </p> <p>I didn&#8217;t make many friends in Scientology because I knew those friendships were very fragile and highly conditional. At the end of the day what was the value for me? The conversations I had with the auditors.  Those were very magical.</p> <p>I still see the entire essence of the experience as exploring magic. But I have never met anyone involved that sees it like that.  I never had a group or friends to loose in reality.  I was encouraged to have enemies I did not want. I declined. Got labeled &#8220;reasonable&#8221;. I took it as a compliment.  Nobody wanted to burden me with any real responsibility because I was a &#8220;defective&#8221; thetan. I love to reason.  It&#8217;s a habit.</p> <p>I try to smooth out some of the conflict with a &#8220;spoon full of sugar&#8221; from time to time.  That annoys some of the soldiers.</p> <p>Handling danger situations is not beneath me though. And one only needs to watch the videos and read the testimony, and sometimes, just be at my house, to see that David Miscavige and his Central Intelligence Agency makes themselves a danger situation people are forced to deal with.  If they stopped being a danger in this society, they wouldn&#8217;t have any problems being &#8220;supreme beings&#8221;.</p> <p>I think it can be sorted out with out blood shed.  Marty has been brilliant at handling these forces and conditions. He had a duty to himself and his family to handle the danger situations the Church has become to him. And so do I.  I can support this from a distance because I do not possess the calm needed to stand in the middle of the storm. Like, the guy that was doing those depositions? I would have jumped across the table and started choking him.  I know my weakness&#8217;.   That is why I stay on the middle road.  And on the far left and far right, I see people consumed by their weakness.  And it&#8217;s scary.</p> <p><span class='embed-youtube' style='text-align:center; display: block;'><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='500' height='312' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/vLkp_Dx6VdI?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' frameborder='0' allowfullscreen='true'></iframe></span></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329741"> 		<div id="comment-329741"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329741"> 				February 7, 2015 at 3:06 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329741#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329741", "329741", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>By the way, I know annoys some people that I don&#8217;t have any regrets. But I&#8217;d rather be sorry for something I&#8217;ve done, than for something that I didn&#8217;t do.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-8 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329755"> 		<div id="comment-329755"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329755"> 				February 7, 2015 at 6:06 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329755#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329755", "329755", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>&#8220;I&#8221; ??? What is it?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329778"> 		<div id="comment-329778"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329778"> 				February 7, 2015 at 9:23 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329778#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329778", "329778", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>In this case speaking for myself. Making it clear that these are my views only, and that I can not comment for everyone else about these things.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329819"> 		<div id="comment-329819"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329819"> 				February 8, 2015 at 7:27 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thanks. I see &#8220;I&#8221; as a &#8220;center of ego&#8221;, where ego represents mental inertia that is trying to maintain its status quo.</p> <p>&#8220;I&#8221; is best used as a reference point. But it is possible to get interiorized into &#8220;I&#8221;. Here inetriorization takes place as increasingly fixed attention.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329824"> 		<div id="comment-329824"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329824"> 				February 8, 2015 at 8:44 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>If there is a desire to clarify that these are &#8220;my views&#8221; then one is probably anticipating challenge to those views. </p> <p>One is probably not ready to handle such a challenge, so one is putting up the shield of &#8220;my views.&#8221;<br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-spyrosillusionist even depth-7 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329760"> 		<div id="comment-329760"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1e3a3898eb06ac9bec55d9581e9d1dd4?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://spyrosillusionist.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Spyros</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329760"> 				February 7, 2015 at 6:50 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329760#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329760", "329760", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Spyros'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thanks, really.</p> <p>Middle road could mean from peace with all, to war with all, or even nothing with all. It depends on how you deal with it each time. I have swung from side to side, from time to time, but it doesn&#8217;t feel good to me to act against any part of life. So, I don&#8217;t have it last for long. I understand and agree with the concept of not submitting to suppression, but at some point, if the suppression was 20 years ago, that game should end. If a condition exists in present time, it is different. I&#8217;m not always calm if I have some hostility occurring in PT and I don&#8217;t like to turn cheeks, either.</p> <p>You said &#8220;Mostly, I do not want to run &#8220;can&#8217;t have ideas&#8221; on others. Unless those ideas lead to harming others.&#8221; That was my argument, exactly. A can&#8217;t have, can&#8217;t do, be Scientology, is a can&#8217;t too. People should be free to choose. I&#8217;ve heard (mostly through that documentary) how harsh the German government has been on Scientologists, and that shouldn&#8217;t occur. Here the government hasn&#8217;t interfered as much, but the press has made it so one would feel ashamed to say that he is a Scientologist. If we started to count crimes and sins, very few to no groups should any longer exist.</p> <p>The worst thing about ethics in SCN and in general, is when you have an unethical person &#8216;put ethics&#8217; on you. That drove me to self-invalidation. And I&#8217;ve noticed it is usually unethical people that get obsessed with forcing ethics upon others.</p> <p>What you said about Scientology fragile friendships had been a big heartbreak for me. To have a whole bunch of people think ill of you, or even disconnect, because some %#$%%## told them so&#8230;not nice. I think it is the major reason why Scientology gets pounded so hard by former members. Some could realize that, and save themselves. Alas, no sense of self criticism. </p> <p>So, you have trouble with DM? You must be kinda like a vip. Fortunately, I&#8217;m not. It takes some nerve to be under pressure, and not hate the subject as a whole.</p> <p>For me, magic is included in SCN theory in the sense of making things happen by non physical means &#8211;but directly, as spirit. There is no mysticism that I know. One would wonder, &#8216;If you can make things happen, as spirit, how come you run onto such trouble? What sort of power is this?&#8217;. I laugh at this contradiction. Well, it is up to anyone to discover, whether power exists or whether we bring trouble upon ourselves through our own power, as said in SCN. I for sure don&#8217;t think of power, as a way to cause harm, for starters. I think mean people are also weak, that&#8217;s why they try so hard to convince others of their power. The domination of evil exists only as a delusion. Sadly, commonly shared delusions can be called reality.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-8 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329785"> 		<div id="comment-329785"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329785"> 				February 7, 2015 at 10:11 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329785#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329785", "329785", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Wow!  This blew so much anger for me!</p> <p>&#8220;The worst thing about ethics in SCN and in general, is when you have an unethical person ‘put ethics’ on you. That drove me to self-invalidation. And I’ve noticed it is usually unethical people that get obsessed with forcing ethics upon others.&#8221;</p> <p>The thing is,making the best choices.  That is how it&#8217;s described anyway.<br /> It used to come up on sec checks. O.K. like I stole money for food frequently growing up. Only until I knew I could panhandle (beg on the street).  It wasn&#8217;t a lot that I stole. Change out of the bottom of people&#8217;s pocket books,only to buy something very small. One time I got real criminal and greedy and took paper money and splurged,went to a Chinese restaurant like a big shot. That was the only time I got caught and,the only time someone noticed some money was missing!!!  That is how little and infrequently I did this. So, this comes up in auditing.  And the up shot is that,you know, I&#8217;m a criminal on some level. &#8220;Financial irregs&#8221; on my history.</p> <p>Well, what choices did I have then?  I was a very smart kid,skipped two grades ahead in school, I knew a lot about making the best choices.  It was the best choice.  The other choice was to starve, and I was so thin and ate so infrequently that that was a real possibility. Is stealing always an overt or an indication of criminal intention? No.  What kind of choice is it to starve?  I would have worked gladly.  And finally did get a job when I was 12, cleaning out pet store cages and selling out dated newspapers. I didn&#8217;t want to steal or beg.</p> <p>And the thing I have about these sec checks and the ethics, is that nobody ever asks how what you did was the best choice.  They never look for rightness. They never even ask. THEY ADD IT UP FOR YOU. They decide you didn&#8217;t make the best choice,and never ask what the choices were.  Don&#8217;t you think common sense would prevail?  They do the math and they don&#8217;t know the equations!</p> <p>Once I was late for a session at an org. Got sent to ethics. Told if I was later again I would be put in liability. I was the only P.C. that Org had at that time. How the hell could I be a liability even if I was late every night? What about the fact that I was showing up at all and trying to improve? I got mad and walked out the front door. The entire staff came running after me,my auditor finally catching up to me and convincing me to come back. Last time I ever got sent to ethics. I said it. I made them admit I was not a liability. Not even close.</p> <p>I knew about the fragile friendships before I ever took a course. Because my mother who I was visiting, kicked me out on the streets when I was 14 because I said something negative about Scientology.  I didn&#8217;tknow what she was up to,asked a neighbor. He said Scientology was a crutch and I relayed the message.  So, I never trusted a Scientologist.  Except the auditors.  But you have to have a line in the sand there too. It has to be a two way conversation. I haven&#8217;t been afraid to stop a process. I haven&#8217;t been afraid to end the conversation on my terms and when I want to.  I didn&#8217;t like the one way rights. The auditor ends the session and all that. I cut a few auditors off,O.K.more than a few.  Not forever or in a bad way, just, &#8220;This session is over if this is the way it&#8217;s going to be.&#8221;  And they ended to tell the C/S.</p> <p>I really did like the other people that were involved in Scientology for the most part.  But I knew they were Hubbard&#8217;s friends,not mine.  It&#8217;s like going to a party. You don&#8217;t ask the guests to come over to your house to continue the party.  I wasn&#8217;t eager to bring any of my friends into Scientology, because I knew that an unconditional friendship could turn into a conditional one by them becoming one. My friends never bothered me about my involvement, I didn&#8217;t burden them with it either or try to push it on them. I may have gotten a little teased in good natured ways. </p> <p>All in all, it was pretty interesting. It still is when I am getting auditing out here.  Friendships in the independent movement have been very solid.</p> <p>I think it attracts some very interesting people. I love the conversations on the table.  Even if I do not originate them. If I originated them, I would really be considered weird.</p> <p>Sorry about the eval on your file clerk. I was just kidding you. I made my file clerk do the anti Q and A Drills.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-9 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329788"> 		<div href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329788"> 				February 7, 2015 at 10:25 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1e3a3898eb06ac9bec55d9581e9d1dd4?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://spyrosillusionist.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Spyros</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329798"> 				February 8, 2015 at 12:32 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329798#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329798", "329798", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Spyros'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hehe I didn&#8217;t mind the file clerk thing. I just didn&#8217;t get the joke, and I don&#8217;t think I have any file clerk.</p> <p>&#8220;How the hell could I be a liability even if I was late every night? &#8221; Do you mean you were late to go home at night and thus you were assigned a liability condition? That&#8217;s too lol for words.</p> <p>My view of ethics is that -like you said- it is inherent to beings. And a being is aware of ethics the more it is aware of itself as it&#8217;s original being, and doesn&#8217;t identify with other things and thus doesn&#8217;t get brainwashed either (one brings another). Thus actual self determinism is ethical.  Thus a self determined being doesn&#8217;t harm &#8211;at least not more than it assists life. It goes along with what I said before about power. And the more self determined a being is, the more it allows self determinism in others, too. So yeah, be free and let be free.</p> <p>On the contrary, people on a constant overt mode, with no sense of self criticism, see in others what they themselves do, and seek to stop others instead of themselves. For them freedom means chaos, destruction, for that&#8217;s what they would do if they were free. And they cannot allow that.</p> <p>For me the handling is to let them be too, like the rest. Just don&#8217;t play their game.</p> <p>I have met nice people everywhere. I don&#8217;t think there is any rule that the good ones go here and the bad ones go there.  </p> <p>I have long decided to not be involved with SCN because I think something is amiss. Simply put, by studying SCN I got different ideas how it would be like, than it was.  it is good to get rid of some charge, of course. I just don&#8217;t think Hubbard set any goals like &#8216;to handle the 4th dynamic so we can then handle ourselves.&#8217; That&#8217;s blame, and quite opposite to what I&#8217;ve read. If you&#8217;re in trouble, you should handle your creating it, not others creating it, as per SCN. Trouble is not natural for a being, according to theory. Thus, I think all trouble can be handled, and fighting is not only unnecessary, but it is a form of trouble itself. </p> <p>I cannot speak on behalf of Hubbard, I only try to make logical sense out of what I&#8217;ve read in conjunction with my own experiences. He is very well responsible for my knowing I&#8217;m not just a body and I&#8217;m very grateful for that. And the outpoints I have noticed in SCN are due to his own theories, as well. From then on, i try to deal with my stuff by myself, the way I see best.<br />  <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-smile' title=':)'>:)</span></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329840"> 		<div id="comment-329840"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329840"> 				February 8, 2015 at 12:52 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I can&#8217;t speak on behalf of anybody.  I like it when people speak on my behalf.  The turning point for me was on the ethics thing you spoke of.  Because once I found myself &#8220;at the top&#8221; in the Sea Org, that is working out of the Flag Command Bureau under WDC, I found out I was surrounded by criminals.  Huge financial crimes. White collar crimes. Federal prison crimes. Taking millions in donations to help kid off of drugs and socking that money into Sea Org reserves.  Fraud, embezzlement. This is prison time.  And I was shamed for pilfering for food?  </p> <p>About the Scientology,  what else would I have been doing in the time I spent there?  More parties?  More shopping? More traveling?  More entertaining?  It was different. It was worth my time. All of my relationships have been.  I&#8217;m not out of arc with the life I have lived or who I have been.<br /> I don&#8217;t belong in those conversations. I don&#8217;t want others to be out of arc with the life they have lived, or who they have been. So I don&#8217;t belong in those activities.</p> <p>At the end of the day what do we have? Great conversations,like these. </p> <p>XXOO</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-spyrosillusionist odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329872"> 		<div id="comment-329872"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1e3a3898eb06ac9bec55d9581e9d1dd4?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://spyrosillusionist.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Spyros</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329872"> 				February 8, 2015 at 9:04 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Good good, I have no regrets or other sentiments either. A surprising conclusion, as I don&#8217;t recall seeing FZ mentioned here recently. As for the indies, some are creating their own space for their own conversations.
