windhorse'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I left &#8212; in a manner of speaking in 1993 &#8212; I decided around 2000 that I was actually no longer a scientologist; HOWEVER, I still *thought* like a scientologist &#8230; </p> <p>In 2000 I moved back to Clearwater from having lived for a couple of years near family &#8230;</p> <p>I worked for several scientology companies in Clearwater UNTIL I realized that FOREVER MORE I would be the WHY on ANY but ANY down stats since I was a &#8220;no longer allowed on the base&#8221; but NOT declared and opps a failed OT VIII.</p> <p>I swore I would NEVER EVER work for a scientologist again and I never have.  </p> <p>THAT said &#8212; I remained friends with several &#8220;still ins&#8221; &#8212; until I started to notice &#8212; good grief &#8212; these people are crazier than I EVER was because they haven&#8217;t a CLUE who they are.  They have ZIP integrity and will sell their mother to ensure their own &#8220;freedom&#8221; &#8212; and many of those people have tragic stories they NOW share about how BAD scientology is/was &#8230; but it took THEIR tragedy to WAKE THEM THE F**K UP.  Before I get piled on about the generalities &#8212; indeed &#8212; not EVERYONE is/was like this.  But IMHO the majority.  </p> <p>So be it.</p> <p>in 2009 I found Mark&#8217;s blog (Marty) &#8230; and on back channels we spoke.  Bit by bit I starting posting &#8230;</p> <p>BUT my point is UNLESS you are DAILY and I mean DAILY looking at your own thoughts and seeing &#8212; hmmm is THIS a TRUTH or a carry-over from the prison of belief &#8212; you are NOT WAKING THE F**K UP &#8212; you are just carrying over the absolutely incredible chains that this prison of Hubbard created.</p> <p>Mark has distilled this prison so well.  8 very simple things.</p> <p>It&#8217;s quite amazing I must say.</p> <p>Again &#8212; deep gratitude to Mark.</p> <p>Windhorse</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329676"> 		<div id="comment-329676"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/a1049d2528a46f6bd92dca4577fd768f?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.unicef.org/' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Cat Daddy</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329676"> 				February 6, 2015 at 5:33 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329676#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329676", "329676", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Cat Daddy'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>1. Planet Earth is a prison. The vast majority of human beings – and billions of invisible other beings – are its inmates.</p> <p>Who on earth does not feel this to be true at one time in his or her life.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329737"> 		<div id="comment-329737"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329737"> 				February 7, 2015 at 2:41 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329737#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329737", "329737", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>On this &#8220;Earth prison&#8221;thing. I figured if this was a prison, what does it say about the people that sent us here?  I&#8217;d rather be here with these people.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329708"> 		<div id="comment-329708"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329708"> 				February 7, 2015 at 8:11 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329708#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329708", "329708", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Blaming LRH, or blaming DM, or blaming Scientologists, or blaming wogs, or blaming anybody amounts to interiorization into &#8220;I&#8221;.</p> <p>It is better to look in a larger context if you really want to handle the situation,<br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329710"> 		<div id="comment-329710"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329710"> 				February 7, 2015 at 8:14 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329710#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329710", "329710", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>In Scientology, INTERIORIZATION refers to a condition that has to do with “going into and becoming part of the body too fixedly.” EXTERIORIZATION is defined as a state where the individual experiences being outside his body.</p> <p>The above definition assumes that individual and the body can be separated “physically” from each other. But the awareness of individuality is not something physical that can be pulled out of the body.</p> <p>The truth is that a person, whose attention is fixed on the body, and who has been operating as a body all his life, feels very liberated when that attention suddenly becomes unstuck. This comes to him as a big surprise. He literally feels being outside the body. He thinks that something very special has happened. He feels a deep “spiritual awakening,”</p> <p><strong>INTERIORIZATION is the condition of attention being too fixed on the body with the person unaware of it. When that attention suddenly becomes unstuck the person feels very liberated.</strong></p> <p>But the experience of being outside the body is just a feeling. The person does not know that he has been operating as a body all this time. The experience goes away just as suddenly as it had come because he does not have awareness of what really happened. But he remembers the brief experience and longs for it.</p> <p>Such “out-of-body” experiences are actually quite common, but they are random and uncontrolled. But after such experience the person&#8217;s attention may get fixed on getting exterior to the body.</p> <p><strong>When a person’s attention is too fixed on separating “self” from the body, then it is just another form of INTERIORIZATION.</strong></p> <p>Scientology convinces a person that he is basically an immortal “thetan” (self), that can operate exterior to the body naturally. The person is then offered expensive Scientology processing to attain the state of &#8220;operating thetan.&#8221; He is put on a long “bridge” that he must cross to achieve the goal of &#8220;operating thetan.&#8221;</p> <p>This may sound crazy. But a person, who already believes that there is a God who exists outside the universe, can easily be convinced to believe in a thetan that can exist outside the body.</p> <p>In truth, &#8220;self&#8221; is not something physical that can be separated from the body. What needs to be freed is the attention fixed on the body, which the person is not aware of.</p> <p>But Scientology directs the person toward the goal of &#8220;operating thetan,&#8221; and makes loads of money of him. The person ends up either hypnotized or feeling betrayed. No operating thetan has actually been observed throughout the existence of Scientology.</p> <p><strong>The simple truth lies in freeing the attention that is fixed on the body unbeknownst to the person.</strong></p> <p>But the attention can be fixed on the body, or on the liberation of self from the body, or on salvation, or on attaining nirvana. The actual problem is the state of the attention, which happens to be fixed.</p> <p>When the fixed attention actually becomes free, there is a feeling of liberation that continues to be there. With this, one attains the certainty that one is much more than some boxed in ideas and thinking patterns. This feeling is real and not the artificial feeling of an &#8220;operating thetan.&#8221;</p> <p><strong>When there is no fixed attention either on body or on self, one can then be as large as the reality one is witnessing at any time.</strong></p> <p>The simple method for freeing fixed attention is mindfulness. One can then view the whole universe for what it is.</p> <p>.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329772"> 		<div id="comment-329772"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/b4e1c4cfb3baf5d0110c888632ec3b75?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Joe Pendleton</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329772"> 				February 7, 2015 at 7:50 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329772#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329772", "329772", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Joe Pendleton'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Vinaire, after very, very careful consideration of what you are saying here &#8230; I have concluded that &#8230; (drum roll please &#8230; tension mounts as the multitudes await my conclusion &#8230; ready?)   &#8230;.    the spirit can and does in fact obviously exist COMPLETELY separate from the body or any physical entity.  The spirit is of a COMPLETELY different nature, it has no wavelength, etc etc etc.  It is not OF the physical universe, but exists and operates IN the good ol&#8217; fiz yune (accepted shorthand for physical universe, kind of like &#8220;beat talk&#8221; was for the beatniks back in the day, scio talk for us old timers).</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329821"> 		<div id="comment-329821"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329821"> 				February 8, 2015 at 7:39 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329821#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329821", "329821", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>A state of motion is defined by INERTIA. The main confusion seems to be between physical and mental aspects of MOTION. So, there is physical inertia as well as mental inertia.</p> <p><b>PHYSICAL INERTIA = FREQUENCY &amp; MASS<br /> MENTAL INERTIA = FIXEDNESS &amp; EGO</b></p> <p>Physical inertia is made up of the FREQUENCY of electromagnetic waves, and the MASS of material particles. On the spectrum of physical inertia, frequency appears in the lower half, and mass appears on the upper half.</p> <p>Mental inertia is made up of the FIXEDNESS of attention, and the EGO of individuality. On the spectrum of mental inertia, fixedness appears in the lower half, and ego appears on the upper half.</p> <p>Based on the concept of inertia we may define SPACE and LOCATION as follows.</p> <p><b>PHYSICAL SPACE = A STATE DEVOID OF PHYSICAL INERTIA<br /> MENTAL SPACE = A STATE DEVOID OF MENTAL INERTIA</b></p> <p>Space may be defined as the lower end on the spectrum of inertia. Thus, physical space would be an electromagnetic wave of zero frequency and infinite wavelength.</p> <p>Mental space would be a state of attention that is totally free.</p> <p><b>PHYSICAL LOCATION = THE CENTER OF MASS<br /> MENTAL LOCATION = THE CENTER OF EGO</b></p> <p>A location may be defined as the upper end on the spectrum of inertia. Thus, physical location would be an infinite mass that is centered at a point. We visualize geometrical point to be dimensionless but discrete. On this concept of point we base the whole subject of geometry. But geometry is only as useful as it is consistent with physical observations.</p> <p>Mental location would be an immense ego that is centered at a “point”. The “point” is visualized as the spiritual “I”. On this concept of “I” we base the whole subject of spirituality, where God is the ultimate “I”. But spirituality is only as useful as it is consistent with what is experienced.</p> <p>The concept of SPIRIT is derived from the mental aspect of motion, just like the concept of MATTER is derived from the physical aspect of motion. Both spiritual and material aspects are present at every point on the spectrum of motion or inertia.</p> <p>When we talk about SPIRIT, we are talking about mental aspects and not the physical aspect. So, SPIRIT has to do with mental space and time, whereas, MATTER has to do with physical space and time. We cannot talk about SPIRIT in terms of physical space and time as it has been done in many religions.</p> <p>.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment program&#8221; advices of Hubbard&#8217;s, there&#8217;s the one &#8220;running program&#8221; advice that says that in ancient space civilization times that &#8220;OTs&#8221; (pure souls that didn&#8217;t have bodies but which existed and did duty on advanced ancient space civilization planets, think of superhero Caspar the Ghosts dutifully helping out on humanoid inhabited planets sort of like a Caspar the Ghost/Greek Gods force of &#8220;OTs&#8221;) when the &#8220;OTs&#8221; needed therapy, they&#8217;d go circle large expanses of outer space, as their therapy.  That&#8217;s in otherwords the &#8220;OT running program.&#8221;   It&#8217;s what the Scientology promo now calls the &#8220;Cause Resurgence Rundown&#8221;  or &#8220;OT objective.&#8221;   (Objective in Scientologese means &#8220;Objective Process&#8221;, like the &#8220;CCHs&#8221; or &#8220;Book and Bottle&#8221; are &#8220;Objective Processes&#8221;, and thus the OT running program is an &#8220;objective&#8221; process for disembodied soul astronauts.)</p> <p>Supposedly, then, how this all fits together, is that today, if you really believe in what all Hubbard wrote, and put this all together, it means that once you are &#8220;up to&#8221; this topnotch spiritual horsepower level, that Hubbard considers he himself had reached at his death, that when you then leave your body and &#8220;die&#8221; you can go off to a distant star, like Hubbard told Sarge Steven Pfauth as is told in &#8220;Going Clear..&#8221; and &#8220;Memoirs of a Scientology Warrier&#8221;, and supposedly today a Scientologist who is OT 8 or thereabouts could like dead Hubbard go do the OT running program yourself, as a rejuvenating OT horsepower amping up therapy on yourself.</p> <p>This is truly NOT to be taken seriously, but if one is a full blown brainwashed Scientologist who got themselves deep all the way in the Hubbard fantasy crank crackpot therapy then this is what this would mean.</p> <p>It&#8217;s more than irresponsible, it&#8217;s truly why Hubbard is a crank crackpot, and his &#8220;work&#8221; on this spiritual stuff is truly not to be taken seriously.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329817"> 		<div id="comment-329817"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/6d9898a119241c960c0072f1e5f5c4d7?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Ftiend</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329817"> 				February 8, 2015 at 7:14 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329817#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329817", "329817", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Ftiend'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Running around a pole .. running around a star .. you can also run around your home if you want more power .. this run around something is good idea for one who is pretty well in disorder .. means you implant yourself a place for order .. and then create new order .. all athletic persons must then be in super power .. no, not really, because they do not handle disorder .. </p> <p>The LRH advice for running around something is the simpliest thing to do  for handle disorder .. best is to run run around a star. 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329964"> 				February 10, 2015 at 1:49 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329964#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329964", "329964", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>I don&#8217;t think the word &#8220;run&#8221; can be taken literally. How about &#8220;move&#8221;? Many people who report out-of-body-experiences talk about moving from one location to another, and even to another time.</p> <p>In this video about OOB experiences, at about 9:45 Graham Nicholls starts talking about both &#8211; moving to a different location as well as to a different time, as in precognition. (And the interviewer is none other than Lilou of the &#8220;Juicy Living Tour&#8221;. <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-smile' title=':)'>:)</span> )</p> <p><span class='embed-youtube' style='text-align:center; class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329770#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329770", "329770", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Joe Pendleton'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>The &#8220;I&#8221; exists as itself and always has as a discrete entity.  It does not &#8230; I repeat, it does NOT break up into tiny pieces of spirit after one&#8217;s death.  It goes on to another body or no body at all as it wishes.  The &#8220;I&#8221; is IN FACT all powerful as a source of creation.  It IS the fountainhead of postulated reality and one&#8217;s truth,, both in one&#8217;s universe and existing as a co-creator in the universe of others.  I have thus spoken.  I create or un-create my own truths.  I no longer need ONE source of truth that I must speak of as THE truth to other beings.  I do not need to justify my own truths by the ideas of The Buddha, L. Ron Hubbard, Ron Paul or Vince Lombardi (to use just some examples) though I can take from them what wisdom I CHOOSE to take (while facing the challenges of crossing the streets in Ho Chi Minh City in Vietnam, I very wisely applied Lombardi&#8217;s old Green Bay sweep play; I darted behind an old Vietnamese woman who was crossing, and I played Paul Hornung to her Jerry Kramer and yes &#8230; I got to the other side in one piece &#8230; nice to have a &#8220;blocker&#8221; when you needed one &#8230; applied wisdom, folks).</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329771"> 		<div id="comment-329771"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/b4e1c4cfb3baf5d0110c888632ec3b75?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Joe Pendleton</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329771"> 				February 7, 2015 at 7:38 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329771#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329771", "329771", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Joe Pendleton'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Note: I really shouldn&#8217;t have included Ron Paul with those other luminaries above. With others, it&#8217;s called &#8220;pimping the &#8216;I'&#8221;. <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-rolleyes' title=':roll:'>:roll:</span></p> <p>No sense of humor either! <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-tongue' title=':P'>:P</span></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329958"> 		<div id="comment-329958"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/b4e1c4cfb3baf5d0110c888632ec3b75?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Joe Pendleton</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329958"> 				February 9, 2015 at 9:32 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329958#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329958", "329958", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Joe Pendleton'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>In that case,  I&#8217;m back in business. Many decades ago Woody Allen wrote an essay called &#8220;The Whore of Mensa&#8221; wherein a man could pay a woman to discuss very deep philosophical issues with him (Plato,  etc). Presumably one could pay someone to also engage in raising awareness about one&#8217;s spiritual nature. Oh wait &#8230; that&#8217;s been done. Anyway I will hapilly attempt to raise your awareness for free. Just your thanks and cogs are enough exchange for me.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329851"> 		<div id="comment-329851"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/49ed3747454eb55c10f4beccdb4fd4f6?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comments' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Conan</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329851"> 				February 8, 2015 at 2:20 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329851#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329851", "329851", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Conan'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Marty. 	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329959"> 		<div id="comment-329959"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329959"> 				February 9, 2015 at 9:52 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329959#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329959", "329959", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>The Scientology impulse of eye for an eye trumps over any feeling of ARC. Their sense of ARC is totally fake. This is so very evident among Scientologists even on this board. They may be out of the Church, but they still have the same spots peculiar to that philosophy.</p> <p>There is no use talking about any feeling of compassion in them, because there is no such thing in Scientology.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329961"> 		<div id="comment-329961"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329961"> 				February 9, 2015 at 10:20 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329961#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329961", "329961", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>This is to clarify for LETTING GO, how I look at awareness.</p> <p>From Wikipedia:</p> <p><em>“Awareness is the state or ability to perceive, to feel, or to be conscious of events, objects, thoughts, emotions, or sensory patterns. In this level of consciousness, sense data can be confirmed by an observer without necessarily implying understanding. More broadly, it is the state or quality of being aware of something. In biological psychology, awareness is defined as a human&#8217;s or an animal&#8217;s perception and cognitive reaction to a condition or event…</em></p> <p><em>“Awareness is a relative concept. An animal may be partially aware, may be subconsciously aware, or may be acutely unaware of an event. Awareness may be focused on an internal state, such as a visceral feeling, or on external events by way of sensory perception. Awareness provides the raw material from which animals develop qualia, or subjective ideas about their experience.”</em></p> <p>.</p> <p>Here awareness is being described in terms of human subjectivity. This subjectivity seems to be taken for granted as awareness. It is being used as a “standard” to measure the awareness of other animals, organisms and objects . An objective definition of awareness seems to be missing.</p> <p>In order to define awareness scientifically, let’s do the following thought experiment. Imagine being out there in the interstellar space, but with no stars or heavenly bodies around to provide any reference points. Pay attention to your motion. You will find that there is no awareness of motion even when you could be moving at the speed of light. Awareness arises only when there is motion relative to something else.</p> <p>Light that contributes to awareness seems to be made up of pure motion. Objects that contribute to awareness seem to be full of motion at molecular and atomic levels. Awareness of sensations, such as push and pull, seems to accompany changes in motion.</p> <p>Science talks about structure like visual cortex or other parts of the brain to explain awareness. But the brain too is made up of atoms and molecules, neurons and electrical impulses. All these things consist of motion. So there is motion outside the brain as well as inside the brain. Science is simply associating the motion inside the brain with awareness.</p> <p>It seems that awareness simply cannot be separated from motion. Any change that gives rise to awareness is fundamentally motion. Even the change in color amounts to the change in wavelength of light, and is thus a very fine motion.</p> <p>We are used to looking at awareness in human context only. Awareness appears to us as something very subjective and complex, but that may just be a human-centric perspective. It was the same human-centric perspective, which held that earth is at the center of the universe. If we look at awareness objectively, it is found to be intimately related to motion.</p> <p><strong> Motion and awareness seem to be aspects of each other.</strong></p> <p>Atoms consist of motion and an effect of that are the properties expressed in the periodic table. This motion in atoms is also atomic awareness. Simple motion associated with electromagnetic waves leads to simple properties. This represents simple awareness. Extremely complex motion associated with human configuration leads to complex properties. This represents complex awareness that we are intimately familiar with.</p> <p><strong>The properties of animated organisms and inanimate objects are an expression of the motion and awareness that they are composed of. </strong></p> <p>This is a very different take on awareness of which human awareness is a special case. If we move away from the narrow, human-centric view, we find that awareness is all around us.</p> <p><strong>The universe is imbued with motion, and thus, it is imbued with awareness.</strong></p> <p><a href="http://vinaire.me/2014/12/13/what-is-awareness-scientifically/" rel="nofollow"><b>What is Awareness, Scientifically?</b></a><br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329986"> 		<div id="comment-329986"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/df446e55d540b29e3179a8b84bcee235?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Letting go</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329986"> 				February 10, 2015 at 4:17 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329986#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329986", "329986", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Letting go'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>This would lead me to ask, is the planet or the ecosystem as a complex configuration on a much larger scale aware? Same for the universe. Is &#8220;it&#8221; aware or is this a human-centric attempt to anthropomorphise the system of motion and forces we call universe?</p> <p>Would awareness be a property of relativity?</p> <p>If a person says &#8220;there is nobody there doing anything &#8211; everything is just what is happening&#8221;, would that express this perception?</p> <p>Why are we lost in fights of right view and wrong view? Why are they so intoxicating?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329992"> 		<div id="comment-329992"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329992"> 				February 10, 2015 at 5:17 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329992#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329992", "329992", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>From a scientific point of view, if there is motion then there is also awareness. </p> <p>This view is different from the human-centric view of awareness. </p> <p>Thus, this universe as a whole is aware. Human awareness is a small but complex part of this overall awareness. </p> <p>Sent from my iPad </p> <p>&gt;</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329993"> 		<div id="comment-329993"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/df446e55d540b29e3179a8b84bcee235?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Letting go</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329993"> 				February 10, 2015 at 5:49 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329993#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329993", "329993", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Letting go'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>So one could consider humans a certain &#8220;strata&#8221; of awareness and some more complex configurations (electromagnetism?) a more developed awareness?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330006"> 		<div id="comment-330006"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330006"> 				February 10, 2015 at 10:05 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330006#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330006", "330006", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Yes. That seems possible.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-spyrosillusionist even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-329962"> 		<div id="comment-329962"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1e3a3898eb06ac9bec55d9581e9d1dd4?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://spyrosillusionist.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Spyros</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-329962"> 				February 9, 2015 at 10:21 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=329962#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-329962", "329962", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Spyros'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>In my effort to clear up some differences that I&#8217;ve had in mind between how I view Scientology and how some others that I&#8217;ve known view it, so that people wont wish to destroy the whole thing, because of some parts of it, like they wouldnt -hopefully- wish to destroy a whole country because of some persons and some corrupt services and activities that occur inside it, I have made some indirect accusations from time to time and I apologise for that. To me it doesn&#8217;t matter whether one has a list of sins that written down would fill a whole skyscraper, I don&#8217;t think it is my business to point them out &#8211;no matter who that person is, that is. And I practice more than forgiveness, usually. I practice &#8216;what happened yesterday shouldn&#8217;t matter today&#8217;.</p> <p>I also don&#8217;t wish to tell people what to think, so as to invalidate their view of things. I only want to address people that think maybe they don&#8217;t know everything about the talked-about subjects, and wish to read about my view. I do not claim to speak any universal truth, it&#8217;s just my view. And I do not wish to play any PR game for or against SCN. I am totally indifferent with what is going to happen, with that matter of PR. I don&#8217;t have any appetite to go against anybody&#8217;s firm belief that Hubbard was a master brainwasher, nor that people like me are the reason why SCN got messed up. I only address people that want to communicate. I&#8217;m not in the game of creating positive nor negative impressions against other impressions.</p> <p>I started to write online because somebody or some people taunted me, that I couldn&#8217;t communicate without their approval &#8211;and it was about something important. But since I have resolved the matter inside me, and I know I can communicate indeed, I have no reason why I should be engaged into that particular game. I would only be willing to communicate to like-minded people that take it easy, for I don&#8217;t feel like fighting.</p> <p>I think people -no matter what faction they might belong in- could take it a bit easy, because most of the things we talk about, don&#8217;t exist in present time. And for many, never have existed, ever. This should go to all directions, as a light hearted advice, and not as an effort to stop things forcefully. I think a desire for revenge corrodes from inside, no matter the fair causes that might back that up &#8211;and of course, I&#8217;m talking generally, and not just about Scientology. If I wanted to be free from something, I would practice &#8216;F*ck it&#8217; or &#8216;let go&#8217;.</p> <p>So as not to talk about things totally irrelevant to the topic, I don&#8217;t feel any enforcement to study nor practice Scientology, and I haven&#8217;t done either in a long time. Still I think -if taken lightly, and if done willingly- it could be an interesting subject to get into. For me, it has much to do with personal interpretations and then personal application. Not few people have interpreted love and freedom as hate and war. And fortunately we are now -politically- at a point where we can make our choices for ourselves &#8211;unless &#8216;we&#8217; live in Iran or other countries with enforced and hardcore ideologies. I think there is room for even more freedom, like education could be more individual-based than society-based, &#8211;an individual should decide what to learn.</p> <p>I have also &#8216;moved on&#8217; to other stuff that are to a degree alligned with Scientology, but are other stuff, and they are noname. They are my stuff <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-tongue' title=':P'>:P</span> Still, I don&#8217;t have any sentiments about possibly negative or extremely negative past experiences in Scientology, as I don&#8217;t have any past hidden anywhere waiting to jump up and eat me. I could of course think of some past and make some sentiments, but what for? I preffer computer games. I had a purpose in the past to &#8216;awaken&#8217; others form what I considered negative in Scientology, but I only have one now to only share with those willing to share. I&#8217;m not going to pound anything to anybody. And by &#8216;share&#8217; I mean share how to be better, not what is wrong.</p> <p>Sorry for the long text. At least this time it wasn&#8217;t a rant <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-tongue' title=':P'>:P</span></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330003"> 		<div id="comment-330003"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">TheOracle</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330003"> 				February 10, 2015 at 9:00 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330003#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330003", "330003", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to TheOracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Yeah,I kind of feel the same way.  I am also grateful we have one another&#8217;s company, and for the pleasant conversations we manage. I used to imagine myself getting old,sitting on the front porch down in Miami of some old folks home, playing cards to keep myself amused.  A bottle of Jim Beam in my house robe pocket. </p> <p>Look at the lot of us. We aren&#8217;t getting any younger and here we are, talking all about such interesting things instead of playing Bingo. Still looking for clues at a crime scene. Time is being good to us. Life is being good to us.  Most of the people we know, are being good to us.</p> <p>It&#8217;s going to be a great summer!</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330007"> 		<div id="comment-330007"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330007"> 				February 10, 2015 at 10:07 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330007#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330007", "330007", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to marildi'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>You and Spyros are both on such a great roll! It&#8217;s soo trippy. </p> <p><span class='embed-youtube' style='text-align:center; display: block;'><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='500' height='312' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/2Z6YyWe46nc?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' frameborder='0' allowfullscreen='true'></iframe></span></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330174"> 		<div id="comment-330174"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/62094ea8485520b990be9f9d0dd38dd2?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://gravatar.com/oraclemysticism' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>The Oracle</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330174"> 				February 16, 2015 at 12:25 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330174#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330174", "330174", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to The Oracle'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thank you for the offering. Gratefully accepted.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330068"> 		<div id="comment-330068"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/43991e4301165e13efd8b0d02660357b?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">FG</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330068"> 				February 12, 2015 at 5:29 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330068#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330068", "330068", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to FG'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Yes Oracle&#8230; The best is to enjoy life, but one has to have a good health.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330062"> 		<div id="comment-330062"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330062"> 				February 12, 2015 at 9:54 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330062#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330062", "330062", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to christianscientology'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hi Spyros</p> <p>I enjoyed your post and it encouraged me to post the following:-</p> <p>About a week ago while eating my breakfast the words came to me “sue for peace”.  I did not know what they meant but they did seem familiar.  After Googling the expression I came across this book “Suing for Peach: a Guide for Resolving Life’s Conflicts”.  Having read the preview I ordered it from Amazon.</p> <p>Basically what it is saying is when we perceive that someone has taken our happiness away we react by taking away their happiness in the mistaken belief that in so doing we will regain our happiness.  However the other person now deeming his happiness has been taken away reacts by attempting to take away the other’s happiness.  This belief that another can take away our happiness seems to be what lies behind the overt-motivator sequence.</p> <p>I can only speak for myself but when I got involved in Scientology it was the happiest time of my life, so when I was expelled it was the most unhappy time of my life.  I could have easily become bitter and retaliated to what I perceived as unfair treatment, but instead I resolved to continue to investigate why I had been expelled.</p> <p>I can say now with comparative certainty that the main problem in the CofS is its inability to think outside the parameters of the technology of Scientology which produces an inability to see other viewpoints that apparently conflict with the Scientology paradigm. </p> <p>Over the years I have met enough fundamentalists to know one challenges their stable datum at one’s peril, for it is their stable datum from which they derive their happiness, and as the book I am recommending points out when our happiness is threatened our reaction is to attempt to restore it by taking away the other person’s happiness.  I don’t believe any sane person wants to see “Scientology at War” and I am confident by applying the principles in this book forgiveness can be achieved on both sides in any conflict.  Do look at the website <a href="http://www.jameskimmeljr.com/literary/suing-for-peace/" rel="nofollow">http://www.jameskimmeljr.com/literary/suing-for-peace/</a> </p> <p>Love with Understanding<br /> Pip</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-spyrosillusionist even depth-3 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330083"> 		<div id="comment-330083"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1e3a3898eb06ac9bec55d9581e9d1dd4?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://spyrosillusionist.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Spyros</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330083"> 				February 13, 2015 at 9:38 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330083#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330083", "330083", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Spyros'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thank you.</p> <p>I agree, it can become a vicious circle to seek revenge &#8211;specially from people that have nothing to do with the matter.</p> <p>I think if somebody tried to really harm me or something I care for, I would defend. But from then on to search for the person to take revenge doesn&#8217;t feel good to me. I think I would have to boil in my juice, from then on, to have a reason to take that revenge. In a way, I would attack myself.</p> <p>And beyond that I think that ethics and justice exist. And one who would harm continuously wouldn&#8217;t have a good time with it. Sometimes, some people&#8217;s &#8216;success&#8217; is only an image they project. </p> <p>Others might look upon such people for their being &#8216;successful&#8217; or &#8216;powerful&#8217;. But like the poem says if you lose yourself, you have lost everything.  </p> <p>I am not nice -if I am- so I will not get harmed back. I just feel the harming myself, and I don&#8217;t like it. </p> <p>We might not be &#8216;one&#8217; as beings, but there is a different kind of oneness, an all-encompassing dynamic.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology odd alt depth-4 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330131"> 		<div id="comment-330131"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330131"> 				February 14, 2015 at 4:20 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330131#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330131", "330131", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to christianscientology'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Thanks for your acknowledgement Spyros.  Yes the more I think of the insanity of thinking if someone has taken my happiness I can get it back by taking theirs, the more silly it seems.</p> <p>My family motto is WILLING EFFECT IS TOTAL CAUSE. To the degree I apply this to my life nothing and no-one can harm me.</p> <p>Yes! we might be &#8216;one&#8217; as beings but that is not the entirety of who we are, for we are both IN TIME and ETERNITY, both AL-ONE and ALONE.</p> <p>Love<br /> Pip</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-spyrosillusionist even depth-5 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330206"> 		<div id="comment-330206"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1e3a3898eb06ac9bec55d9581e9d1dd4?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://spyrosillusionist.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Spyros</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330206"> 				February 17, 2015 at 10:38 am</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330206#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330206", "330206", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Spyros'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Yes, I think I fully agree even if I used slightly different wording. </p> <p>I too lately found that the most important thing in Christinity is true for me too. </p> <p>Both in Scientology and in Christianity there are elements with which I disagree. And when it comes to the subject o spirit or God, it&#8217;s the same. I don&#8217;t really agree with Christ nor Mohamed. I once opened a quoran that somebody had left at some book exchange, in some random page explaining how to punish your wife right, and it really wasn&#8217;t my thing. Those punishments and sufferings are not my idea of spirituality. Nor is it to feel serene about anything you do. I think feelings could work as compass. And feeling like #$%$%$ could indicate something is not OK. </p> <p>My &#8216;basic&#8217; agreements with religions are agreements they themselves have with philosophies too.</p> <p>Most often I find movements talking about something I agree with, then adding stuff I really disagree with. So, I try to have things my own way, whether I partially agree with groups or not. I think, in spirituality, the core of what one looks for is inside.</p> <p>I understand atheists arguments too and most often I agree. </p> <p>I don&#8217;t think that if religions get wiped out, the world will be free -particularly brainwash-free- either. Proof is some past atheist countries. Brainwashing can come in many flavors, so long as there are people to sell and buy it.</p> <p>In any case, since there are also many beliefs and brainwashes of many flavors, I think we must -at least- respect each other&#8217;s views &#8211;without that meaning to agree with them. And respect those who respect. I would personally not respect one who would want to impose his views on me or a friend. But also I think it is a waste of time, for myself, to fight those who don&#8217;t intend to respect. </p> <p>Anarchists have the motto &#8216;No gods no masters&#8217;. I&#8217;m close, as I don&#8217;t want bosses above my head, but I keep my (own) spiritual stuff, and try to avoid unnecessary collisions. For anyway, fighting is a way to impose something, even if it is a fight-back, no?</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330663"> 		<div id="comment-330663"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330663"> 				February 24, 2015 at 9:46 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p><i>Spyros: &#8220;Generally speaking, I think the less vias, the better. And when it comes to the subject o spirit or God, it’s the same.&#8221;</i></p> <p>The two biggest vias are &#8220;I&#8221; and &#8220;God&#8221; in that order.<br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330742"> 		<div id="comment-330742"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330742"> 				February 27, 2015 at 4:07 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Interesting Vinaire!  The two that are not vias are the two that you see as the biggest. That is what the ONE TRUE GOD is and he has made you in his image.</p> <p>I often tell people “Jesus did not come to start a new religion, he came to restore a relationship”.  To invite us to let go of all our vias which is just another word for VIEWPOINTS and to realise we are not a view point but that which can assume a view point THE AWARENESS of AWARENESS.</p> <p>Atheism is just another viewpoint. I was a Christian early on, then gradually turned against. Now I balance it. Some big disagreements that I have with Christianity are that we must suffer on Earth to be rewarded in Heaven, that God is a judge, and a couple of passages I read that say that JC coaxed people to be respectful to their Earthly masters, like they would be towards God. Of course, it could be that JC never said such things. And that is very important, Like I think about some cases that LRH didn&#8217;t mean for SCN to be how it is, and that fanatic LRHers are as SCNists as fanatic crusaders were Christians. </p> <p>I have thought all that you wrote above too. But I&#8217;d rather not analyse God anymore, for I think words only alter it. I also think I&#8217;m not entitled to do it, and people should know for themselves, not through me nor others.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-christianscientology odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330882"> 		<div id="comment-330882"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/535874aa14b2cef0c4574543b07e8463?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">christianscientology</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330882"> 				March 3, 2015 at 12:09 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Hi Spyros</p> <p>Like you, before I met Jesus LRH was my &#8220;main man&#8221;. Like another would assume that I am an anti-Scientologist, for bad-talking TRs, Conan knows only a braiwashed scilon, or maybe an OSA, would ever say anything good about Hubbard, who&#8217;s been controlling all Scientologists subcosciously since &#8217;86 that he died and became a haunting ghost.  He even makes Conan mock and see himself in others like me. Too bad. I&#8217;m not to be trusted.</p> <p>If you ever really get to dislike fighting, and domination -not only the fighting and domination of others- let me know. </p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330475"> 		<div id="comment-330475"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/350d54331c090bcdace0f231815a0dd3?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">marildi</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330475"> 				February 21, 2015 at 9:01 pm</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>“If you ever really get to dislike fighting, and domination -not only the fighting and domination of others- let me know.”</p> <p>The thing I liked was that you weren’t easily dominated in that you objected to a misinterpretation of what you wrote. If you don&#8217;t want to call that &#8220;fighting&#8221;, fine.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire odd alt depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330486"> 		<div id="comment-330486"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330486"> 				February 22, 2015 at 6:21 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Do ideas have force that they can dominate?</p> <p>I think that an idea can dominate only when it fits consistently in a structure. However, it can dominate only within that structure. It may not dominate when considered in a larger structure where it creates inconsistency. That is the story of Scientology.</p> <p>To make Scientology right, one can always present it in a limited context. But the true test will always be of demonstrating consistency and harmony in a universal context.<br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-spyrosillusionist even depth-10 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330487"> 		<div id="comment-330487"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1e3a3898eb06ac9bec55d9581e9d1dd4?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://spyrosillusionist.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Spyros</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330487"> 				February 22, 2015 at 7:43 am</a> 					| 													</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Yes, it is fighting. I have fought too. I think whenever you assert that you know (or do, or other things) better than somebody, no matter what that is, no matter your good purposes, it is a kind of fighting for you assert the other person is somewhat incapable to know as good as you. It is not the same as to punch him, but it is fighting nevertheless. So now I wonder what is left for me to say, thinking that. I will let you know, if I find out <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-tongue' title=':P'>:P</span></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> </ul><!-- .children --> .children --> </li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-vinaire even depth-6 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330442"> 		<div id="comment-330442"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c743e7f3c77f15d38d8298be31d9780?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='http://vinaire.wordpress.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>vinaire</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330442#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330442", "330442", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to vinaire'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Prison of Belief comes from accepting a religion literally. It comes from blind acceptance of inconsistencies (cognitive dissonance) after suspending mindfulness.</p> <p>Christianity has wonderful lessons that one can learn from if one can only step around the inconsistencies that the Bible is filled with. Same thing can be said about Scientology, though there is precious little that is new and really useful in Scientology.</p> <p>If Scientology has its Xenu, then Christianity has its God as &#8220;creator.&#8221; The idea of &#8220;God as creator of the universe&#8221; is no less inconsistent than the idea of Xenu. If you can&#8217;t see that then you can&#8217;t.</p> <p>The word &#8220;God&#8221; has many meaning. One has to to work out the right meaning of &#8220;God&#8221; that is not inconsistent.  Here is how I see it.</p> <p><a href="http://vinaire.me/2010/10/29/can-god-be-defined/" rel="nofollow"><b>CAN GOD BE DEFINED?</b></a><br /> .</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- 	<li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330035"> 		<div id="comment-330035"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' on stalkers. Navigation through the only hole in the wall consists of closely emulating Hubbard and behaving as he did when he lived.</p> <p>  When the animals decided to establish schools they selected a school board consisting of Mr. Elephant, Mr. Kangaroo and Mr. Monkey, and these fellows held a meeting to agree upon their plans.<br />     “What shall the animals’ children be taught in the animal school? That is the question,” declared Mr. Monkey.<br />     “Yes, that is the question,” exclaimed Mr. Kangaroo and Mr. Elephant together.</p> <p>    “They should be taught to climb trees,” said the monkey, positively. “All my relatives will serve as teachers.”<br />     “No, indeed!” shouted the other two, in chorus. “That would never do.”<br />     “They should he taught to jump,” cried the kangaroo, with emphasis. “All of my relatives will be glad to teach them.”<br />     “No, indeed!” yelled the other two, in unison. “That would never do.”<br />     “They should be taught to look wise,” said the elephant. “And all of my relatives will act as teachers.”<br />     “No, indeed!” howled the other two together. “That will never do.”</p> <p>    “Well, what will do?” they asked, as they looked at each other in perplexity.<br />     “Teach them to climb,” said Mr. Monkey.<br />     “Teach them to jump,” said Mr. Kangaroo.<br />     “Teach them to look wise,” said Mr. Elephant.<br />     And so it was that none of them would yield, and when they saw there was no chance to agree, they all became angry and decided not to have any animal schools at all.</p> <p><a href="http://quoteinvestigator.com/2013/04/06/fish-climb/" rel="nofollow">http://quoteinvestigator.com/2013/04/06/fish-climb/</a></p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330070"> 		<div id="comment-330070"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/a1049d2528a46f6bd92dca4577fd768f?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href="http://www.aa.org/pages/en_US/daily-reflection" rel="nofollow">http://www.aa.org/pages/en_US/daily-reflection</a> reminded me once more of the moment I started to see Scientology for what it really is.</p> <p>Thirty Five years ago I heard a voice that said “you have sold your soul to the devil”.  If I had never been expelled from The Church of Scientology I would still be living under the delusion that I was Homo Novis (new man) and as the daily reading says “…… float above the rest of the folks on our brain power alone”.</p> <p>Change the word “alcoholism” for the word EGO and that was me.  “Even the most brilliant mind is no defence against the disease of Alcoholism (ego)”</p> <p>Love with Understanding<br /> Pip</p> <p>NOTHING IS WRONG WITH SCIENTOLOGY, THAT’S RIGHT, IT’S NOTHING THAT IS WRONG.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment Rathbun'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Revised 2/17 to correct sequence and add notes.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	</li><!-- #comment-## --> 	<li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330213"> 		<div id="comment-330213"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/49ed3747454eb55c10f4beccdb4fd4f6?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn"><a href='https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comments' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Conan</a></cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330213"> 				February 17, 2015 at 12:00 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330213#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330213", "330213", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Conan'>Reply</a>								</span><!-- .comment-meta .commentmetadata --> 		</div><!-- .comment-author .vcard --> 		 		<div class="comment-body"><p>Marty, thanks for the revision.</p> <p>The key to Scientology’s bamboozle is the hiding of its SOURCES, that is the principal trick Ron used to create the illusion of Omniscience and to project his Demi-God status.</p> <p>All other hypnotic tricks employed, build upon and reinforce the assumption that Ron created Scientology through preternatural insights into the nature of Reality. Once you know Hubbard’s sources, including his undisclosed intentions, the entire house of cards crumbles.<br /> A sleight of hand from a master hypnotist, as it creates a difference of potential between the Operator and its subjects, from whom commands can flow down and stick as memes.</p> <p>I and others have noted many times before that knowledge about the mind, its processes and phenomena has been extensively studied and recorded in the East for thousands of years.<br /> Particularly that Buddhism is the largest reservoir of knowledge on the subject.</p> <p>In the late 1800’s two major events occurred that advanced human thought in the West:</p> <p>One was the publishing of The Egyptian Book of the Dead and The Pyramid Texts which essentially revealed the source and history of Religion and Magic in the West and showed the three main monotheistic cults as emperors with no clothes.</p> <p>The other was the publishing of Buddhist and Vedic sacred texts, along with disseminating Yoga and meditation practices.</p> <p>The Theosophical Society had a big hand in syncretizing and popularizing both aspects of this ancient spiritual knowledge. See <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theosophical_Society" rel="nofollow">http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theosophical_Society</a></p> <p>Hubbard’s main source, Aleister Crowley was at the forefront of this movement and incorporated all of  this esoterica into his Thelema system. See <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A%E2%88%B4A%E2%88%B4" rel="nofollow">http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A%E2%88%B4A%E2%88%B4</a></p> <p>I think a must read for recovering Scientologists and others is Crowley’s Essay on Yoga, brilliantly written, you will see Hubbard’s “unique” insights into the mind plagiarized from Yoga, via Crowley.<br /> See <a href="http://hermetic.com/crowley/eight-lectures-on-yoga/" rel="nofollow">http://hermetic.com/crowley/eight-lectures-on-yoga/</a></p> <p>It is obvious to me that Scientologists lack the most basic common sense to be able to understand the processes involved in auditing, the similarities and differences between the various states induced by focusing attention on mental  objects, as done under Reverie, Meditative Absorption or under<br /> Hypnosis.</p> <p>Well, just remedy that ignorance and lift yourself up to be at par with Hubbard&#8217;s knowledge and hopefully exceed it.</p> </div>  	</div><!-- #comment-##  -->  	<ul class="children"> 	<li class="comment byuser comment-author-martyrathbun09 comment-author-is-site-member bypostauthor odd alt depth-2 highlander-comment" id="li-comment-330219"> 		<div id="comment-330219"> 		<div class="comment-author vcard"> 			<img alt='' src='https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/c2d94d163a566268e73c8b0195b6c03a?s=48&#038;d=identicon&#038;r=G' class='avatar avatar-48' height='48' width='48' /> 			<cite class="fn">Mark C. Rathbun</cite>  			<span class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 				| 				<a href="https://markrathbun.wordpress.com/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/#comment-330219"> 				February 17, 2015 at 1:53 pm</a> 					| 					<a class='comment-reply-link' href='/2015/02/03/scientology-beliefs/?replytocom=330219#respond' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-330219", "330219", "respond", "11823" )' aria-label='Reply to Mark C.
